content:
ゆみやはちまん〔弓矢八幡〕
〈名〉The God of War

content.content: 弓矢八幡誓って父の仇を討つ
I swear by the God of War that I will avenge my father.
弓矢八幡誓って本当だ(弓矢八幡ご照覧あれ)
Witness God of War that I speak the truth!

content:
ゆめ〔努〕
〈副〉Never; on no account

content.content: ゆめ忘るな
Never forget it!―Ever remember it!
ゆめ怠るな
On no account neglect it!
ゆめ人に洩らし給えそ
Never breathe a syllable of it to any one!

content:
ゆめ〔夢〕
〈名〉
1. A dream

content.content: 夢を見る
to dream―have a dream―dream a dream
死んだ人の夢を見た
I dreamed about a dead man.
自分が死んだ夢を見た
I dreamed that I was dead.
好い夢を見る
to have a good dream―dream a good dream
昨夜おかしい夢を見た
I had a funny dream last night.
僕は時々怖い夢を見る
I have fearful dreams―I am subject to fits of night mare.
栄華の夢を見る
to revel in prosperity
平家二十年の栄華の夢
The Tairas revelled in prosperity for a score of years.
清盛は高い一夜の夢を見た
Kiyomori had a night's dream which cost him dear.
夢に見る
to see anything in a dream―dream anything
あまり嬉しくて夢にまで見る
I see my happiness in my dreams―I dream my happiness.
毎晩夢に見る
I dream it every night.
夢にでも見たんだろう
You must have dreamed it.
夢に夢見し心地して
I lay in a trance.
夢かと思う(夢でないかと身をつねってみる)
I can not believe my eyes―I doubt the evidence of my senses―I can not realize my situation.
夢かとばかり悦んだ
I could scarcely credit the evidence of my senses.
親父の死に方があまり急でまるで夢のようでした
My father died so suddenly that I could not realize my situation.
夢にも思わなかった、夢にも知らなかった
I little dreamed―little thought―little knew.
君にここで逢おうとは夢にも思わなかった
I little dreamed of―little thought of―meeting you here.
こんなことをしようとは夢にも思わなかった
I little dreamed of―little thought of―doing such a thing.
こんなことになろうとは夢にも思わなかった
I little dreamed that―little thought that―things would come to this.
それが君であろうとは夢にも知らなかった
I little dreamed that―little knew that―it was you.
こんな物があろうとは夢にも知らなかった
I little dreamed of such a thing―I little knew of such a thing―This is a revelation to me.
そんな危険があろうとは夢にも知らなかった
I was quite unconscious of any such danger.
どんな物だか夢にも知らぬ
I have not the least idea of―have not the slightest idea of―have not the faintest idea of―have not the remotest idea of―what it is like.
科学の力でこんなことができようとは夢にも思わなかった
Such triumphs of science were never dreamed of.
かかる成功は夢にも望むべからず
You must not think of such a success―Such a success is not to be thought of―out of the question.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 夢か現{うつつ}か
Is this a dream or a reality?
夢にも現にも忘れぬ
I can not forget her waking or sleeping.
夢は逆さま
“Dreams go by contraries.”
夢が当たることがある
Dreams sometimes come true.
正夢{まさゆめ}
a true dream
夢は正夢であった
My dreams came true.
逆夢{さかゆめ}
a false dream
夢は逆夢であった
My dream turned out false.
嬉しい夢を結ぶ
to realize one's dream of love
夢を判断する
to interpret dreams―read dreams
一生を夢で暮らす
to dream away one's life
夢のようにうかうか月日を送っている
I pass my time as in a dream―I dream away my time.
浮世は夢、人生は夢の如し
Life is a dream.
夢は五臓の疲れ
Dreams are due to the fatigue of the internal organs.
痴人夢を説くが如し
It is a chimerical scheme―building castles in the air.
夢のお告げ
a revelation in a dream
夢のお告げがあった
It was revealed to me in a dream.

content: 5. (=睡眠)sleep

content.content: 夢が覚める
to awake from a dream―awake from sleep
夢を破る
to disturb one's repose―awaken one from sleep
門を叩く音に夢を破られた
I was awakened from sleep―roused from torpor―by a knocking at the door―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A loud knocking at the door awakened me from sleep―roused me from torpor.

content: 6. (=夢想、迷夢)a dream; a delusion; an illusion; a vision

content.content: 夢が覚める
to be disillusioned―be disenchanted―come to one's senses
放蕩息子はやっと夢が覚めたと見える
The prodigal son seems at last to have come to his senses.
夢が覚めなければ俺が覚ましてやる
I will bring him to his senses.
夢を覚ます
to bring one to one's senses―disillusion one―disenchant one
女の悪辣を見て夢が覚めた
Her villainy disillusioned me―disenchanted me.
青年時代の夢
the romantic visions of youth
空想家の夢
the dreams of a visionary

content:
ゆめあわせ〔夢合せ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ゆめはんだん〔夢判断〕

content:
ゆめうつつ〔夢現〕
〈名〉Trance

content.content: 夢現になる
to fall into a trance
彼は夢現で日を暮らしている
He passes his time in a trance.

ゆめさら〔夢更〕
〈名〉Not in the least; not at all; not a bit of it

content:
ゆめじ〔夢路〕
〈名〉Dream-land

content.content: 夢地をたどる
to sleep
夢地をたどる心地
I feel as if I were in Dream-land.

content:
ゆめじらせ〔夢知らせ〕
〈名〉A revelation in a dream

content.content: そういう夢知らせがあった
It was revealed to me in a dream.

content:
ゆめはんだん〔夢判断〕
〈名〉Dream-reading; oneiromancy

content.content: 夢判断をする
to read dreams―interpret dreams
夢判断師
a dream-reader―an oneirocritic

content:
ゆめまくらにたつ〔夢枕に立つ〕
〈自動〉To appear in a dream

content.content: 観音様が彼の夢枕に立った
The goddess appeared to him in a dream.

content:
ゆめみ〔夢見〕
〈名〉Having a good or bad dream

content.content: 夢見が好い、夢見が悪い
to have a good dream―have a bad dream

content:
ゆめゆめ〔努々〕
〈副〉Never; on no account whatever

content.content: ゆめゆめ人に洩らすな
Never breathe a syllable of it to any one!

ゆもと〔湯元〕
〈名〉The source of a hot spring

ゆや〔湯屋〕
〈名〉A bath-house; a public bath

content:
ゆゆしき〔由々しき〕
〈形〉Grave; serious

content.content: 由々しき大事
a matter of grave significance
由々しき天下の大事だ
It is a matter of grave significance to the State.

content:
ゆらい〔由来〕
〈名〉Origin; source; cause; derivation; history:(副詞に用いれば)originally:(=する) to originate (in something); to derive its origin, derive itself, be derived (from something)

content.content: (習慣などの)由来を尋ねる
to inquire into the origin of a custom―trace a custom to its origin
その由来を尋ねれば仏教より出でたるものである
On inquiring into its origin, we find that the custom comes from Buddhism―The custom is to be traced to Buddhism.
この習慣は仏教より由来する
The custom originated in Buddhism―derives its origin from Buddhism―derives itself from Buddhism―is derived from Buddhism.
英語にはラテンより由来する言葉が多い
Many English words are derived from Latin.
由来語
a derivative
この弊害の由来はここに存す
Herein lies the source of this evil.
その由来甚だ深し
The cause is very deep.
これには深い由来がある
It has a deep history.
その由来甚だ遠し
The origin is very remote.
君がキリスト教信者になった由来は(?)
How came you to be a Christian?
由来動植物は一つ物である
Animals and plants were originally one.

content:
ゆらぐ〔揺ぐ〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ゆるぐ〔揺ぐ〕

ゆらゆらする〔ユラユラする〕
〈自動〉To swing; to sway:(火炎なら)to flare

ゆらゆらする〔ユラユラする〕
〈自動〉To swing; to sway:(火炎なら)to flare

content:
ゆり〔百合〕
〈名〉The lily

content.content: 歩く姿は百合の花
She walks a lily.
百合の根
a lily bulb

ゆりいす〔揺椅子〕
〈名〉A rocking-chair

ゆりおこす〔揺り起す〕
〈他動〉To wake (one) by shaking; to shake (one) up; to shake (one) out of one's sleep

content:
ゆりかえし〔揺り返し〕
〈名〉An after-shock; a counter-shock

content.content: 揺り返しが来る
There will be an after-shock.

content:
ゆりかご〔揺籃〕
〈名〉A cradle

content.content: 揺籃を揺する
to rock a cradle
揺籃を揺すって子どもを寝かす
to rock a child to sleep

ゆりどこ〔揺床〕
〈名〉A swinging cot; a cradle

ゆりもくば〔揺木馬〕
〈名〉A rocking-horse

content:
ゆる〔揺る〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ゆれる〔揺れる〕

content:
ゆるい〔緩い〕
〈形〉
1. (=きついに対し)loose

content.content: 帯が緩い
The belt is loose.
結び目が緩い
The knot is loose.
腹が緩い
My bowels are loose.
緩い靴
loose-fitting shoes

content: 2. (=厳しいに対し、緩慢な)lax (discipline); lenient (punishment); slack (rein); easy (canter); slow (way)

content.content: 規律が緩い
The discipline is lax.
取り締まりが緩い
He controls with a slack hand.
人間が緩い
He has no strength of character―He has no backbone―He is a weak character―He needs winding up―He wants screwing up.
緩い勾配
a gentle slope―(鉄道なら)―an easy gradient
勾配の緩い屋根
a low-pitched roof
歩調が緩くなる
One's pace slackens.

ゆるがす〔揺がす〕
〈他動〉To shake (a house, etc.)

content:
ゆるかせ〔忽せ〕
〈名〉Negligence

content.content: ゆるかせにする
to neglect―slight
職務をゆるかせにする
to neglect one's duties―be neglectful of one's duties
仕事をゆるかせにするな
Do not slight your work!―scamp your work!―fudge your work!
学生は学問をゆるかせにしてはならぬ
A student must not neglect his studies―He must attend to his studies.
一字一句をゆるかせにするな
Do not slight a word or a phrase―Note well each word and phrase.

content:
ゆるがせ〔忽せ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ゆるかせ〔忽せ〕

content:
ゆるぐ〔揺ぐ〕
〈自動〉To shake

content.content: 家が揺るいだ
The house shook―I felt the house shake.
汽車が通ると家が揺るぐ
The house shakes when a train passes―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A passing train shakes the house.
風で家が揺るぐ
The wind shakes the house.
地震で家がひどく揺るいだ
The earthquake shook the house terribly.
地盤が軟らかいから家が地震で揺るぐ
The soft ground makes the house susceptible to earthquakes.

content:
ゆるし〔許し〕
〈名〉Permission; leave

content.content: 許しを乞う
to ask permission―beg leave
先生のお許しを乞うたか
Have you asked permission of your teacher?
許しを得た
I have permission―have leave―to do so.
外出の許しを得た
I have leave to go out.
許しを与える
to give one permission―give one leave―to do something
彼に外出の許しを与えた
I have given him leave to go out.
帰宅の許しを得た
I have leave to go home.
誰の許しを得て入ったか
By whose permission―On whose authority―did you enter the premises?

content:
ゆるし〔赦し〕
〈名〉Pardon; forgiveness; excuse

content.content: 赦しを乞う
to beg pardon
先生に赦しを乞うた
I begged pardon of my teacher.

content:
ゆるし〔免し〕
〈名〉
1. (=免除)excuse (from a task); exemption (from service); freedom (from obligations); release (from a promise); absolution (from a vow); remission (from a fee, etc.)
2. (=免許)permission; licence

content.content: 免し状
a permit―a licence

content: 3. (=放免)release; discharge; liberation; acquittal

ゆるす〔許す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=許可する)to permit (one to do something); to give (one) leave (to do something)

content.content: 生徒に外出を許した
I have permitted the students to go out―given them permission to go out―given them leave to go out.
親父は芝居へ行くことを許しません
My father will not permit me to go to the play.
そんな行動は許し難い
Such conduct is not to be permitted―impermissible.
その家へ出入りを許された
I have the entr?e of the house―have the run of the house.
彼の蔵書の閲覧を許された
He allows me the run of his library.
出獄を許す
to let one out of prison

content: 2. (=黙許する)to allow (one to do something); to tolerate (something)

content.content: 子どもに酒を飲むことを許さない
I do not allow the children to drink wine―I don't let them drink.
下駄にて昇校するを許さず
It is not allowed to enter the school in clogs.
この家には足踏みも許さぬ
You shall not set foot in the house.
働かぬ者には食事を許さぬ
Those who do not work, shall not eat.
それは国法の許さぬところだ
It is contrary to the laws―against the laws.
そんなことをしては良心が許さない
My conscience forbids my doing such a thing―It would go against my conscience to do such a thing.
仏教は他宗を許す
Buddhism tolerates other religions.

content: 3. (=事情が許す)to admit of, permit of, allow of (doing something)

content.content: 僕の洋行は事情が許さぬ
Circumstances do not admit of―permit of―allow of―my going abroad.
回答は延引を許さぬ
The answer admits of no delay.
この議論は答弁を許さぬ
The argument admits of no reply.
それは字句の許さぬ解釈だ
The words do not admit of such an interpretation―bear such a construction.
そんなぜいたくは財政が許さぬ
I can not afford such extravagance.
そんな物を買うことは財政が許さぬ
I can't afford to buy such things.

content: 4. (=習慣が許す)to sanction

content.content: この言葉は間違っているけれども習慣が許している
The expression is wrong, but sanctioned by usage.
そんなことをすると世間が許さぬ
The public will cry out against such conduct―If you do such a thing, you will lay yourself open to public censure―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such conduct will lay you open to public censure.
許さぬ関
social restraint
入場を許す
to admit one
女子児童は入場を許さず
Women and children not admitted―No admittance to women and children.
僕は入場を許されなかった
They refused me admission―I was refused admission.
入学を許す
to admit a student (into the school)
入会を許す
to admit a man (into membership)
庭園は一般公衆の縦覧を許す
The garden is open to the public.
(法廷で)傍聴を許す、傍聴を許さぬ
The court sits with open doors―sits with closed doors.
許せ
Grant house!
願いを許す
to grant one a request
保釈を許す
to grant bail―allow bail―admit one to bail
心を許す
to trust one―confide in one
七人の子を産むとも女に心を許すな
Trust no woman though she be the mother of your seven children.
心を許して人と付き合う
to take a man into one's confidence
二人は互いに心を許し合っている
They are in each other's confidence.
あの男に心を許すな
You must not trust that man―You must guard against him.
彼は人に心を許さない
He distrusts people.
女が男に心を許した
She trusted herself to the man―gave herself to the man.
女が男に肌を許した
She surrendered her chastity to him―sacrificed her honour to him―give herself to him―admitted his embraces.

content: 8. (=認める)to acknowledge; to allow

content.content: 彼は一世の学者をもって許されている
He is acknowledged as―allowed to be―the greatest scholar of the day.

content:
ゆるす〔赦す〕
〈他動〉(罪を赦して罰せぬ)to pardon:(恨まぬ)to forgive:(大目に見る)to excuse; to overlook:(放つ)to let (one) off

content.content: 罪を赦す
(法律上の罪なら)to pardon a crime―(天が人の罪悪を赦すなら)―remit one's sins―(過失なら)―forgive one (for) a fault―excuse one for a fault―overlook one's fault
将来は慎みますから今度だけはお赦し下さい
I will be more careful in future, so you will please pardon me―overlook my fault―for this once.
その罪赦し難し
He is unpardonable.
そうやすくは赦されぬ
I can't let you off so easily.
今度だけは赦してやる
I will let you off for this once.
君のような経験家がこんな失錯をしては許し難い
Such a blunder is inexcusable in a man of your experience.

content:
ゆるす〔免す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=免除する)to excuse (one from a task); to exempt (one from service); to free (one from obligations); to absolve (one from a vow); to release (one from a promise); to remit (one the fee)

content.content: 約束を免す
to release one from a promise
租税を免す
to remit one the taxes

content: 2. (=放免する)to release (a prisoner from prison); to discharge (a prisoner from custody); to acquit (one of the charge); to liberate (a prisoner); to set (one) at liberty; to set (one) free

ゆるみ〔弛み、緩み〕
〈名〉Slack; relaxation

content.content: 心に緩みができる
One's mind is relaxed.
続けて成功すると心に緩みを生ずる
Continued successes will relax one's mind.

content:
ゆるみ〔弛み、緩み〕
〈名〉Slack; relaxation

content.content: 心に緩みができる
One's mind is relaxed.
続けて成功すると心に緩みを生ずる
Continued successes will relax one's mind.

content:
ゆるむ〔弛む、緩む〕
〈自動〉To get loose; loosen; to slacken; to relax; to remint; to flag; to abate

content.content: 結び目が弛んだ
The knot has got loose.
腹が弛んだ
I have loose bowels.
気が緩む
One's attention is relaxed.
試験が済んで気が緩んだ
The conclusion of the examination has relaxed my mind.
忙しくて心の緩む暇が無い
Press of business keeps my mind on the stretch.
歩調が緩む
One's pace slackens.
熱心が緩んできた
His enthusiasm begins to flag―His enthusiasm begins to remit.
学期の終りになると生徒の熱心が緩む
The class flags towards the end of the term.
寒さが緩む
The cold abates.
痛みが緩んできた
The pain begins to remit.

content:
ゆるむ〔弛む、緩む〕
〈自動〉To get loose; loosen; to slacken; to relax; to remint; to flag; to abate

content.content: 結び目が弛んだ
The knot has got loose.
腹が弛んだ
I have loose bowels.
気が緩む
One's attention is relaxed.
試験が済んで気が緩んだ
The conclusion of the examination has relaxed my mind.
忙しくて心の緩む暇が無い
Press of business keeps my mind on the stretch.
歩調が緩む
One's pace slackens.
熱心が緩んできた
His enthusiasm begins to flag―His enthusiasm begins to remit.
学期の終りになると生徒の熱心が緩む
The class flags towards the end of the term.
寒さが緩む
The cold abates.
痛みが緩んできた
The pain begins to remit.

content:
ゆるめる〔緩める、弛める〕
〈他動〉To loosen (a rope); to unloose (a knot); to slacken (one's pace); to relax (one's attention); to unbend (the mind); to slacken, reduce, lessen (speed); to ease (the strain); to mitigate (punishment); to allay, alleviate, assuage (pain); to remit(one's efforts); to relieve (pain or suffering)

content.content: 帯を弛める
to loosen one's belt
手を弛める
to loosen one's hold
腹を弛める
to loosen the bowels
気を弛める
to relax one's attention―unbend one's mind
歩調を緩める
to slacken one's pace
速力を緩める
to slacken the speed―reduce the speed―lessen the speed―slow down―slow up―slow off
(船の)速力緩めー(号令)
Ease her!
罰を緩める
to mitigate the penalty
努力を緩める
to remit one's efforts―relax one's efforts
痛みを緩める
to allay the pain―alleviate the pain―assuage the pain―relieve the pain
手綱を弛める
to give a horse the reins―throw the reins to the horse
締めるところは締め、緩めるところは緩める
to be judicious

content:
ゆるめる〔緩める、弛める〕
〈他動〉To loosen (a rope); to unloose (a knot); to slacken (one's pace); to relax (one's attention); to unbend (the mind); to slacken, reduce, lessen (speed); to ease (the strain); to mitigate (punishment); to allay, alleviate, assuage (pain); to remit(one's efforts); to relieve (pain or suffering)

content.content: 帯を弛める
to loosen one's belt
手を弛める
to loosen one's hold
腹を弛める
to loosen the bowels
気を弛める
to relax one's attention―unbend one's mind
歩調を緩める
to slacken one's pace
速力を緩める
to slacken the speed―reduce the speed―lessen the speed―slow down―slow up―slow off
(船の)速力緩めー(号令)
Ease her!
罰を緩める
to mitigate the penalty
努力を緩める
to remit one's efforts―relax one's efforts
痛みを緩める
to allay the pain―alleviate the pain―assuage the pain―relieve the pain
手綱を弛める
to give a horse the reins―throw the reins to the horse
締めるところは締め、緩めるところは緩める
to be judicious

ゆるやか〔緩か〕
〈形〉
1. (=緩慢)lax (discipline); slack (hand or rein); easy (canter); slow (pace); gentle (slope)
2. (=寛大)generous (treatment); liberal (views); indulgent (parent); mild (punishment); lenient (with offenders)

content:
ゆるゆる
〈副〉→『

content.content: ゆっくり

content:
ゆるりと
〈副〉→『

content.content: ゆっくり

content:
ゆれる〔揺れる〕
〈自動〉To shake; to quake; to rock; to sway; to swing:(船が横に揺れるのは)to roll:(縦に揺れるのは)to pitch:(馬車などは)to jolt

content.content: 家が揺れた
The house shook―I felt the house shake.
汽車が通ると家が揺れる
The house shakes when a train passes―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A passing train shakes the house.
風で家が揺れる
The wind shakes the house.
地震で家がひどく揺れた
The earthquake shook the house terribly.
地盤が軟らかいから家が地震で揺れる
As the ground is soft, the house is susceptible to earthquakes.
船が左右に揺れる
A ship rolls.
船が前後に揺れる
A ship pitches.
船が前後左右にひどく揺れた
The ship rolled and pitched heavily―The ship laboured.
馬車がでこぼこの道を揺れながら走った
The carriage jolted over an uneven road.
木が嵐で揺れる
A tree sways in the storm―A tree is swayed by the storm.
揺籃は左右に揺れる
A cradle rocks from side to side.

content:
ゆわえる〔結える〕
〈他動〉To tie; to bind; to fasten

content.content: 紐をゆわえる
to tie the strings
紐でゆわえる
to tie with a string
縄を柱へゆわえる
to fasten a rope to a post

ゆわかし〔湯沸し〕
〈名〉A kind of kettle

content:
ゆわたおび〔岩田帯〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いわたおび〔岩田帯〕

content:
ゆんづえ〔弓杖〕
〈名〉Leaning on a bow

content.content: 弓杖突く
to lean on a bow

ゆんで〔弓手〕
〈名〉The left hand

content:
よ
〈呼び掛け〉O...!

content.content: 神よ
O God!
月よ、言うなかれ
O Moon! do not tell!

content: 〈命令法〉

content.content: 見よ
Look!
聴けよ
Hark!
起きよ
Get up!

content: 〈感嘆詞〉

content.content: その嬉しさよ
How glad I was!
その面白さよ
What fun it was!
そのおかしさよ
How funny it was!
落ちるよ
You will fall!

content:
〈強声詞〉
1. I tell you; I can tell you

content.content: 骨が折れるよ
It is hard work, I can tell you.
面白いことよ
I tell you, it is great fun.

content: 2. I should think; I should say; it would seem

content.content: 何かの間違いなんだろうよ
It must be some mistake, I should think.
まあそんなことだろうよ
That's about it, I should say.
あれでも学者なんだろうよ
He is a scholar, it would seem.
どうせそうでしょう
I expected that of your anyhow.

content:
よ〔世〕
〈名〉
1. (=世の中、浮世、世間)the world; the public; the society; life; men and things

content.content: 世を渡る
to walk through life
身をやつして世を渡る
to sail under false colours
世に出る
to go out into the world―start in life―get on in life―come to the front
彼はめでたく世に出た
He started in life under the fairest auspices―got a good start in life.
世に出て人にもまれる、世の荒浪にもまれる
to be buffeted by the world
世の荒浪に堪える
to stand the wear and tear of life
世にもまれなけりゃ人に成れぬ
The world will make a man of you.
世に処す
to deal with men and things―get on in life
世の辛酸を嘗める
to taste the sweets and bitters of life
世をはかなむ
to be sick of life―sick at heart
世をはかなむ人
a heartsick man
世ははかなきもの
How mutable is the world!―How transient is life!―Life is but a span.
世のはかなさ
the mutability of the world―the instability of human affairs
世のはかなさを思う
I muse on the mutability of human affairs.
世を厭う
to be weary of the world―pessimize
世を厭う人
a pessimist―a misanthrope
世を棄てる
to renounce the world―die to the world
彼は世を棄てている
He is dead to the world.
無常を感じ世を棄てて一生を慈善事業に委ねた
Sick of life, he renounced the world, and devoted his life to works of charity.
世に捨てられた
Society cast him forth―He was cast out from society.
天才は世に容れられぬ
Genius is not appreciated by the world.
世に容れられぬ人
an unappreciated genius
たいがいの人は世に忘れられてしまう
Most men sink into oblivion.
世を去る
to depart this life―go out of the world
世を早うする
to die young―die an early death―sink into an early grave
世を憚る
to fly the face of man
人は本分さえ尽くしておけば世に憚るところは無い
If I only do my duty, I can look the world in the face.
世を忍ぶ
to be in hiding―lie low―lie close―bury oneself in obscurity
世に名を売る
to make a name in the world
世に知られぬ人、世に現れぬ人
an obscure individual―a man of modest worth―a man unknown to fame
彼は世の事情に通じている
He is in touch with the world.
世の事情に疎い
He is out of touch with the world.
世は塵の世
It is a dusty world.
塵の世を避ける
to seclude oneself from the world―hold aloof from the crowd―live remote from towns
塵の世を避けて清き生涯を送っている
Remote from towns,―Aloof from the crowd,―“Far from the madding crowd's ignoble strife,”―he runs his godly race.
世の塵
worldly affairs
あさましき世の有様哉
What a wretched world it is!
これが世の常だ
That is the way of the world.
世を離れて閑静なところだ
The spot is secluded from the world.
味気無き世だ
It is a dreary world―a hollow world.
世の味気なさを知る
to awake to the stern realities of life
世を益す
to do good―bless mankind
あの学校は大いに世を益している
The school is doing much good―doing a great deal of good.
これは世を益する発明だ
It is an invention to bless mankind.
飛行機は世を益するものだ
The aeroplane is a public utility.
金は世を益する力ともなり世を害する力ともなる
Money may be a power for good or a power for evil.
世を驚かす
to do wonders
凡庸の才能でも忍耐さえあれば世を驚かすことができる
Perseverance will enable a man of ordinary ability to perform wonders.
世に従う
to swim with the stream―swim with the current―swim with the tide
世に逆らう
to swim against the stream―swim against the current―swim against the tide
世を圧する
to dominate over the world―domineer over the world
武力をもって世を圧したる二大強国も今や地上にその影をとどめず
The two mighty Powers, which dominated over the world by military power, have been wiped off the face of the earth.
世の物議をかもす
to give rise to a public controversy
世の反感を買う
to incur odium
彼はその不正事件に関係して世の反感を買った
He incurred the odium of the transaction―The transaction exposed him to odium.
世は文明に進む
The world advances in civilization.
世は相い持ち
Men must depend on one another―“Hand washes hand.”
彼が世に在りし時は家が栄えた
While he lived, his house prospered.
親父が世に在る間は大丈夫だ
We are safe while the old man is to the fore.
世に類無き
matchless―peerless―unequalled―unrivalled―unparallelled―incomparable―unique
世に類無し
It stands unrivalled in the world―It has no equal in the world―It is without a parallel―It is unique.
世に稀な品
a rare article
あのような学者は世に稀だ
Such scholars are rarely to the met with.
世の終り
the end of the world―(キリスト教にては)―the Day of Judgment―doomsday→『あのよ〔あの世〕』→『このよ〔此世〕』
旅は道連れ
Good company upon the road,
世は情け
And love to lighten life's load.

content: 2. (=時世)the age; the times

content.content: 世に後れる
to fall behind the times
彼は世に後れている
He is behind the times―out of touch with the times.
世と共に進む
to keep pace with the times―keep abreast of the times―move with the times
彼は旧弊家で世と共に進まぬ
He sticks in the mud―He is a stick-in-the-mud.
世に合う
to be in sympathy with the times
世に合わぬ
to be out of sympathy with the times―ahead of one's age
彼の考えは十年も進んでいるから世に合わないはずだ
His ideas are ten years ahead of his age.
世は変遷す
The times change.
世の変遷
the change of the times―the march of times
世が進むに従って人は賢くなる
Man grows in wisdom with the progress of the ages.
いつの世にも偉人はあったものだ
Great men have lived in all ages.
いつの世にも偽りの無いことは無かった
In no age was man free from falsehood.
この文明の世に生まれてそんなばかばかしいことは信じられぬ
Born in this age of civilization,―Born in this enlightened age,―I am above believing in such absurdities.
この日進月歩の世にありて進まざる者は退く
He who does not progress in this progressive age must retrograde.
世に媚びる
to truckle to the times―pander to the public
主義ある者は世に媚びず
A man of principles does not pander to the public.
世が世ならあんな奴らに頭を下げはせぬ
If I had my due, I should not cringe to such men.
泰平無事の世
the piping times of peace

content: 3. (=一生、生涯)life

content.content: 世を送る
to live―lead a life
幸福に世を送る
to lead a happy life―live a happy life
不幸に世を送る
to lead an unhappy life―drag out a miserable existence
人は額に汗して世を送る
Man must live by the sweat of his brow.
世を終る
to meet one's end―die

content: 4. (=御世、治世)reign; rule

content.content: 英国は Victoria の世に繁栄の極に達した
England was at the zenith of her prosperity in the reign of Queen Victoria.
日本は徳川の世に栄えた
Japan prospered under (the rule of) the Tokugawas.

content:
よ〔夜〕
〈名〉Night:(=の) nocturnal:(=に) at night; by night

content.content: 三日の夜に
on the night of the 3rd
夜になる
Night falls―Night comes on.
夜に入る
Evening sets in.
夜が明ける
Day breaks―Morning dawns.
今は何時に夜が明けるか
What time does day break?
もう夜の明けるのも間が無い
It will soon be daylight.
夜はほのぼのと明け渡る
Day is dawning.
夜が明けると銀世界
The day breaks on a world of silver.
夜の引き明けに
at break of day―at peep of day
女ならでは夜の明けぬ国
the land on which woman shines
女ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
Woman is the light of life.
君ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
You are the light of my life―the light of my eye―the light of the household.
夜を明かす
to pass the night
青天井で夜を明かした
We passed the night under the blue sky.
花を引いて夜を明かした
We played the night out.
夜を語り明かした
We talked the night away.
夜を徹する
to sit up all night―stay up all night
夜を徹して痛飲した
We caroused all night―made a night of it.
夜が更ける
Night advances.
夜が更けた
The night is advanced.
夜が深々と更け行く
It is the dead of night―It is the witching hour of night.
夜を更かす
to sit up till late―stay up till late
勉強して夜を更かす
to work till late at night
夜が長くなる、夜が短くなる
The nights are getting longer―The nights are getting shorter.
夜が長くなって日が短くなる、日が長くなって夜が短くなる
The night gains on the day―The day gains on the night.
冬は夜が長い
The nights are long in winter.
夏は夜が短い
The nights are short in summer.
夜に乗じて上陸した
We effected a landing under cover of night―under favour of night.
心配で夜の目も眠られぬ
Anxiety keeps me awake of nights.

content:
よ〔余〕
〈名〉(=他)the rest:(=の) other

content.content: 余は言うを要せず
The rest needs no telling.
余は想像に任す
The rest may be imagined.
余は推して知るべし
The rest may be inferred.
余の人々はいかがなり行きしか
What became of the other men?

content: 〈形〉(=以上)(and) odd; and more; and over:(前置詞に用いれば)over; above; more than; upwards of

content.content: 百余人
a hundred and odd men
五十余円
fifty odd yen
牛三十余頭
thirty odd head of cattle
一時間余待った
I have been waiting over an hour.
彼は十年余も洋行しておった
He stayed abroad for upwards of ten years.
三倍余
three times and more―three times and over

content:
よ〔余、予〕
〈代名詞〉I; (the royal) we

content.content: 余は存ぜぬ
We know not.

content:
よ〔余、予〕
〈代名詞〉I; (the royal) we

content.content: 余は存ぜぬ
We know not.

content:
よあかし〔夜明し〕
〈名〉Sitting up all night:(=する) to sit up all night; to stay up all night

content.content: あの時は皆夜明かしした
They were up all night.
本を読んで夜明かしする
to sit up all night over a book
夜明かしして普請を早くでかした
The house was finished quickly by working nights.

content:
よあがり〔夜上り〕
〈名〉Clearing at night

content.content: 夜上りだからこの天気は長くは持つまい
As it has cleared at night, the weather will not hold long.
夜上りの天気は持たない
The weather that clears at night, does not hold long.

よあきんど〔夜商人〕
〈名〉A night-hawker

content:
よあけ〔夜明け〕
〈名〉Daybreak; daylight; dawn:(=に) at daylight; at daybreak; at break of day; at peep of day; at dawn

content.content: 夜明けにはまだ間がある
We have some time before daylight.
夜明けにはもう間が無い
We are near daylight.
夜明け前に
before daylight
夜明け方に
towards daylight
一刻千秋の思いで夜明けを待った
We eagerly longed for day to break.

content:
よあそび〔夜遊び〕
〈名〉Pleasures of the night:(=する) to go out for pleasure at night

content.content: あの人は夜遊びする
He is a night-bird.

content:
よあるき〔夜歩き〕
〈名〉Going out at night:(=する) to go out a night

content.content: あの人は夜歩きする
He is a night-bird.

content:
よい〔宵〕
〈名〉Early evening

content.content: 宵にチラリと見たばかり
I only caught a glimpse of her early in the evening.
仲人は宵の内
The go-between's duties end with the ceremony.

content:
よい〔酔い〕
〈名〉Intoxication; drunkenness; tipsiness

content.content: 酔いがまわる
to become intoxicated―get drunk
酔いが醒める
to become sober
酔いを醒ます
to make oneself sober
寝て酔いを醒ます
to sleep oneself sober
寝ると酔いが醒める
You will sleep yourself sober―sleep away your debauch.

content: よい〔善い、好い、良い、宜い〕→『

content.content: いい〔善い、好い、良い、宜い〕

content:
』
〈形〉
1. Good:(副詞に用いれば)well

content.content: これは善い本だ
This is a good book.
好い酒だ
This is good wine.
たいそう好い子だ
She is as good as gold―worth her weight in gold.
好いことばかりは無い
We must take the evil with the good.
好いことは待ち遠しい
A good thing is a long time in coming.
好い物は得難い
Good things are hard to get―“The best fish swim near the bottom.”
あの人はどこが好いか
What (good) do you see in him?
好い子だから早くお寝なさい
Go to bed, there is a good boy―there is a good girl―there's a dear―that's a dear.
日本ほど好い国は無い
Japan is the best country in the world―the best land under the sun.
君は記憶が好いか
Have you a good memory?
彼は筆跡が好い
He writes a good hand.
彼は口は悪いが心は至って好い男だ
He has a foul tongue, but is, at bottom, a good fellow.
彼は人が好い
He is good-natured.
二人は仲が好い
They are on good terms with each other―great friends with each other.
あの人は様子が好い
He is good-looking.
亭主ぶりが好い
He plays the host well―hosts it well.
今日は気分が好い
I feel well today.
気持が好い
I feel that it is well with me.
好い後は悪い
“Every good has its evil.”

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉Nice (man); handsome (man); fine (woman or weather); fair (weather); pretty (face); sweet (smell or voice); agreeable (taste); bright (moon); favourable (answer)

content.content: 好い人だ
He is a nice man.
ほどが好い
He is an agreeable man―an amiable person.
好い男だ
He is a handsome man.
界隈切っての好い男
He is the handsomest man in the whole neighbourhood.
好い女だ
She is a fine woman―a fine girl.
今日は好い天気だ
It is fine weather―We have fine weather―today.
好い景色だ
It is a fine prospect.
この家は見晴らしが好い
The house commands a fine prospect.
あの娘は好い顔をしている
She has a pretty face.
あの子は声が好い
She has a sweet voice.
この花は匂いが好い
This flower smells sweet―This flower has a sweet smell.
この果物は味が好い
This fruit has an agreeable taste.
この馬鈴薯は風味が好い
These potatoes have an agreeable flavour.
好い月だ
There is a bright moon.
好い返事(色好い返事)が聞きたい
I am anxious for a favourable answer.
病気は好い方に向かった
His illness has taken a favourable turn―taken a turn for the better.
この本はたいそう好いように聞いている
I have heard much in favour of the book.

content: 3. (=めでたい)auspicious (occasion); happy (event); lucky (day)

content.content: 日が好い
The day is lucky.
好い日を選ぶ
to fix upon a lucky day
近い中に好い事がある
A happy event is expected.

content: 4. (=適当な)a fit, the proper, the right (man)

content.content: 誰かよい人は無いか
Can't you think of any fit person?
誰がよかろう
Who is the proper person?
この地位には彼がよかろう
He is fit for the post―the proper man for the post.
彼ならちょうどよい
He is the right man in the right place.
君はちょうどよいところへ来た
You have come at the right moment―You have come in the nick of time―You are just in time.

content: 5. (=何に好い)good for (something)

content.content: 運動は身体に好い
Exercise is good for the health.
風邪に好い薬は無いものか
Is there no medicine good for colds?―no remedy for colds?

content: 6. (=何の方が好い、より好い)better

content.content: これはあれより好い
This is better than that.
こっちが好い
This is the better of the two.
僕は洋服よりも和服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
日本人は洋服よりも羽織袴の方が好い
A Japanese looks to better advantage in his native costume than in foreign clothes.
彼は居ない方が好い
His room is better than his company―I prefer his room to his company.
好い方をお取りなさい
You may make your choice.

content: 7. (=一番好い)best

content.content: この本が一番好い
This book is the best of all.
一番好い物は何だろう
What is the thing in the world?
そうしたが一番に好い
That is the best way.
そうしたが一番に好いかと思った
I judged that to be the best course.

content: 8. (=何々するはよい)(It is) right, proper (to do so)

content.content: 場合によっては嘘をついてもよいものか
Is it right to tell a lie under some circumstances?
金を浪費するのはよくない
It is not right―wrong―to waste money.
君は先生の悪口を言うのはよくないぜ
It is wrong of you to speak ill of your teacher.

content: 9. (=何々するがよい)ought

content.content: 借りた物は返すがよい
You ought to pay what you owe.
その金を返せばよかったに
You ought to have paid the money.
そういう場合にはどうすればよいものか
What ought one to do in such a case?
彼に聞いてみたらよいだろう
You ought to ask him.
僕に相談すればよかったに
You ought to have consulted with me.
こう長く降ったからもう天気になってもよいわけだ
It ought to be fine after such a long rain.

content: 10. (=どうすればよい)(you) have only to (do so)

content.content: 明日までに返事をすればよい
You have to give an answer by tomorrow―You need not give an answer before tomorrow.
金は月末に返せばよい
You need not pay the money before the end of the month.
勉強さえすればよい
You have only to work hard.
断って入ればよいでしょう
I have only to ask permission to enter, haven't I?

content: 11. (=何々してもよい)(you) may; (I) will; (I) do not mind (doing so); I do not care if (I do so); (I) have no objection to (doing so)

content.content: そうしてもよろしい
You may do so―You are at liberty to do so―You are welcome to do so.
君は行ってもよい
You may go―You are liberty to go―I don't mind your going―I don't care if you go―I have no objection to your going.
僕も行ってもよい
I don't mind going with you―I don't care if I go with you―I have no objection to going with you.

content: 12. (=何々した方がよい)(I) would rather (do so); (you) had better (do so); (I) may as well (do so)

content.content: 恥を掻くくらいなら死んだ方がよい
I would rather die than live in dishonour.
降参するくらいなら死んだ方がよいと言って死んだ
Rather than surrender, he died.
君は自分で行った方がよいだろう
You had better go yourself―I would advise you to go yourself.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方がよかろう
You had better tell him the truth―I may as well tell him the truth.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方がよかったに
You had better have told him the truth.

content: 13. (=何々したのがよい)(you have) done well (in doing so)

content.content: 君は事実を打ち明けたのがよかった
You have done well in telling the truth.
君が来てくれてよかった
You have done well in coming―I am glad your have come.

content: 14. (=何々しなくともよい)need not

content.content: その金は返さなくともよい
You need not pay the money.
この本なら買わなくともよかった
You need not have bought the book.

content: 15. (=無くともよい)(can) do without; (can) spare

content.content: この金は当分無くともよい
I can do without the money for the present.
あの人は居なくもよい
We can do without him―He can be very well done without.

content: 16. (=もうこれでよい)to be enough; to want no more

content.content: 金はもうこれでい
The money is enough―I want no more money.
飯はもうこれでよい
I have had enough rice―No more, thank you.

content: 17. (=何でもよい)any

content.content: 何本でもよいから貸してくれ
Lend me any book.
何紙でもよいからくれ給え
Give me any paper.
いくらでもよいから貸してくれ給え
Lend me any sum.
その話は嘘でも本当でもよいから聞かせてくれ給え
Please tell me the story whether it may by true or not.

content: 18. (=それでよい)(that) will do

content.content: 今日はこれでよし
That'll do for today.
何でもよい
Anything will do.
何本でもよい
Any book will do.
どちらでもよい
Either will do.
明日でもよいか
Will tomorrow do?
いつでもよい
Any time will do.
五十円もあったらよいか
Will fifty yen do?
この室は僕の書斎によい
This room will do for my study.
この本は参考書にはよいが教科書にはよくない
This book will do for reference, but not for a text-book.

content: 19. (=そうならよい)I wish it were so.

content.content: 私は男ならよかった
I wish I were a man.
男に生まれりゃよかった
I wish I had been born a man.
君の病気が早く治ればよいが
I with you would get well soon.
彼は今度及第すればよいが
I wish he would pass this time.
待つ人が早く来ればよい
I wish he would come soon.
この家がもう少し大きけりゃよかった
I wish this house were a little larger.
僕は何かほかの専門を選べばよかった
I wish I had chosen some other profession.
早くその時になればよい
How I long for that time to come!

content: 20. (=何々しなけりゃよいが)I fear I shall; I am afraid he will

content.content: 今度落第しなけりゃよいが
I am afraid I shall fail this time.
彼は落第と聞いて発狂でもしなけりゃよいが
I fear lest he should go mad at the news of his failure.

content: 21. (=どうでもよい)I don't care; it does not matter

content.content: そんなことはどうでもよい
That is no matter―of no consequence.
そんなことはどうでもよいと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence.
成功しようと失敗しようとそんなことはどうでもよい

I don't care whether I succeed or fail―It does not matter whether I succeed or fail―Success or failure makes no difference to me―Success or failure is indifferent to me―Success or failure is all one to me.

content: 22. (=どうでもよいように)as one pleases

content.content: どうでもよいようにし給え
You may do as you please―as you think fit.
いくらでもよいと思召すだけ下さい
Give me whatever you think fit.
君のよいと思うようにし給え
You may do as you think fit―You may act at your discretion.

content: 23. (=どちらが善い、どちらが悪い)(which is) in the right; in the wrong

content.content: お前の方が悪い、弟の方が善い
Your are in the wrong; your brother is in the right.

content: 24. (=何で好い)nice and...

content.content: ここは涼しくて好い
It is nice and cool here.
あそこは温かで好い
It is nice and warm there.
家は高燥で好い
The house stands nice and high.
この汽車は速くて好い
This train is going nice and fast.
あの男は相撲にしたらいいだろう
What a wrestler he will make!
明日は速く来るのだぞ、よいか、わかったか
You come early tomorrow, mind!―mark my words!―d'ye hear?
間違いは間違いだがまあよいわ
It is a mistake. to be sure, but let it go!―let it pass!
酒や女は有っても無くてもよい
Wine and woman are indifferent to me―I am indifferent to wine or woman.
よいともよいとも
Certainly―With pleasure.
いいじゃないか、笑ったっていいじゃないか
Why not?―Why should I not laugh?
金がいくらかかったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the expense?―Hang the expense!
貰うさ、年が違ったっていいじゃないか
Take her―never mind the difference in age!
まあいいじゃありませんか
Are you going so soon?―Surely you can stay a little longer.
いい事がある
I tell you what.
いいところで逢った
I am glad to have met you.
いいところへ気が付いた
Well said!―It is a word in season.
いい物を拾った
See what I have found!
いい人でもできたかな
He has got a sweetheart, it would seem―She has got a chap, it would seem.
いい気味だ
Serve you right!
いい面の皮だ
Poor fellow!
いい年をして結婚でもあるまい
Marriage is not to be thought of at his age―at his time of life.
彼は金まわりがいいと見える
He seems to be flush of money.
彼は察しがいい、思い遣りがいい
He is considerate.
この魚は生きがいい
This fish is fresh―It looks rosy about the gills.
彼は酒の上がいい
He is merry over his cup.
あまりよくないのですがさし上げましょう
You shall have it, such as it is.
こんないいことはめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
たまには休みも好い
A holiday is quite a treat once in a while.
月三百円入りゃ好い
Three hundred yen a month is not bad.
この魚はどうしたのがいいか
How do you eat this fish?
この魚は煮たのが好い
I like this fish boiled.
この魚は焼いたのが好い
I like this fish broiled.
僕は洋服よりも日本服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
海の景色はいつ見ても好い
I never tire of looking out over the sea.
尺八はいつ聞いても好い
I never tire of listening to the shakuhachi.
シェークスピアはいつ読んでも好い
I never tire of reading Shakespeare.
天気が良ければ月曜に立つ
I leave on Monday, weather permitting.
僕の風邪はどうしても好くならない
I can't get over my cold.
この子はとうに学校へ出してもいい年だ
It is high time the boy should be put to school.
どうしたらいいだろう
What shall I do?―What is to be done?
何本を読んだらいいでしょう
What book shall I read?―What book do you recommend?
どうすればいいのだ
What do you wish me to do? What would you have me do?
どうしていいやら
I don't know what to do―I am at a loss how to act.
彼は死んだと言ってもいいくらいのものだ
He is all but dead―as good as dead―virtually dead―practically dead―to all intents and purposes a dead man.
及第してよかった
I am glad I have passed.
あの船で行かなくてよかった
It is a mercy I did not go in that ship.
金を持って来てよかった
It is lucky I have brought some money with me.
まずよかった
Thank Heaven!―I congratulate myself on my escape―Bless your star that you have escaped!

content: よい〔善い、好い、良い、宜い〕→『

content.content: いい〔善い、好い、良い、宜い〕

content:
』
〈形〉
1. Good:(副詞に用いれば)well

content.content: これは善い本だ
This is a good book.
好い酒だ
This is good wine.
たいそう好い子だ
She is as good as gold―worth her weight in gold.
好いことばかりは無い
We must take the evil with the good.
好いことは待ち遠しい
A good thing is a long time in coming.
好い物は得難い
Good things are hard to get―“The best fish swim near the bottom.”
あの人はどこが好いか
What (good) do you see in him?
好い子だから早くお寝なさい
Go to bed, there is a good boy―there is a good girl―there's a dear―that's a dear.
日本ほど好い国は無い
Japan is the best country in the world―the best land under the sun.
君は記憶が好いか
Have you a good memory?
彼は筆跡が好い
He writes a good hand.
彼は口は悪いが心は至って好い男だ
He has a foul tongue, but is, at bottom, a good fellow.
彼は人が好い
He is good-natured.
二人は仲が好い
They are on good terms with each other―great friends with each other.
あの人は様子が好い
He is good-looking.
亭主ぶりが好い
He plays the host well―hosts it well.
今日は気分が好い
I feel well today.
気持が好い
I feel that it is well with me.
好い後は悪い
“Every good has its evil.”

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉Nice (man); handsome (man); fine (woman or weather); fair (weather); pretty (face); sweet (smell or voice); agreeable (taste); bright (moon); favourable (answer)

content.content: 好い人だ
He is a nice man.
ほどが好い
He is an agreeable man―an amiable person.
好い男だ
He is a handsome man.
界隈切っての好い男
He is the handsomest man in the whole neighbourhood.
好い女だ
She is a fine woman―a fine girl.
今日は好い天気だ
It is fine weather―We have fine weather―today.
好い景色だ
It is a fine prospect.
この家は見晴らしが好い
The house commands a fine prospect.
あの娘は好い顔をしている
She has a pretty face.
あの子は声が好い
She has a sweet voice.
この花は匂いが好い
This flower smells sweet―This flower has a sweet smell.
この果物は味が好い
This fruit has an agreeable taste.
この馬鈴薯は風味が好い
These potatoes have an agreeable flavour.
好い月だ
There is a bright moon.
好い返事(色好い返事)が聞きたい
I am anxious for a favourable answer.
病気は好い方に向かった
His illness has taken a favourable turn―taken a turn for the better.
この本はたいそう好いように聞いている
I have heard much in favour of the book.

content: 3. (=めでたい)auspicious (occasion); happy (event); lucky (day)

content.content: 日が好い
The day is lucky.
好い日を選ぶ
to fix upon a lucky day
近い中に好い事がある
A happy event is expected.

content: 4. (=適当な)a fit, the proper, the right (man)

content.content: 誰かよい人は無いか
Can't you think of any fit person?
誰がよかろう
Who is the proper person?
この地位には彼がよかろう
He is fit for the post―the proper man for the post.
彼ならちょうどよい
He is the right man in the right place.
君はちょうどよいところへ来た
You have come at the right moment―You have come in the nick of time―You are just in time.

content: 5. (=何に好い)good for (something)

content.content: 運動は身体に好い
Exercise is good for the health.
風邪に好い薬は無いものか
Is there no medicine good for colds?―no remedy for colds?

content: 6. (=何の方が好い、より好い)better

content.content: これはあれより好い
This is better than that.
こっちが好い
This is the better of the two.
僕は洋服よりも和服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
日本人は洋服よりも羽織袴の方が好い
A Japanese looks to better advantage in his native costume than in foreign clothes.
彼は居ない方が好い
His room is better than his company―I prefer his room to his company.
好い方をお取りなさい
You may make your choice.

content: 7. (=一番好い)best

content.content: この本が一番好い
This book is the best of all.
一番好い物は何だろう
What is the thing in the world?
そうしたが一番に好い
That is the best way.
そうしたが一番に好いかと思った
I judged that to be the best course.

content: 8. (=何々するはよい)(It is) right, proper (to do so)

content.content: 場合によっては嘘をついてもよいものか
Is it right to tell a lie under some circumstances?
金を浪費するのはよくない
It is not right―wrong―to waste money.
君は先生の悪口を言うのはよくないぜ
It is wrong of you to speak ill of your teacher.

content: 9. (=何々するがよい)ought

content.content: 借りた物は返すがよい
You ought to pay what you owe.
その金を返せばよかったに
You ought to have paid the money.
そういう場合にはどうすればよいものか
What ought one to do in such a case?
彼に聞いてみたらよいだろう
You ought to ask him.
僕に相談すればよかったに
You ought to have consulted with me.
こう長く降ったからもう天気になってもよいわけだ
It ought to be fine after such a long rain.

content: 10. (=どうすればよい)(you) have only to (do so)

content.content: 明日までに返事をすればよい
You have to give an answer by tomorrow―You need not give an answer before tomorrow.
金は月末に返せばよい
You need not pay the money before the end of the month.
勉強さえすればよい
You have only to work hard.
断って入ればよいでしょう
I have only to ask permission to enter, haven't I?

content: 11. (=何々してもよい)(you) may; (I) will; (I) do not mind (doing so); I do not care if (I do so); (I) have no objection to (doing so)

content.content: そうしてもよろしい
You may do so―You are at liberty to do so―You are welcome to do so.
君は行ってもよい
You may go―You are liberty to go―I don't mind your going―I don't care if you go―I have no objection to your going.
僕も行ってもよい
I don't mind going with you―I don't care if I go with you―I have no objection to going with you.

content: 12. (=何々した方がよい)(I) would rather (do so); (you) had better (do so); (I) may as well (do so)

content.content: 恥を掻くくらいなら死んだ方がよい
I would rather die than live in dishonour.
降参するくらいなら死んだ方がよいと言って死んだ
Rather than surrender, he died.
君は自分で行った方がよいだろう
You had better go yourself―I would advise you to go yourself.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方がよかろう
You had better tell him the truth―I may as well tell him the truth.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方がよかったに
You had better have told him the truth.

content: 13. (=何々したのがよい)(you have) done well (in doing so)

content.content: 君は事実を打ち明けたのがよかった
You have done well in telling the truth.
君が来てくれてよかった
You have done well in coming―I am glad your have come.

content: 14. (=何々しなくともよい)need not

content.content: その金は返さなくともよい
You need not pay the money.
この本なら買わなくともよかった
You need not have bought the book.

content: 15. (=無くともよい)(can) do without; (can) spare

content.content: この金は当分無くともよい
I can do without the money for the present.
あの人は居なくもよい
We can do without him―He can be very well done without.

content: 16. (=もうこれでよい)to be enough; to want no more

content.content: 金はもうこれでい
The money is enough―I want no more money.
飯はもうこれでよい
I have had enough rice―No more, thank you.

content: 17. (=何でもよい)any

content.content: 何本でもよいから貸してくれ
Lend me any book.
何紙でもよいからくれ給え
Give me any paper.
いくらでもよいから貸してくれ給え
Lend me any sum.
その話は嘘でも本当でもよいから聞かせてくれ給え
Please tell me the story whether it may by true or not.

content: 18. (=それでよい)(that) will do

content.content: 今日はこれでよし
That'll do for today.
何でもよい
Anything will do.
何本でもよい
Any book will do.
どちらでもよい
Either will do.
明日でもよいか
Will tomorrow do?
いつでもよい
Any time will do.
五十円もあったらよいか
Will fifty yen do?
この室は僕の書斎によい
This room will do for my study.
この本は参考書にはよいが教科書にはよくない
This book will do for reference, but not for a text-book.

content: 19. (=そうならよい)I wish it were so.

content.content: 私は男ならよかった
I wish I were a man.
男に生まれりゃよかった
I wish I had been born a man.
君の病気が早く治ればよいが
I with you would get well soon.
彼は今度及第すればよいが
I wish he would pass this time.
待つ人が早く来ればよい
I wish he would come soon.
この家がもう少し大きけりゃよかった
I wish this house were a little larger.
僕は何かほかの専門を選べばよかった
I wish I had chosen some other profession.
早くその時になればよい
How I long for that time to come!

content: 20. (=何々しなけりゃよいが)I fear I shall; I am afraid he will

content.content: 今度落第しなけりゃよいが
I am afraid I shall fail this time.
彼は落第と聞いて発狂でもしなけりゃよいが
I fear lest he should go mad at the news of his failure.

content: 21. (=どうでもよい)I don't care; it does not matter

content.content: そんなことはどうでもよい
That is no matter―of no consequence.
そんなことはどうでもよいと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence.
成功しようと失敗しようとそんなことはどうでもよい

I don't care whether I succeed or fail―It does not matter whether I succeed or fail―Success or failure makes no difference to me―Success or failure is indifferent to me―Success or failure is all one to me.

content: 22. (=どうでもよいように)as one pleases

content.content: どうでもよいようにし給え
You may do as you please―as you think fit.
いくらでもよいと思召すだけ下さい
Give me whatever you think fit.
君のよいと思うようにし給え
You may do as you think fit―You may act at your discretion.

content: 23. (=どちらが善い、どちらが悪い)(which is) in the right; in the wrong

content.content: お前の方が悪い、弟の方が善い
Your are in the wrong; your brother is in the right.

content: 24. (=何で好い)nice and...

content.content: ここは涼しくて好い
It is nice and cool here.
あそこは温かで好い
It is nice and warm there.
家は高燥で好い
The house stands nice and high.
この汽車は速くて好い
This train is going nice and fast.
あの男は相撲にしたらいいだろう
What a wrestler he will make!
明日は速く来るのだぞ、よいか、わかったか
You come early tomorrow, mind!―mark my words!―d'ye hear?
間違いは間違いだがまあよいわ
It is a mistake. to be sure, but let it go!―let it pass!
酒や女は有っても無くてもよい
Wine and woman are indifferent to me―I am indifferent to wine or woman.
よいともよいとも
Certainly―With pleasure.
いいじゃないか、笑ったっていいじゃないか
Why not?―Why should I not laugh?
金がいくらかかったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the expense?―Hang the expense!
貰うさ、年が違ったっていいじゃないか
Take her―never mind the difference in age!
まあいいじゃありませんか
Are you going so soon?―Surely you can stay a little longer.
いい事がある
I tell you what.
いいところで逢った
I am glad to have met you.
いいところへ気が付いた
Well said!―It is a word in season.
いい物を拾った
See what I have found!
いい人でもできたかな
He has got a sweetheart, it would seem―She has got a chap, it would seem.
いい気味だ
Serve you right!
いい面の皮だ
Poor fellow!
いい年をして結婚でもあるまい
Marriage is not to be thought of at his age―at his time of life.
彼は金まわりがいいと見える
He seems to be flush of money.
彼は察しがいい、思い遣りがいい
He is considerate.
この魚は生きがいい
This fish is fresh―It looks rosy about the gills.
彼は酒の上がいい
He is merry over his cup.
あまりよくないのですがさし上げましょう
You shall have it, such as it is.
こんないいことはめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
たまには休みも好い
A holiday is quite a treat once in a while.
月三百円入りゃ好い
Three hundred yen a month is not bad.
この魚はどうしたのがいいか
How do you eat this fish?
この魚は煮たのが好い
I like this fish boiled.
この魚は焼いたのが好い
I like this fish broiled.
僕は洋服よりも日本服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
海の景色はいつ見ても好い
I never tire of looking out over the sea.
尺八はいつ聞いても好い
I never tire of listening to the shakuhachi.
シェークスピアはいつ読んでも好い
I never tire of reading Shakespeare.
天気が良ければ月曜に立つ
I leave on Monday, weather permitting.
僕の風邪はどうしても好くならない
I can't get over my cold.
この子はとうに学校へ出してもいい年だ
It is high time the boy should be put to school.
どうしたらいいだろう
What shall I do?―What is to be done?
何本を読んだらいいでしょう
What book shall I read?―What book do you recommend?
どうすればいいのだ
What do you wish me to do? What would you have me do?
どうしていいやら
I don't know what to do―I am at a loss how to act.
彼は死んだと言ってもいいくらいのものだ
He is all but dead―as good as dead―virtually dead―practically dead―to all intents and purposes a dead man.
及第してよかった
I am glad I have passed.
あの船で行かなくてよかった
It is a mercy I did not go in that ship.
金を持って来てよかった
It is lucky I have brought some money with me.
まずよかった
Thank Heaven!―I congratulate myself on my escape―Bless your star that you have escaped!
