content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉Nice (man); handsome (man); fine (woman or weather); fair (weather); pretty (face); sweet (smell or voice); agreeable (taste); bright (moon); favourable (answer)

content.content: 好い人だ
He is a nice man.
ほどが好い
He is an agreeable man―an amiable person.
好い男だ
He is a handsome man.
界隈切っての好い男
He is the handsomest man in the whole neighbourhood.
好い女だ
She is a fine woman―a fine girl.
今日は好い天気だ
It is fine weather―We have fine weather―today.
好い景色だ
It is a fine prospect.
この家は見晴らしが好い
The house commands a fine prospect.
あの娘は好い顔をしている
She has a pretty face.
あの子は声が好い
She has a sweet voice.
この花は匂いが好い
This flower smells sweet―This flower has a sweet smell.
この果物は味が好い
This fruit has an agreeable taste.
この馬鈴薯は風味が好い
These potatoes have an agreeable flavour.
好い月だ
There is a bright moon.
好い返事(色好い返事)が聞きたい
I am anxious for a favourable answer.
病気は好い方に向かった
His illness has taken a favourable turn―taken a turn for the better.
この本はたいそう好いように聞いている
I have heard much in favour of the book.

content: 3. (=めでたい)auspicious (occasion); happy (event); lucky (day)

content.content: 日が好い
The day is lucky.
好い日を選ぶ
to fix upon a lucky day
近い中に好い事がある
A happy event is expected.

content: 4. (=適当な)a fit, the proper, the right (man)

content.content: 誰かよい人は無いか
Can't you think of any fit person?
誰がよかろう
Who is the proper person?
この地位には彼がよかろう
He is fit for the post―the proper man for the post.
彼ならちょうどよい
He is the right man in the right place.
君はちょうどよいところへ来た
You have come at the right moment―You have come in the nick of time―You are just in time.

content: 5. (=何に好い)good for (something)

content.content: 運動は身体に好い
Exercise is good for the health.
風邪に好い薬は無いものか
Is there no medicine good for colds?―no remedy for colds?

content: 6. (=何の方が好い、より好い)better

content.content: これはあれより好い
This is better than that.
こっちが好い
This is the better of the two.
僕は洋服よりも和服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
日本人は洋服よりも羽織袴の方が好い
A Japanese looks to better advantage in his native costume than in foreign clothes.
彼は居ない方が好い
His room is better than his company―I prefer his room to his company.
好い方をお取りなさい
You may make your choice.

content: 7. (=一番好い)best

content.content: この本が一番好い
This book is the best of all.
一番好い物は何だろう
What is the thing in the world?
そうしたが一番に好い
That is the best way.
そうしたが一番に好いかと思った
I judged that to be the best course.

content: 8. (=何々するはよい)(It is) right, proper (to do so)

content.content: 場合によっては嘘をついてもよいものか
Is it right to tell a lie under some circumstances?
金を浪費するのはよくない
It is not right―wrong―to waste money.
君は先生の悪口を言うのはよくないぜ
It is wrong of you to speak ill of your teacher.

content: 9. (=何々するがよい)ought

content.content: 借りた物は返すがよい
You ought to pay what you owe.
その金を返せばよかったに
You ought to have paid the money.
そういう場合にはどうすればよいものか
What ought one to do in such a case?
彼に聞いてみたらよいだろう
You ought to ask him.
僕に相談すればよかったに
You ought to have consulted with me.
こう長く降ったからもう天気になってもよいわけだ
It ought to be fine after such a long rain.

content: 10. (=どうすればよい)(you) have only to (do so)

content.content: 明日までに返事をすればよい
You have to give an answer by tomorrow―You need not give an answer before tomorrow.
金は月末に返せばよい
You need not pay the money before the end of the month.
勉強さえすればよい
You have only to work hard.
断って入ればよいでしょう
I have only to ask permission to enter, haven't I?

content: 11. (=何々してもよい)(you) may; (I) will; (I) do not mind (doing so); I do not care if (I do so); (I) have no objection to (doing so)

content.content: そうしてもよろしい
You may do so―You are at liberty to do so―You are welcome to do so.
君は行ってもよい
You may go―You are liberty to go―I don't mind your going―I don't care if you go―I have no objection to your going.
僕も行ってもよい
I don't mind going with you―I don't care if I go with you―I have no objection to going with you.

content: 12. (=何々した方がよい)(I) would rather (do so); (you) had better (do so); (I) may as well (do so)

content.content: 恥を掻くくらいなら死んだ方がよい
I would rather die than live in dishonour.
降参するくらいなら死んだ方がよいと言って死んだ
Rather than surrender, he died.
君は自分で行った方がよいだろう
You had better go yourself―I would advise you to go yourself.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方がよかろう
You had better tell him the truth―I may as well tell him the truth.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方がよかったに
You had better have told him the truth.

content: 13. (=何々したのがよい)(you have) done well (in doing so)

content.content: 君は事実を打ち明けたのがよかった
You have done well in telling the truth.
君が来てくれてよかった
You have done well in coming―I am glad your have come.

content: 14. (=何々しなくともよい)need not

content.content: その金は返さなくともよい
You need not pay the money.
この本なら買わなくともよかった
You need not have bought the book.

content: 15. (=無くともよい)(can) do without; (can) spare

content.content: この金は当分無くともよい
I can do without the money for the present.
あの人は居なくもよい
We can do without him―He can be very well done without.

content: 16. (=もうこれでよい)to be enough; to want no more

content.content: 金はもうこれでい
The money is enough―I want no more money.
飯はもうこれでよい
I have had enough rice―No more, thank you.

content: 17. (=何でもよい)any

content.content: 何本でもよいから貸してくれ
Lend me any book.
何紙でもよいからくれ給え
Give me any paper.
いくらでもよいから貸してくれ給え
Lend me any sum.
その話は嘘でも本当でもよいから聞かせてくれ給え
Please tell me the story whether it may by true or not.

content: 18. (=それでよい)(that) will do

content.content: 今日はこれでよし
That'll do for today.
何でもよい
Anything will do.
何本でもよい
Any book will do.
どちらでもよい
Either will do.
明日でもよいか
Will tomorrow do?
いつでもよい
Any time will do.
五十円もあったらよいか
Will fifty yen do?
この室は僕の書斎によい
This room will do for my study.
この本は参考書にはよいが教科書にはよくない
This book will do for reference, but not for a text-book.

content: 19. (=そうならよい)I wish it were so.

content.content: 私は男ならよかった
I wish I were a man.
男に生まれりゃよかった
I wish I had been born a man.
君の病気が早く治ればよいが
I with you would get well soon.
彼は今度及第すればよいが
I wish he would pass this time.
待つ人が早く来ればよい
I wish he would come soon.
この家がもう少し大きけりゃよかった
I wish this house were a little larger.
僕は何かほかの専門を選べばよかった
I wish I had chosen some other profession.
早くその時になればよい
How I long for that time to come!

content: 20. (=何々しなけりゃよいが)I fear I shall; I am afraid he will

content.content: 今度落第しなけりゃよいが
I am afraid I shall fail this time.
彼は落第と聞いて発狂でもしなけりゃよいが
I fear lest he should go mad at the news of his failure.

content: 21. (=どうでもよい)I don't care; it does not matter

content.content: そんなことはどうでもよい
That is no matter―of no consequence.
そんなことはどうでもよいと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence.
成功しようと失敗しようとそんなことはどうでもよい

I don't care whether I succeed or fail―It does not matter whether I succeed or fail―Success or failure makes no difference to me―Success or failure is indifferent to me―Success or failure is all one to me.

content: 22. (=どうでもよいように)as one pleases

content.content: どうでもよいようにし給え
You may do as you please―as you think fit.
いくらでもよいと思召すだけ下さい
Give me whatever you think fit.
君のよいと思うようにし給え
You may do as you think fit―You may act at your discretion.

content: 23. (=どちらが善い、どちらが悪い)(which is) in the right; in the wrong

content.content: お前の方が悪い、弟の方が善い
Your are in the wrong; your brother is in the right.

content: 24. (=何で好い)nice and...

content.content: ここは涼しくて好い
It is nice and cool here.
あそこは温かで好い
It is nice and warm there.
家は高燥で好い
The house stands nice and high.
この汽車は速くて好い
This train is going nice and fast.
あの男は相撲にしたらいいだろう
What a wrestler he will make!
明日は速く来るのだぞ、よいか、わかったか
You come early tomorrow, mind!―mark my words!―d'ye hear?
間違いは間違いだがまあよいわ
It is a mistake. to be sure, but let it go!―let it pass!
酒や女は有っても無くてもよい
Wine and woman are indifferent to me―I am indifferent to wine or woman.
よいともよいとも
Certainly―With pleasure.
いいじゃないか、笑ったっていいじゃないか
Why not?―Why should I not laugh?
金がいくらかかったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the expense?―Hang the expense!
貰うさ、年が違ったっていいじゃないか
Take her―never mind the difference in age!
まあいいじゃありませんか
Are you going so soon?―Surely you can stay a little longer.
いい事がある
I tell you what.
いいところで逢った
I am glad to have met you.
いいところへ気が付いた
Well said!―It is a word in season.
いい物を拾った
See what I have found!
いい人でもできたかな
He has got a sweetheart, it would seem―She has got a chap, it would seem.
いい気味だ
Serve you right!
いい面の皮だ
Poor fellow!
いい年をして結婚でもあるまい
Marriage is not to be thought of at his age―at his time of life.
彼は金まわりがいいと見える
He seems to be flush of money.
彼は察しがいい、思い遣りがいい
He is considerate.
この魚は生きがいい
This fish is fresh―It looks rosy about the gills.
彼は酒の上がいい
He is merry over his cup.
あまりよくないのですがさし上げましょう
You shall have it, such as it is.
こんないいことはめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
たまには休みも好い
A holiday is quite a treat once in a while.
月三百円入りゃ好い
Three hundred yen a month is not bad.
この魚はどうしたのがいいか
How do you eat this fish?
この魚は煮たのが好い
I like this fish boiled.
この魚は焼いたのが好い
I like this fish broiled.
僕は洋服よりも日本服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
海の景色はいつ見ても好い
I never tire of looking out over the sea.
尺八はいつ聞いても好い
I never tire of listening to the shakuhachi.
シェークスピアはいつ読んでも好い
I never tire of reading Shakespeare.
天気が良ければ月曜に立つ
I leave on Monday, weather permitting.
僕の風邪はどうしても好くならない
I can't get over my cold.
この子はとうに学校へ出してもいい年だ
It is high time the boy should be put to school.
どうしたらいいだろう
What shall I do?―What is to be done?
何本を読んだらいいでしょう
What book shall I read?―What book do you recommend?
どうすればいいのだ
What do you wish me to do? What would you have me do?
どうしていいやら
I don't know what to do―I am at a loss how to act.
彼は死んだと言ってもいいくらいのものだ
He is all but dead―as good as dead―virtually dead―practically dead―to all intents and purposes a dead man.
及第してよかった
I am glad I have passed.
あの船で行かなくてよかった
It is a mercy I did not go in that ship.
金を持って来てよかった
It is lucky I have brought some money with me.
まずよかった
Thank Heaven!―I congratulate myself on my escape―Bless your star that you have escaped!

content: よい〔善い、好い、良い、宜い〕→『

content.content: いい〔善い、好い、良い、宜い〕

content:
』
〈形〉
1. Good:(副詞に用いれば)well

content.content: これは善い本だ
This is a good book.
好い酒だ
This is good wine.
たいそう好い子だ
She is as good as gold―worth her weight in gold.
好いことばかりは無い
We must take the evil with the good.
好いことは待ち遠しい
A good thing is a long time in coming.
好い物は得難い
Good things are hard to get―“The best fish swim near the bottom.”
あの人はどこが好いか
What (good) do you see in him?
好い子だから早くお寝なさい
Go to bed, there is a good boy―there is a good girl―there's a dear―that's a dear.
日本ほど好い国は無い
Japan is the best country in the world―the best land under the sun.
君は記憶が好いか
Have you a good memory?
彼は筆跡が好い
He writes a good hand.
彼は口は悪いが心は至って好い男だ
He has a foul tongue, but is, at bottom, a good fellow.
彼は人が好い
He is good-natured.
二人は仲が好い
They are on good terms with each other―great friends with each other.
あの人は様子が好い
He is good-looking.
亭主ぶりが好い
He plays the host well―hosts it well.
今日は気分が好い
I feel well today.
気持が好い
I feel that it is well with me.
好い後は悪い
“Every good has its evil.”

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉Nice (man); handsome (man); fine (woman or weather); fair (weather); pretty (face); sweet (smell or voice); agreeable (taste); bright (moon); favourable (answer)

content.content: 好い人だ
He is a nice man.
ほどが好い
He is an agreeable man―an amiable person.
好い男だ
He is a handsome man.
界隈切っての好い男
He is the handsomest man in the whole neighbourhood.
好い女だ
She is a fine woman―a fine girl.
今日は好い天気だ
It is fine weather―We have fine weather―today.
好い景色だ
It is a fine prospect.
この家は見晴らしが好い
The house commands a fine prospect.
あの娘は好い顔をしている
She has a pretty face.
あの子は声が好い
She has a sweet voice.
この花は匂いが好い
This flower smells sweet―This flower has a sweet smell.
この果物は味が好い
This fruit has an agreeable taste.
この馬鈴薯は風味が好い
These potatoes have an agreeable flavour.
好い月だ
There is a bright moon.
好い返事(色好い返事)が聞きたい
I am anxious for a favourable answer.
病気は好い方に向かった
His illness has taken a favourable turn―taken a turn for the better.
この本はたいそう好いように聞いている
I have heard much in favour of the book.

content: 3. (=めでたい)auspicious (occasion); happy (event); lucky (day)

content.content: 日が好い
The day is lucky.
好い日を選ぶ
to fix upon a lucky day
近い中に好い事がある
A happy event is expected.

content: 4. (=適当な)a fit, the proper, the right (man)

content.content: 誰かよい人は無いか
Can't you think of any fit person?
誰がよかろう
Who is the proper person?
この地位には彼がよかろう
He is fit for the post―the proper man for the post.
彼ならちょうどよい
He is the right man in the right place.
君はちょうどよいところへ来た
You have come at the right moment―You have come in the nick of time―You are just in time.

content: 5. (=何に好い)good for (something)

content.content: 運動は身体に好い
Exercise is good for the health.
風邪に好い薬は無いものか
Is there no medicine good for colds?―no remedy for colds?

content: 6. (=何の方が好い、より好い)better

content.content: これはあれより好い
This is better than that.
こっちが好い
This is the better of the two.
僕は洋服よりも和服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
日本人は洋服よりも羽織袴の方が好い
A Japanese looks to better advantage in his native costume than in foreign clothes.
彼は居ない方が好い
His room is better than his company―I prefer his room to his company.
好い方をお取りなさい
You may make your choice.

content: 7. (=一番好い)best

content.content: この本が一番好い
This book is the best of all.
一番好い物は何だろう
What is the thing in the world?
そうしたが一番に好い
That is the best way.
そうしたが一番に好いかと思った
I judged that to be the best course.

content: 8. (=何々するはよい)(It is) right, proper (to do so)

content.content: 場合によっては嘘をついてもよいものか
Is it right to tell a lie under some circumstances?
金を浪費するのはよくない
It is not right―wrong―to waste money.
君は先生の悪口を言うのはよくないぜ
It is wrong of you to speak ill of your teacher.

content: 9. (=何々するがよい)ought

content.content: 借りた物は返すがよい
You ought to pay what you owe.
その金を返せばよかったに
You ought to have paid the money.
そういう場合にはどうすればよいものか
What ought one to do in such a case?
彼に聞いてみたらよいだろう
You ought to ask him.
僕に相談すればよかったに
You ought to have consulted with me.
こう長く降ったからもう天気になってもよいわけだ
It ought to be fine after such a long rain.

content: 10. (=どうすればよい)(you) have only to (do so)

content.content: 明日までに返事をすればよい
You have to give an answer by tomorrow―You need not give an answer before tomorrow.
金は月末に返せばよい
You need not pay the money before the end of the month.
勉強さえすればよい
You have only to work hard.
断って入ればよいでしょう
I have only to ask permission to enter, haven't I?

content: 11. (=何々してもよい)(you) may; (I) will; (I) do not mind (doing so); I do not care if (I do so); (I) have no objection to (doing so)

content.content: そうしてもよろしい
You may do so―You are at liberty to do so―You are welcome to do so.
君は行ってもよい
You may go―You are liberty to go―I don't mind your going―I don't care if you go―I have no objection to your going.
僕も行ってもよい
I don't mind going with you―I don't care if I go with you―I have no objection to going with you.

content: 12. (=何々した方がよい)(I) would rather (do so); (you) had better (do so); (I) may as well (do so)

content.content: 恥を掻くくらいなら死んだ方がよい
I would rather die than live in dishonour.
降参するくらいなら死んだ方がよいと言って死んだ
Rather than surrender, he died.
君は自分で行った方がよいだろう
You had better go yourself―I would advise you to go yourself.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方がよかろう
You had better tell him the truth―I may as well tell him the truth.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方がよかったに
You had better have told him the truth.

content: 13. (=何々したのがよい)(you have) done well (in doing so)

content.content: 君は事実を打ち明けたのがよかった
You have done well in telling the truth.
君が来てくれてよかった
You have done well in coming―I am glad your have come.

content: 14. (=何々しなくともよい)need not

content.content: その金は返さなくともよい
You need not pay the money.
この本なら買わなくともよかった
You need not have bought the book.

content: 15. (=無くともよい)(can) do without; (can) spare

content.content: この金は当分無くともよい
I can do without the money for the present.
あの人は居なくもよい
We can do without him―He can be very well done without.

content: 16. (=もうこれでよい)to be enough; to want no more

content.content: 金はもうこれでい
The money is enough―I want no more money.
飯はもうこれでよい
I have had enough rice―No more, thank you.

content: 17. (=何でもよい)any

content.content: 何本でもよいから貸してくれ
Lend me any book.
何紙でもよいからくれ給え
Give me any paper.
いくらでもよいから貸してくれ給え
Lend me any sum.
その話は嘘でも本当でもよいから聞かせてくれ給え
Please tell me the story whether it may by true or not.

content: 18. (=それでよい)(that) will do

content.content: 今日はこれでよし
That'll do for today.
何でもよい
Anything will do.
何本でもよい
Any book will do.
どちらでもよい
Either will do.
明日でもよいか
Will tomorrow do?
いつでもよい
Any time will do.
五十円もあったらよいか
Will fifty yen do?
この室は僕の書斎によい
This room will do for my study.
この本は参考書にはよいが教科書にはよくない
This book will do for reference, but not for a text-book.

content: 19. (=そうならよい)I wish it were so.

content.content: 私は男ならよかった
I wish I were a man.
男に生まれりゃよかった
I wish I had been born a man.
君の病気が早く治ればよいが
I with you would get well soon.
彼は今度及第すればよいが
I wish he would pass this time.
待つ人が早く来ればよい
I wish he would come soon.
この家がもう少し大きけりゃよかった
I wish this house were a little larger.
僕は何かほかの専門を選べばよかった
I wish I had chosen some other profession.
早くその時になればよい
How I long for that time to come!

content: 20. (=何々しなけりゃよいが)I fear I shall; I am afraid he will

content.content: 今度落第しなけりゃよいが
I am afraid I shall fail this time.
彼は落第と聞いて発狂でもしなけりゃよいが
I fear lest he should go mad at the news of his failure.

content: 21. (=どうでもよい)I don't care; it does not matter

content.content: そんなことはどうでもよい
That is no matter―of no consequence.
そんなことはどうでもよいと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence.
成功しようと失敗しようとそんなことはどうでもよい

I don't care whether I succeed or fail―It does not matter whether I succeed or fail―Success or failure makes no difference to me―Success or failure is indifferent to me―Success or failure is all one to me.

content: 22. (=どうでもよいように)as one pleases

content.content: どうでもよいようにし給え
You may do as you please―as you think fit.
いくらでもよいと思召すだけ下さい
Give me whatever you think fit.
君のよいと思うようにし給え
You may do as you think fit―You may act at your discretion.

content: 23. (=どちらが善い、どちらが悪い)(which is) in the right; in the wrong

content.content: お前の方が悪い、弟の方が善い
Your are in the wrong; your brother is in the right.

content: 24. (=何で好い)nice and...

content.content: ここは涼しくて好い
It is nice and cool here.
あそこは温かで好い
It is nice and warm there.
家は高燥で好い
The house stands nice and high.
この汽車は速くて好い
This train is going nice and fast.
あの男は相撲にしたらいいだろう
What a wrestler he will make!
明日は速く来るのだぞ、よいか、わかったか
You come early tomorrow, mind!―mark my words!―d'ye hear?
間違いは間違いだがまあよいわ
It is a mistake. to be sure, but let it go!―let it pass!
酒や女は有っても無くてもよい
Wine and woman are indifferent to me―I am indifferent to wine or woman.
よいともよいとも
Certainly―With pleasure.
いいじゃないか、笑ったっていいじゃないか
Why not?―Why should I not laugh?
金がいくらかかったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the expense?―Hang the expense!
貰うさ、年が違ったっていいじゃないか
Take her―never mind the difference in age!
まあいいじゃありませんか
Are you going so soon?―Surely you can stay a little longer.
いい事がある
I tell you what.
いいところで逢った
I am glad to have met you.
いいところへ気が付いた
Well said!―It is a word in season.
いい物を拾った
See what I have found!
いい人でもできたかな
He has got a sweetheart, it would seem―She has got a chap, it would seem.
いい気味だ
Serve you right!
いい面の皮だ
Poor fellow!
いい年をして結婚でもあるまい
Marriage is not to be thought of at his age―at his time of life.
彼は金まわりがいいと見える
He seems to be flush of money.
彼は察しがいい、思い遣りがいい
He is considerate.
この魚は生きがいい
This fish is fresh―It looks rosy about the gills.
彼は酒の上がいい
He is merry over his cup.
あまりよくないのですがさし上げましょう
You shall have it, such as it is.
こんないいことはめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
たまには休みも好い
A holiday is quite a treat once in a while.
月三百円入りゃ好い
Three hundred yen a month is not bad.
この魚はどうしたのがいいか
How do you eat this fish?
この魚は煮たのが好い
I like this fish boiled.
この魚は焼いたのが好い
I like this fish broiled.
僕は洋服よりも日本服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
海の景色はいつ見ても好い
I never tire of looking out over the sea.
尺八はいつ聞いても好い
I never tire of listening to the shakuhachi.
シェークスピアはいつ読んでも好い
I never tire of reading Shakespeare.
天気が良ければ月曜に立つ
I leave on Monday, weather permitting.
僕の風邪はどうしても好くならない
I can't get over my cold.
この子はとうに学校へ出してもいい年だ
It is high time the boy should be put to school.
どうしたらいいだろう
What shall I do?―What is to be done?
何本を読んだらいいでしょう
What book shall I read?―What book do you recommend?
どうすればいいのだ
What do you wish me to do? What would you have me do?
どうしていいやら
I don't know what to do―I am at a loss how to act.
彼は死んだと言ってもいいくらいのものだ
He is all but dead―as good as dead―virtually dead―practically dead―to all intents and purposes a dead man.
及第してよかった
I am glad I have passed.
あの船で行かなくてよかった
It is a mercy I did not go in that ship.
金を持って来てよかった
It is lucky I have brought some money with me.
まずよかった
Thank Heaven!―I congratulate myself on my escape―Bless your star that you have escaped!

content:
よい〔余威〕
〈名〉Elation; intoxication

content.content: 戦勝の余威に乗じて独軍はパリを脅した
Elated with victory,―Intoxicated with victory,―Flushed with victory,―the Germans threatened Paris.

content:
よいかげん〔好い加減〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: いいかげん〔好い加減〕

よいくるう〔酔い狂う〕
〈自動〉To be raving drunk

content:
よいごし〔宵越し〕
〈名〉Keeping overnight:(=の) kept overnight:(=する) to keep overnight

content.content: この魚は宵越しができない
This fish will not keep overnight.
江戸っ子は宵越しの金を使わない
The Edokko will not keep his money overnight―He will not let tomorrow's sun rise on his earnings.

content:
よいこと〔好い事〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いいこと〔好い事〕

content:
よいざめ〔酔い醒め〕
〈名〉Recovery from intoxication

content.content: 酔い醒めの渇き
hot coppers
酔い醒めにまた酒を飲む
to cool one's coppers
酔い醒めの
How sweet water is to those
水の旨さを
Who wake up from a drunken doze,
下戸知らず
No teetotaller knows.

content:
よいっぱり〔宵張り〕
〈名〉(事)sitting up till late:(人)one who sits up till late

content.content: 彼は宵張りだ
He sits up till late.
宵張りの朝寝坊
He keep late hours―keeps bad hours.

よいつぶす〔酔い潰す〕
〈他動〉To leave (one's companion) under the table

content:
よいつぶれる〔酔い潰れる〕
〈自動〉To get dead drunk

content.content: 彼はいつも酔いつぶれるまで飲む
He always drinks himself dead drunk.

content:
よいどれ〔酔いどれ〕
〈名〉A drunkard

content.content: 酔いどれけがせず
Special Providence watches over drunkards.

content:
よいのくち〔宵の口〕
〈名〉Early evening

content.content: まだ宵の口だった
It was early in the evening.

よいのみょうじょう〔宵の明星〕
〈名〉The evening star; Hesperus

よいまつり〔宵祭り〕
〈名〉The eve of a festival:(殊に)Christmas eve

よいやみ〔宵闇〕
〈名〉Dark evening (before the moon rises)

content:
よいよい
〈名〉Locomotor ataxy; paralysis

content.content: 彼はよいよいだ
He is a paralytic.

content:
よいん〔余韻〕
〈名〉Suggestion; suggestiveness

content.content: 余韻の有る詩
a suggestive poem
この詩は余韻が有る
The poem is suggestive―full of suggestions.

content:
よう〔酔う〕
〈自動〉
1. To get drunk; to become intoxicated; to get tipsy:(わざとなら)to make oneself drunk

content.content: 酒に酔う
to get drunk (on wine)―drink till all's blue―yield to the influence of wine
ドイツ人はビールでは酔わぬ
A German can not get drunk on beer.
少しは飲んでもよいが酔ってはいかん
You may drink a little, but you must not make yourself drunk.
酔うほど飲んではいかん
You must not drink so much as to make you drunk.
彼は酔っている
He is drunk―intoxicated―tipsy―tight―in drink―disguised in drink―in liquor―the worse for liquor―in his cups―under the influence of wine.
だいぶ酔っている
He is far gone in drink.
酔って暮らすは人生の花
“Intoxication is the best of life.”
彼は酔うと冗談を言う
He is merry in his cups.
(あの相撲が負けたのは)酒にでも酔っていたのだろう
He must have been the worse for liquor.
彼は酒に酔ってそんなことを言ったのだろう
He must have said so under the influence of wine.
酔って倒れる、酔ってつぶれる
to drink oneself dead drunk―drink oneself to sleep
酔って倒れている
He is dead drunk―(西洋では)―He is under the table.
彼はいつも酔いつぶれるまで飲む
He always drinks himself dead drunk.
相手を酔いつぶす
to drink one's companion down―leave one's companion under the table
ベロベロに酔っている
He is fuddled with drink.
正体なく酔っている、たわいなく酔っている
He is drunk and incapable.
酔って管巻く
to talk incoherently in one's cups―drink oneself into incoherence
酔って本性を顕す
“Wine reveals the true man”―“The true man comes out in wine”―“The heart is seen in wine”―“There is truth in wine.”
飲んだ酒なら酔わずばなるまい
Why should not wine make me drunk?
タバコに酔う
to smoke oneself ill―(は英、米は)―smoke oneself sick
子どもはタバコに酔ったのだ
The boy is ill with smoking―sick with smoking.
君はまだタバコに酔うか
Does smoking still make you ill?
酔わなくなった
Smoking does not make me ill any longer.
船に酔う
to get seasick―make a sacrifice to the sea
船に酔った時は地を踏むとたちまち治る
When you are seasick, you feel well the instant you set foot on land.
君は船に酔うか
Do you get seasick?―Are you a good sailor?
僕は船に酔わない
I am a good sailor.
僕は船に酔って困る
I am a poor sailor―a fair-weather sailor.
誰でも始めは船に酔う
Everybody makes a sacrifice to the sea at first.
汽車に酔う人がある
Some people get train-sick.
鰹に酔う
to be poisoned by bonito
戦勝に酔う、成功に酔う
to be intoxicated with victory―elated with success
彼は成功に酔っている
He is intoxicated with success―Success has turned his head.
弁舌に酔う
to hang on one's words―hang on one's lips
聴衆は彼の弁舌に酔って聴いている
The audience hangs on his words―listen to him with rapt attention.
あの女優は見物を酔わせる
She takes the audience by storm.
花の香に酔える風
The air is faint with the scent of flowers.

content:
よう〔幼〕
〈名〉Infancy; childhood

content.content: 幼にして父母を失う
He lost both his parents in his infancy.
幼にして語学の才あり
He early showed an aptitude for languages.
幼にして世に出た
He was thrown upon the world early in life.

content:
よう〔曜〕
〈名〉The day of the week

content.content: 今日は何曜か
What day of the week is this?―What is the day of the week?

content:
よう〔様〕
〈名〉
1. (=様式)way; manner

content.content: このように
in this way―in this manner―like this―thus
何とも言いようが無い
There is no way of expressing it―It is unspeakable―unutterable.

content: 2. (=様子)appearance

content.content: 誰かいるようだ
Somebody appears to be there.
彼は正直なようだ
He seems to be honest.

content: 3. (=種類)kind; sort

content.content: どのような植物か
What kind of plant?
どのような人か
What sort of a man?

content:
〈形〉
1. (=如き)like

content.content: 猿のようだ
He is like a monkey―He looks like a monkey.
あの人の伝を書いたら小説のようだろう
His life would read like a novel.

content: 2. (=な)like

content.content: その男は職人のような風体だった
He was dressed like a workman.
あの人は猿のような顔をしている
He looks like a monkey.
あのような人を見たことが無い
I never set eyes upon his like―the like of him.
まあそんなようなものさ
It is something like that―That's about the size of it.

content: 3. (=な)such as

content.content: 鷲や鷹のような猛禽は卵を多く生まぬ
Birds of prey, such as the eagle and the hawk, do not lay many eggs.
あの人のような勉強は稀だ
Such diligence as his is rarely to be met with.
貴様のような生意気な奴は嫌いだ
I hate such impertinent fellows as you are.
名誉を害するような悪口ではない
The remark is not such as to―of a nature to―injure one's reputation.

content: 4. (=な)kind of; sort of

content.content: その様な品は店に置きません
We do not keep articles of that kind―that kind of articles―such articles―in stock.
僕はその様な本を読まない
I do not read that sort of books―such books.
彼は才取りのようなものだ
He is a sort of middleman.
今度の校長はどのような人か
What sort of a man is the new principal?―What is he like?
善いような人だ
He is a good sort of a man.
彼は豚のような奴だ
He is a pig of a fellow.
山のような浪が頭の上から落ちかぶさって来た
A mountain of a wave came tumbling over me.
彼は仏様のような人だ
He is a saint of a man.
こんな玩具のような鉄砲で何が撃てるものか
What can you shoot with such a toy of a gun?

content: 6. (=な)in the nature of

content.content: 彼の歎願は命令のような歎願だ
His request is in the nature of a command.
そこには病院のようなものは無い
There is nothing there in the nature of a hospital.

content: 7. (=な)as if

content.content: 彼は何でも知っているようなことを言う
He talks as if he knew everything.
この子は大人のようなものの言いようをする
The child takes as if he were a man―The child talks like a man.
我が家には金の茶釜でもあるようなことを言う
He talks as if he had a mint of money.
君は身代を無くしたようなものだ
It is as if you had lost your fortune.

content: 8. (=な)a man of one's...

content.content: そんな失錯をしては君のような経験家には似合わぬ
Such blunder is not becoming in a man of your experience.
君のような学者がこんなことを知らないとは意外だ
I am surprised that a man of your learning should not know it.
彼のような財産家がそれっばかり出すとはひどい
It is a shame that a man of his means should give so little.

content: 9. (=な)not the man to...

content.content: 彼はそんなことをするような人じゃない
He is not the man to do such a thing.
一度の失敗に屈するような人じゃない
He is not the man to be daunted by a single failure.
あれは嘘をつくような子じゃない
He is not the boy to tell a lie―He is above telling a lie.

content: 10. (=な)might have...

content.content: 彼はお母さんのような女と結婚した
He married a woman who might have been his mother.
君は見て来たような話をする
You might have been there.

content: 11. (=な)to the effect that...

content.content: 彼は文法は要らぬというようなことを言った
He said something to the effect that grammar should be done away with.
なんでもそんなようなことを言った
He said something to that effect.

content: 12. (=な)as it were; in a manner

content.content: 彼は成人した赤ん坊のようなものだ
He is, as it were, a grown-up baby.
君は身代を無くしたようなものだ
You have, in a manner, lost your fortune.

content: 13. (=な)might as well... as...

content.content: あんな人を害そうとするのは太陽に石をぶっつけるようなものだ
You might as well throw a stone at the sun as try to injure such a man.
あの人に勧めるのは狼に説法するようなものだ
You might as well reason with the wolf as try to persuade that man.

content: 14. (=な)only to...

content.content: 彼は米国へ死にに行ったようなものだ
He went to America, only to die.
昼夜を分かたず働いたのも失敗するために働いたようなものだ
I laboured night and day, only to fail.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=に)like

content.content: 猿のように木登りする
He climbs like a monkey―(複数にすれば)―They climb like so many monkeys.
弟は僕のように朝寝坊でない
My brother is not a late riser, like me.
彼は木の葉のように浮く
He swims like a cork.
石のように沈む
He will sink like lead.
この様に
like this―thus―in this manner
どの様に
how?
どのように驚いたろう
How surprised he must have been!
僕のするようにし給え
Do as I do!
猿のように木登りする
He climbs as a monkey does―like a monkey.
彼はいつものように朝出かけた
He went out in the morning, as usual.
彼はもとのように勉強しなくなった
He has ceased to work hard as he used to.
世人はあの人を学者のように思っている
People regard him as a scholar.
彼は子どもを邪魔物のように思っている
He regards his children as so many encumbrances.

content: 3. (=に)as if

content.content: 鬼の首でも取ったように自慢する
He boasts as if he had killed a giant.
我が家には金の茶釜でもあるように大きいことを言う
He talks as if he had a mint of money.
彼は何でも知っているように大言する
He talks as if he knew everything.
雪のように白い
It is as white as snow.
烏のように黒い
It is as black as a crow.
妹は姉のように美しくはない
The younger sister is not so beautiful as the elder.
彼は君のように勉強しない
He does not work so hard as you do.
彼は親に孝行であったように君もに忠義だ
He is as loyal to his lord as he was dutiful to his father.

content: 5. (=に)so that (... may...); so as to...

content.content: 一番汽車に間に合うように早く起きた
I go up early so that I might be in time for the first train―so as to be in time for the first train.
寒くないように着物をたくさん着て来た
I have muffled myself up, so that I may not be cold―so as not to be cold.
失敗しないように勉強し給え
You must work hard, so that you may not fail―so as not to fail.
彼は死んだように聞いている
I have heard that he is dead.
彼が死んだように言い触らした
It was given out that he was dead.
世間では彼がまだ生きているように評判している
Rumour has it that he is still alive.
世間では彼を金持ちのように言っている
People say that he is rich―They represent him as being rich.

content: 7. (=に)to that effect.

content.content: 来られないなら来られないように言って寄越せ
If you can not come, drop me a line to that effect.
行くなら行くように言ってやるがよい
If you are going, you ought to write to that effect.

content: 8. (=に)to come to...; to fall into the way of...

content.content: (日本は戦勝に慣れて)戦報と言えば勝報だと思うようになった
People came to regard news of battle as news of victory.
(お前は男を嫌うけれども)いまにだんだん愛するようになる
You will come to love him―learn to love him.
彼は独りで飯が食えるようになった
He has fallen into the way of getting his own living.
彼を独りで飯の食えるようにしてやった
I have put him in the way of getting his own living.
日本は戦闘艦が造れるようになった
Japan has fallen into the way of building her own battleships.

content: 〈命令法〉

content.content: 弟をいつ伺わせましょうか? 明日に来るように
When shall my brother call on you?―Let him call tomorrow.
その人を通しましょうか? 暫く待つように
Shall I show him in?―Let him wait for a while.
暫く待つように申しました
I have told him to wait for a while.
明日来るように言いました
I have told him to come tomorrow.
万事不都合の無いように頼む
See that all is well!
お忘れ物の無いように
Please see that you leave nothing behind!
疎漏の無いように
See that due care is taken!
病人には相当の手当てをするように
See that the sick are properly cared for!
少しは飲んでもよいが、しかし酔わないように
You may drink a little, but see that you do not get drunk!
子どもらが花を取らないように
Take care that the children do not pluck the flowers!

content: 〈特例〉［注意］「様」を英語に訳さぬ場合がある。

content.content: 誰か来たようだ
There is some one at the door.
そういう人は無いようだ
There is no such man that I know of.
風呂が冷めないようにしてくれ
Keep the bath hot.
風邪をひかないように気を付け給え
Be careful not to take cold.
人を怒らせないようにし給え
Take care not to give offence.
なるべくそうするように致します
I will try and do so.
目に見えるようだ
I see it before my eyes.
金を泥溝{どぶ}へうちっゃるようなものだ
It is throwing money away―a sheer waste of money.
彼は嘘をつくような人間じゃない
He is above telling a lie.
彼らはたとい貧しくとも国を売るようなことはせぬ
Thought poor, they are above selling their country.
人に尊敬されるようになさい
You must make yourself respected.

content:
よう〔洋〕
〈名〉An ocean

content.content: 太平洋
the Pacific Ocean
大西洋
the Atlantic Ocean
インド洋
the Indian Ocean
北氷洋
the Arctic Ocean
南氷洋
the Antarctic Ocean
西洋
the West―the Occident
東洋
the East―the Orient
南洋
the South Sea Islands

content:
よう〔用〕
〈名〉
1. (=用事)business:(人に頼まれた用は)a commission

content.content: 用をする
to do one's business―attend to business
彼は用をしている
He is attending to business―He is engaged.
用がある
I have some business to attend to―I have something to do―I am engaged.
今手放されない用がある
I am particularly engaged just now.
君は何か用があるか
Have you any business to attend to?―Have you anything to do?―Are you engaged?
なにも用が無い
I have no business to attend to―I have nothing to do―I am not engaged―I am free.
用があって行かれない
Business prevents me from going.
用があって来られなかった
Business prevented my coming.
君にちょっと用がある
I want to speak to you a moment―I want you a moment.
私に何かご用ですか
What is your business with me?―What do you want with me?
僕に何かご用ですか
Do you want anything with me?―Do you want me?
お母さんがご用
Mamma wants you.
お座敷でご用
You are wanted in the parlour.
ご用の節は鈴をお鳴らし下さい
When you want me, please press the button.
どなたでもご用の節は私まで
If any one of you wants anything, let him say so to me.
田中に用があると言って下さい
Please tell Tanaka I want him.
用があったら呼んで下さい
Please call me if I am wanted.
僕に用というのは金でも貸してくれと言うのか
What can you want with me, unless you want to borrow money of me?
ご用は(?)
Will you state your business?―What are your commands?―(言い出しかねてる人に向かってなら)―Come to the point!
ほかにご用はありませんか
Have you any other commands?
主人は不在ですがご用なら私がお取り次ぎ致します
Master is out. If you have anything to say to him, please leave it with me.
ご用の方は差配まで
Please inquire at the agency.
今日は用があって来た
I have come on business.
ちと大事な用があって伺いました
I have called on particular business.
親父は商用で上京しました
Father has come to town on commercial business―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Commercial business has brought father to town.
用があって田舎の方へ行って来る
I am going into the country on business―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Business calls me into the country.
何用でおいでですか
On what business have you called?―(他動詞構文にすれば)―What business brings you here?―(略して言えば)―What are you here for?
用を達す
to do one's business―transact business―(人に頼まれた用なら)―execute a commission―do one a service―(使い歩きの用なら)―run errands―undertake messages
僕に一つ用を達してくれんか
Will you execute a commission for me?―do me a service?
小僧は用を達しに行きました
The boy has gone on an errand.
君は英語で用が達せるか、用がわかるか
Can you make yourself understood in English?
あの西洋人は日本語で用がわかります
He can make himself understood in Japanese.
下等動物は(言葉が無くとも)互いに用のわかる方法があるに違いない
The lower animals must have some means of making known their wants to one another.
人に用を頼む
to charge one with a commission―entrust one with a commission―give one a commission
用を済ます
to finish one's business―get quit of one's business
用を片づける
to despatch one's business―make an end of one's business

content: 2. (=目的)purpose; aim; end

content.content: 用を弁ずる、用が足りる
to answer the purpose―serve one's turn―do (the business)
この紙で用が足りる
This paper will answer the purpose―serve the purpose―serve my turn―This paper will do―serve―answer.
この箱で食卓の用が足りる
This box will answer the purpose of a table―serve the purpose of a table―serve for a table―do for a table.
この長椅子で寝台の用が弁ずる
This sofa will serve for a bed.
用が弁じました
I have gained my end―succeeded in my aim―managed the matter―The matter has been managed―The thing is done.
用が弁じない
I can not gain my end―I have failed in my aim―The matter can not be managed―The thing can not be done.
その人が不在で用が弁じない
The man is absent, and nothing can be done.
主人が不在でも君は用が弁ずるか、君で用がわかるか
Can you attend to my business?

content: 3. (=使用)use; service; disposal

content.content: 用に立つ
to be useful―of use―serviceable―of service―good for something
用に立たぬ
to be useless―of no use―good for nothing
どんな物でも使いようでそれぞれ用に立つものだ
Everything is useful in its place.
どんな人でも使いようでそれぞれ用に立つ
Every man is useful in his way.
この植物は何の用に立つか
Of what use is the plant?―What is it good for?
何かの用に立つか
Is it of any use?―good for anything?
何かの用に立つだろう
It must be of some use―good for something.
いつか用に立つこともあろうからどんなことでも覚えていた方がよい
You had better learn anything for some future use―for possible uses.
あの男は何の用にも立たぬ
He is quite useless―of no use at all―good for nothing.
日本紙はいろいろの用に立つ(種々の用に供せらる)
Japanese paper is put to various uses―It is used for various purposes―It serves various purposes.
ご用に立てる
to place anything at one's service―place money at one's disposal
何でもご入用の物はご用に立てます
I will place anything at your service―Anything you want is heartily at your service.
金はいくらでもご用に立てます
I will place any sum at your disposal.
用に堪える
to be fit for use―fit for service
この家はまだ用に堪える
This house is still fit for use.
船は古くて用に堪えぬ
The ship is old and unfit for service.
老耄{ろうもう}用に堪えず
He is decrepit and unfit for service.
この機械は丈夫にできているから荒い用に堪える
The machine is strongly made, and will stand rough usage.
この本は用が済んだ
I have done with the book.
ご用が済んだら返して下さい
Please return it when you have done with it.
家庭用
for household use
学校用
for school use
婦人用
for ladies' use

content: 4. (=用務)business; service

content.content: いつでもご用を承ります
I am always at your service―at your orders.
政府の御用
official business―government business
御用有之英国へ出張を命ず
You are ordered to England on official business.
彼は御用で洋行中だ
He is travelling abroad on official business―in the service of the government―under government orders.
彼は会社の用で旅行している
He is travelling in the service of the company―in the interests of the firm.
宮内省御用
Under the patronage of the Imperial Household.
宮内省御用洋服商
Tailors to the Imperial Household.
御用(!)
I arrest you in the name of the government―in the name of the law―(英国では)―In the King's name!―(軽く言えば)―You are my prisoner.

content: 5. (=註文)an order (to a tradesman)

content.content: 今日は何ぞご用は
Have you any order for me today?
雑貨店からご用を聞きに来ました
The grocer has sent for orders―The grocer's man has come for orders.
(多少にかかわらず)御用仰付け下されたし
We beg you will favour us with your orders―We solicit your custom.

content: 6. (=関係)concern; concernment

content.content: お前には用が無い
I have no concern with you―have no concernment with you―have nothing to do with you―have nothing to say to you.
そんな人間には用が無い
I will have nothing to do with such men.
そんなばかには用が無い
I have no concernment with such a fool.
君にはもう用が無い(君とは絶交する)
I will have nothing more to do with you―I have done with you.
そんな事件には用が無い
I will have nothing to do with such an affair.

content: 7. (=費用)expenses; expenditure

content.content: 用を節する
to save expenses―be frugal of expenditure

content: 8. (=用便)necessity of nature; calls of nature; offices of nature; relief of nature

content.content: 用を達す
to do one's needs―obey the calls of nature―ease nature―relieve nature―go to the W. C.

よう〔葉〕
〈名〉A leaf (of a plant); a sheet (of paper); a lobe (of the lungs or the liver); a plane (of an aeroplane)

content:
よう〔要〕
〈名〉
1. (=必要)need; necessity

content.content: 金の要は無い
I have no need of money―There is no necessity for money.
彼は邦語を学ぶの要がある
He needs to learn Japanese―He must learn Japanese.

content: 2. (=要点)the chief point; the main point; the essential point; the essence; the secret

content.content: 語学研究の要は練習にあり
Practice is the main thing―the great thing―in language-study.
要は時機を得るにあり
The chief point to be attended to is to seize the right moment.
立法の要は生命財産を保護するにあり
Protection of life and property is the essence of legislation.
富国の要は殖産にあり
The secret of national prosperity lies in the development of industries.
政府の要は国民をして堵に安んぜしむるにあり
The chief aim of government is to enable the people to live in peace.
軍人の行動は信義を要とす
Faith is the main thing in the conduct of a soldier.
問題解決の要はこの点にあり
The solution of the problem turns on this point.
要を摘む
to epitomize―summarize―sum up
要を得る
to be to the point
彼の文は簡にして要を得ている
His writings are brief and to the point.

content:
よう〔陽〕
〈名〉The male principle; the positive; light; openness

content.content: 陰と陽
male and female―positive and negative
陰に陽に僕を助けてくれた
He helped me in every possible way.
陰窮まって陽生ず
“The darkest hour is nearest the dawn.”
陽電気
positive electricity

content.content: 俑を作る
to create a bad precedent

content:

content.content: 彼は背中に癰を出した

content:
ようい〔容易〕
〈形〉
1. Easy; simple:(=に) easily; with ease; readily; with facility

content.content: 容易にできることだ
It is easily done―It can be done with ease.
事実は容易にわかった
The fact was easily ascertained―readily ascertained.
一国語を究めるのは容易なことではない
It is no easy task to master a language.
あの人は容易に面会ができる
He is easy of access―accessible to everybody.
容易に面会ができぬ
He is difficult of access―inaccessible to everybody.
そうすれば事が容易になる
That will simplify matters.
君が名を出せば事が容易に運ぶ
Your name will facilitate matters.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この薪は容易に燃えぬ
This wood will not burn―refuses to burn.
この戸は容易に開かぬ
This door will not open―refuses to open.
この栓が容易に抜けぬ
This cork will not come out―refuses to come out.
彼は容易に怒らぬ
He is slow to get angry―slow to anger.
猫は容易に死なぬ
A cat dies hard―“A cat has nine lives.”
彼は容易に金を返しそうもない
He seems in no hurry to pay me the money.
彼の病気は容易に治りそうもない
He seems in no hurry to get well.
容易ならぬ
grave―serious―alarming
事態容易ならず
The matter grows serious.
容易ならぬ事件だ
It is a serious matter―a matter of grave significance.
容易ならぬ病気だ
It is a serious illness―a grave illness.
容易ならぬ犯罪だ
It is a grave offence―a heinous crime.
容易ならぬ報に接した
I have heard alarming news.
敵は容易ならぬ奴だ
We have no common enemy to deal with.
かかりが容易でない
The expenses are heavy.
人民の負担は容易でない
The people's burden is not light.

content:
ようい〔用意〕
〈名〉
1. (=準備)preparations; arrangements:(=する) to prepare (for departure); to prepare oneself (for an examination); to make preparations (for a journey); to make arrangements (for starting a school); to get (dinner) ready

content.content: 用意はよろしいか
Are you ready?
用意はよろしい
I am ready.
出発の用意をせよ
Prepare for departure!―Get ready for departure!
出発の用意は好いか
Are you ready for departure?
いつでも出発のできるように用意しておれ
Be ready―Hold yourself in readiness―to start at a moment's notice!
試験の用意をする
to prepare oneself for the examination
生徒は試験の用意に忙しい
The students are busy preparing themselves for the examination.
試験の用意ににわか仕込みする
to cram up a subject for the examination
旅立つ用意をする
to make preparations for a journey
お祭りの用意をする
to make preparations for a festival
新年の用意をする
to make preparations for the New Year
開校の用意をする
to make arrangements for opening a school
会の用意をする
to make arrangements for a meating
食事の用意をする
to get dinner ready
食事の用意を命じた
I caused dinner to be prepared.
食事の用事ができました
Dinner is ready―(下女下男に言わせれば)―Dinner is served.
用意を整える
to make preparations―get everything ready
用意が整った

用意万端調っている、ちゃんと用意ができている
All is ready.
あらかじめ用意がしてあるのだ
All is prepared beforehand―It is all arranged―It is cut and dried.
何の用意も無しに演壇に立った
I ascended the platform without any preparation.
彼は用意周到なものだ
He prepares everything to the minutest details.
彼の議論は用意周到乗ずべき隙無し
He is armed at all points.
用意(!)
Ready!

content: 2. (=予備)provision:(=する) to provide (for the future―against accidents―oneself with money)

content.content: まさかの時の用意をしておかなけりゃならぬ

まさかの時の用意に金を貯えておいた

万一の用意をする

いざ鎌倉という時の用意に槍の錆びておらぬように
Keep your sword bright against the day of battle!
若いうちに老後の用意をする
Youth should provide against age.
少しは金の用意がある
I have provided myself with some money―I am provided with some money.
雨具の用意があるか
Are you provided with rain-gear?
娘がしてくれた用意の握り飯
This is a luncheon my daughter has provided for me.
来客の用意をする

content:
ようじ〔用事〕
〈名〉Business (to attend to)

content.content: 僕は用事がある
I have some business to attend to―I have something to do―I am engaged.
今用事があって手が放されぬ
I am particularly engaged just now.
君は何か用事があるか
Have you any business to attend to?―Have you anything to do?―Are you engaged?
何も用事が無い
I have no business to attend to―I have nothing to do―I am not engaged―I am free.
ほかに用事が無い
I have no other business to attend to―I have nothing else to do―I am not otherwise engaged.
ほかに用事がある
I have some other business to attend to―I have something else to do―I have other fish to fry―I am otherwise engaged.
もうここに居る用事が無い
I have no business to detain me.
今日は用事があって来ました
I have called on business.
ちと大事な用事があって
I have called on particular business.
父は用事があって上京しました
Father has come to town on business―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Business has brought father to town.
用事があって田舎の方へ行って来る
I am going into the countly on business―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Business calls me into the country.
どういう用事でおいでですか
What is the nature of your business?
用事を済ます
to finish one's business―get quit of one's business
用事が済んだ
I have finished my business―I am quit of my business.
用事を片づける
to despatch one's business―make an end of one's business

ようしゃ〔容赦〕
〈名〉
1. Pardon; forgiveness; excuse; mercy; forbearance:(=する) to pardon; to forgive; to excuse; to have mercy on (one)

content.content: 平にご容赦を
I humbly beg your pardon.
その罪容赦し難し
Your offence is not to be pardoned―unpardonable.
英語の拙いところはご容赦を願います
I beg you will excuse my poor English―I hope you will be charitable towards my poor English.
今後こんなことがあったら断じて容赦しませんよ
I will not put up with this sort of thing in future.
もう容赦はできぬ
I can't stand it any longer.
法律は誰彼を容赦せぬ
The law has no respect of persons―The law is no respecter of persons.
大夫は咽喉{のど}を痛めおりますればお聞き苦しいところは幾重にもご容赦を願います
As the performer has a sore throat, I beg you will listen to his defective performance with forbearance.
容赦無く
mercilessly―without mercy
犯人は容赦無く罰する
I will show the offenders no mercy―They shall be punished without benefit of clergy.
容赦無くやっつけろ、容赦無く殺してしまえ
Show them no mercy!―Give no quarter!
時は容赦無く経つ
Time has no mercy―Time knows no mercy.
彼は新作を容赦無く批評する
He criticizes new works without mercy―handles them without gloves.
容赦の無い批評
merciless criticism―unsparing criticism

content.content: 養生のために旅行に行く
I am about to start on a journey for the benefit of my health.
彼は養生のために海岸へ行っている
He has gone to the seaside for his health.
肉食は養生になる
Meat diet is good for the health―beneficial to health.
酒とタバコは養生に害あり
Wine and tobacco are bad for the health―injurious to health.
平生養生すれば病気にかからぬ
Be careful of your health, and you will escape illness.

recuperation

to recuperate (oneself)―recruit (one's health)

hygiene―sanitation―(食物の養生法)―regimen
養生になる食物

養生地

content:
ようじん〔用心〕
〈名〉
1. Caution; precaution; guard; vigilance; watchfulness; prudence; circumspection; heed; care:(=する) to beware (of errors); to guard against (errors); to be way (of making mistakes); to be cautious (of making mistakes); to caution oneself against (errors); to use caution; to take precautions against (fire); to be prudent, use prudence; to be circumspect, use circumspection; to be vigilant, use vigilance; to be watchful (against errors); to be alert; to take heed of (errors); to take care; to look out

content.content: ご用心(!)
Beware!―Take care! ―Have a care!―Look out!―Mind your eye!―Mind the helm!
足下ご用心
Mind your footing!―Be circumspect!
犬ご用心
Beware of the dog!
にせ物ご用心
Beware of counterfeits!
けがの無いようにご用心
Beware of accidents!―Guard against accidents!
用心にけが無し
Better err on the side of caution!
人に用心させる
to warn one against―caution one against―counterfeits
懐中物ご用心(西洋ではスリご用心)
Beware of pickpockets!―(は米、英は)―The public is cautioned against pickpockets.
火の用心
precautions against fire
火の用心をする
to take precautions against fire
火の用心なさりませ
Take care of the fire!
火事の後の火の用心
“The stable-door is shut after the horse is stolen.”
この誤りに陥らぬように用心せよ

Beware lest you should fall into this error!―Beware of this error!―Guard against this error!―Caution yourself against this error!―Be watchful against this error!―Take heed of this error!―(他動詞構文にすれば)―I must warn you against this error―caution you against this error―put you on your guard against this error.
あれは悪い人間だから用心し給え
You must beware of that man―take heed of that man―guard against that man―(他動詞構文にすれば)―I must warn you against that man―caution you against that man―put you on your guard against that man.
彼は用心して秘密などをしゃべらぬ
He is cautions of telling secrets―wary of telling secrets.
用心してものを言うものだ
You should speak guardedly―use guarded language―You should be guarded in your speech.
彼はいつも用心して(決して油断しない)
He is always on his guard―never taken off his guard―watchful―vigilant―alert.
病にかからぬ用心には節制が第一
Temperance is the best guard against disease.
用心厳重な人だ
He is a dragon of watchfulness―vigilance itself.
彼は用心家で過ちの無い若い者だ
He is a prudent young man.
彼は例の用心家だから容易に手を出さない
He holds back with his usual prudence.
よくよく用心あるべし
You can not be too cautious―You can not use too much caution.
何とか処置を施すのが当然の用心というものだ
Some measure ought, in common prudence, to be taken.
この機械は用心に用心して扱わなければならぬ
You must handle the instrument gingerly.
ここは用心が悪い
The place is unsafe―insecure.
戸締りをよくしないと用心が悪い
Fasten your doors with care, or things may go amiss o'-nights.

ようじんぶかい〔用心深い〕
〈形〉Cautious, wary, watchful, vigilant, alert, prudent, circumspect, heedful(person); jealous (watch, etc.)

ようじんぼう〔用心棒〕
〈名〉A ronin kept as a guard by a gambling boss

content:
ようす〔様子〕
〈名〉
1. (=事情、模様、形勢)(the state of) things; the state of matters; the state of affairs; the aspect of affairs; the phase of affairs; the complexion of affairs; the position of affairs; the situation of affairs; circumstances

content.content: 世間の様子が好い
Things look bright.
様子が悪い
Things look dark.
様子が好くなってきた
The state of things are mending―The state of things are improving―Things are taking a turn for the better―Things are taking a favourable turn.
様子が悪くなってきた
Things are taking a turn for the worse―Things are taking an unfavourable turn.
今の様子では事件がいつ片づくかわからん
In the present state of matters,―As matters now stand,―there is no saying when the affair will come to a settlement.
様子を窺う
to observe the state of things―see how the land lies―find out how the wind blows
様子を探る
to inquire into the state of affairs―see how the land lies―find out how the wind blows
内々様子を探ってみた
I inquired, in private, into the state of matters.
(僕は来たばかりで)この辺の様子がさらにわからない
I am quite a stranger here―I must grope my way among strangers.
君は土地の様子を知っている
You know the place―You are acquainted with the place―familiar with the place.
やっと様子がわかってきた
I now comprehend the state of things―I now see how the land lies.
夕飯を済まして町の様子を見に出かけた
Supper over, I went out to look about me.
ひと目でその場の様子を見て取った、一見して様子がスッカリわかった
I saw all―understood whole story―grasped the situation―at a glance.
始終の様子を聞きました
I have heard all about the affair.
隣り座敷で様子を聞きました
I overheard your talk in the next room.
十年ぶりで国へ帰ってみるとスッカリ様子が変わっておった
I went home after a ten years' absence, and saw all changed.
様子によってはそうしないものでもない
I may do so according to circumstances.
彼は満足している様子だ
He seems to be contented.
何か面倒がある様子だ
There seems to be some trouble.
この議案には反対がありそうな様子だ
The bill seems likely to be opposed in the House.

content: 2. (=容貌、風采、挙動)personal appearance; look; looks; air; manner; behaviour

content.content: その人はどんな様子の人か
What does he look like?
官吏のような様子の人だ
He looks like an official.
あの人は様子が好い
He is good-looking.
あの男は様子があやしい
He looks suspicious―There is a suspicious look about him.
彼は軍人らしい様子をしている
He has a military air.
愛嬌のある様子をしている
He has a genial manner.
女は取り乱した様子をしていた
She had a dishevelled air.
娘はしとやかな様子をしている
She has a graceful manner.
彼は平気な様子をして眺めている
He looks on with an unconcerned air.
若い女は艶な様子をする(しなをする)
A girl will put on airs and graces.
彼は様子が変だ(気でも違いはせんか)
He is strange in his behaviour―I fear for his reason.
その様子がハテ変だなと思った
His appearance struck me as strange.
胸に覚えのある様子が顔に現れている
His countenance shows that he is conscious of his guilt.
あの家の様子が気に入らぬ(極めて曖昧だ)
I don't like the look of the house.

content: 3. (=兆候)signs; indications ［注意］打ち消しのほかはいつも複数。

content.content: 暴風雨の来そうな様子がある
There are signs of―indications of―a coming storm.
嵐の来そうな様子が無い
There is no sign of―no indication of―a storm coming.
米は下がりそうな様子だ
There are signs that―indications that―rice will fall.
物価は下がりそうな様子が無い
There is no sign that―no indication that―the prices will fall.
彼の来そうな様子が無い
There is no sign of his coming.
泥棒が外から入った様子が無い
There is no sign of the house having been broken into.
病人の様子はどうか
How is the invalid?
病人の様子は好い方だ
His illness shows favourable signs.
病人の様子が好くなった
His illness has taken a turn for the better―taken a favourable turn.
病人の様子が悪い
His illness shows unfavourable signs.
病人の様子が悪くなった
His illness has taken a turn for the worse―taken an unfavourable turn.

content: 4. (=見た様子)effect

content.content: この絵は見た様子が好い
The painting has a good effect.
軍艦は電飾を施すと見た様子は何とも言われない
When a warship is illuminated, the effect is unspeakably beautiful.
ざっと見た様子、だいたいの様子
the general effect―tout ensemble

content:
ようすい〔用水〕
〈名〉(水道の水)service-water; city-water:(天水)rain-water (caught in a tank):(灌漑用水)water for irrigation

content.content: 用水設備(水道)
water-works
用水桶
a rain-water tank

content:

1. (=要る)to require; to want; to need; to demand; to ask; to call for; to deserve (notice); to take (time or men); must

content.content: 事急を要す
The matter requires haste―demands haste―asks haste―presses―The matter is pressing―urgent.
事秘密を要す
The matter requires secrecy―demands secrecy―asks secrecy―must be kept a secret.
この仕事は熟練を要する
The work requires skill―demands skill.
この問題は注意を要する
The question requires attention―demands attention.
ひと通りならぬ注意を要する
It deserves more than a passing notice.
この犯罪は厳罰を要する
The crime requires severe punishment―calls for severe punishment.
この病は早速治療を要する
The case requires prompt treatment―calls for prompt attention.
彼は未だ後見を要する
He wants looking after―(は英、米は)―needs looking after―(初歩英語にては)―must be looked after.
家は塗り替えを要する
The house wants painting―needs painting―must be painted.
この船を操縦するに幾人を要するか

英語を修めるには十年を要する

この仕事は時日を要する

入学志願者は中学卒業者たることを要す
Applicants for entrance must have finished the middle school.

憂慮するを要せず

助力を要せず

なんぞ助力を要せん

ようむ〔用務〕
〈名〉Business (to attend to)

content.content: 彼は用務を帯びて洋行した
He has gone abroad on business.
用務を果たす
to despatch one's business

content:
ようむ〔要務〕
〈名〉Important duty

content.content: 彼は要務を帯びて英国へ出張を命ぜられた
He is ordered to English on some important duty.

content:
ようむき〔用向き〕
〈名〉The nature of one's business

content.content: 彼は上京した用向きを決して言わない
He does not hint at the nature of the business which has brought him to town.

content:
ようめい〔幼名〕
〈名〉One's infant name

content.content: 幼名を牛若と言った
He was named Ushiwaka in his infancy.

content:
ようめい〔用命〕
〈名〉An order

content.content: 御用命の程願上候
We beg you will favour us with your orders―We request to be favoured with your orders―We solicit your patronage.
御用命次第即時御届け仕る可く候{ごようめいしだいそくじおとどけつかまつるべくそうろう}
We will deliver the goods immediately on receipt of your order.

ようめいがく〔陽明学〕
〈名〉The philosophy of Wang Yang-ming

content:
ようもう〔羊毛〕
〈名〉Wool:(=の) woollen

content.content: 羊毛を剪む
to shear a sheep
一回に剪み取った羊毛
a fleece

content:
ようもく〔要目〕
〈名〉Chief items; a syllabus

content.content: 講義要目
a syllabus of lectures

content:
ようやく〔漸く〕
〈副〉
1. (=漸々、段々)gradually; by degrees; little by little

content.content: 病人はようやく快方に赴く
The invalid is gradually getting well―picking up by degrees.
政界はようやく多事ならんとす
The political world begins to show signs of activity―We are on the eve of a busy political season.

content: 2. (=遂に)at last; at long last; at length; finally; now

content.content: 騒動がようやく静まった
The disturbance has subsided at last.
問題がようやく解決した
The matter is settled at last.
彼を幾度も訪ねて今日ようやく会った
I called on him several times, and at length saw him today.
彼はようやく卒業した
He has finished school at last.
幾度も幾度もやってようやく成功した
I tried again and again, till I finally succeeded.
ようやくわかった
Now I see.
彼が泥棒であったことがようやくわかった
I now find him to have been the thief.

content: 3. (=辛うじて)with difficulty; with much ado; barely; narrowly; just

content.content: ようやくのことで成功した
I have succeeded with great difficulty―with much ado.
彼はようやく目的を遂げた
He barely accomplished his purpose.
ようやく遁れた
He had a narrow escape―It was a close shave.
ようやく死を免れた
He barely escaped death―He narrowly escaped death―He was snatched from the jaws of death.
ようやく逃げて来た
I got off with much ado.
来会者はようやく百名に達した
The attendants barely reached a hundred.
彼はようやく当選した
He was elected by a bare majority.
彼はようやくその日を送っている
He makes a bare living.
(眠くて眠くて)ようやく目を覚ましておった
I kept awake with much ado―I had much ado to keep awake―It was all I could do to keep awake.
ようやく借金だけはせずにいる
I have much ado to keep out of debt―It is as much as I can do to keep out of debt―It is all I can do to keep out of debt.
彼らはようやく飢餓をしのいでいる
They have much ado to keep off starvation―It is all they can do to keep off starvation―They barely manage to keep the wolf from the door.
ようやく汽車に間に合った
I was just in time for the train.
給料は生活にようやく間に合う
My salary barely suffices for my living.
仕事をようやく済ました
I have just got my work finished.
議案がようやく両院を通過した
The bill barely passed both Houses.
ようやく雨露をしのぐだけのあばら屋です
It is a tumble-down cottage that will barely shelter you from the rain.
爪立ちになってようやく届く窓だ
You can just reach the window by standing on tiptoe.
僕はようやく天井に届く
I can just reach the ceiling.
彼はようやく十代を越したばかりだ
He is barely out of his teens―scarcely out of his teens.
瞳をこらしてようやく見える
You can just see it by straining your eyes.
ようやくできる
I can just manage it.
ようやくのことでできた
I have just managed it.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼はようやくのことで試験だけは通過する
He scrapes through his examinations.
ようやく一睡を貪った
I snatched a wink of sleep.
ようやくここまで漕ぎ付けた
I have struggled through somehow.
滑ったり転んだりしてようやく後へ付いて行った
I stumbled after him as best I might.

content: 〈接続詞〉Before

content.content: しばらくたってようやく事実がわかった
It was some time before the fact became known.
一年たってようやく全快した
It was a year before I got well.
二時間も待ってから彼はようやくやって来た
I had waited two hours before he appeared.
十二時打ってからようやく着いた
It was twelve before I arrived.

ようやくする〔踊躍する〕
〈自動〉To leap and dance

content:
ようよう〔揚々〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: いきようよう〔意気揚々〕

content:
ようよう〔洋々〕
〈形〉
1. (=果て無き)boundless

content.content: 洋々たる大海
the boundless waste of waters

content: 2. (=盛んな)grand

content.content: 春色洋々たり
Spring laughs.

ようよう〔要用〕
〈形〉Necessary; important; useful

content:
ようらん〔揺籃〕
〈名〉A cradle

content.content: 揺籃をゆすって子どもを寝かす
to rock a child to sleep
文明の揺籃
the cradle of civilization

ようりつ〔擁立〕
〈名〉Support:(=する) to support (a candidate)

ようりゃく〔要略〕
〈名〉A summary; an epitome; a compendium; an outline

ようりょう〔容量〕
〈名〉Capacity; content

content:
ようりょう〔要領〕
〈名〉The point (of a matter); the substance, the sum and substance (of a matter); the gist, the pith (of a matter)

content.content: これが事の要領である
This is the substance of the matter―the gist of the matter―the pith of the matter―the sum and substance of the matter.
要領を得る
to gain one's end―touch bottom―touch ground
もう要領を得た(目的を達した)
I have gained my end.
まだ要領を得ない(目的を達しない)
I am not there yet.
調査が要領を得た(確かな事実に触れた)
The inquiry has touched bottom.
談判が要領を得た(目鼻が付いた)
The negotiations have touched ground.
会議は要領を得ずにおわった
The conference led to no result―led to no end―led nowhere.
要領を得ている
to be to the point―relevant―pertinent
要領を得ない
to be nothing to the purpose―beside the purpose―beside the mark―irrelevant―impertinent
あの人の言うことは要領を得ている
He speaks to the point.
要領を得ないことばかり言っている
He says nothing to the purpose―He speaks beside the purpose.
彼の説明は実に要領を得ている(かゆいところへ手が届くようだ)
His explanations are quite to the point.
簡にして要領を得ている
It is brief and to the point.
彼の演説は簡単にして要領を得ている
His speech was brief and to the point.
要領を得た演説だ
It was a speech of pith and point.
要領を得ないことを言うならむしろ何も言わない方が好い
Better say nothing than nothing to the purpose.
あんな要領を得ない演説をするならかえって止した方がよかった
He spoke so little to the purpose that he had better have left it undone.
彼の演説は要領を得たようで得ない
His speech was point no point.
先方の回答はさらに要領を得ない
His answer is nothing to the purpose.
少々要領をえない
It is not quite to the purpose.
彼は要領を得ない返事ばかりする人だ
He will answer beside the purpose―answer beside the mark―give irrelevant answers―give impertinent answers―give evasive answers.
質問をしても要領を得ない
I am not satisfied.
君の言うことはいっこう要領を得ない
I can make nothing of what you say―I don't know what to make of your statement―I can't make head or tail of what you say.
要領を得ない男だ
I can make nothing of him―He is incomprehensible―He is a nondescript.
実に要領を得た(徹底した)男だ
He is a through-going man―There is no halfness about him.
あの人は要領を得ない中に要領を得ている
Want of character is his character.

ようれき〔陽暦〕
〈名〉The solar calendar

content:
ようろ〔要路〕
〈名〉
1. (=肝要な道路)an important road

content.content: 日本は世界交通の要路に当たる
Japan holds an important position in the communication of the world.
要路を扼す
to hold the passes―command the passes

content: 2. (=顕要な地位)an important position

content.content: 要路に立つ
to hold an important position―hold a position of trust
要路に立たせる
to place one in a position of trust
要路に立つ人、要路の顕官
men in authority―those high in authority―the powers that be

ようろ〔鎔炉〕
〈名〉A cupola; a cupola-furnace

content:
ようろう〔養老〕
〈名〉
1. (=老人を労り養うこと)care for the aged
2. (=老年を安楽に送ること)passing one's old age in ease
3. (=老後の備え)provision for old age

content.content: 養老金
an old age pension
養老院
an old people's home

content:
ようろうほけん〔養老保険〕
〈名〉Endowment insurance; endowment assurance

content.content: 一万円養老保険に入っている
I hold a 10,000 yen endowment policy.

ようろく〔葉肋〕
〈名〉The ribs (of a leaf)

ようわ〔鎔和〕
〈名〉Fusion:(=する) to fuse, melt (a metal)

content:
ようん〔余蘊〕
〈名〉What is left over; surplus

content.content: 余蘊無き
exhaustive
余蘊無く研究する
to make an exhaustive study of a subject

content:
ようんなき〔余蘊無き〕
〈形〉Exhaustive

content.content: 余蘊無く研究する
to make an exhaustive study of a subject

content:
よえい〔余栄〕
〈名〉Posthumous honour

content.content: 死して余栄あり
Honour blossoms on his grave.

content:
よか〔予科〕
〈名〉A preparatory course

content.content: 予科を履まなけりゃ本科へ入れぬ
One must go through the preparatory course before entering the regular course.
予科生
a preparatory student
大学予科
the preparatory course to a university

content:
よか〔余暇〕
〈名〉Leisure; leisure hours; spare time; time to spare

content.content: 余暇が無い
I have no leisure―no time to spare.
ちょっとの余暇も無い
I have not a minute I can call my own.
職務の余暇
the time one can spare from one's duties
公務の余暇にした仕事だ
The work was done in the time I could spare from my official duties.
業務の余暇に書いた本だ
The book was written in the intervals of business.

content:
よかいれい〔予戒令〕
〈名〉The premonition law

content.content: 予戒令を執行する
to place one under the ban of the premonition law
彼は予戒令執行中の身だ
He is under the ban of the premonition law.

content:
よかく〔予覚〕
〈名〉Presentiment; foreboding:(=する) to forebode; to have a presentiment (of something)

content.content: 人は死を予覚するものか
Does man forebode death?―Does man have a presentiment of death?

よかく〔余角〕
〈名〉A complementary angle

よかせぎ〔夜稼ぎ〕
〈名〉Night-work:(=する) to work nights

content:
よがら〔世柄〕
〈名〉The times; the state of things

content.content: 今は昔と世柄が違う
The times are not what they were.

content:
よかりそう〔宜かりそう〕
〈自動詞相当〉Might

content.content: 金を貸してくれてもよかりそうなものじゃないか
You might lend me the money, might you not?
彼は暇乞いくらいに来てもよかりそうなものだ
He might at least have come to say good-bye.

content:
よがる〔好がる〕
〈自他動〉To enjoy (anything); to enjoy oneself; to be complacent

content.content: 彼はあんな気障{きざ}なふうをして独りで好がっている
He is self-complacent in his insufferable costume.

content:
よかれあしかれ〔善かれ悪かれ〕
〈副〉Whether good or bad; whether right or wrong; for good or for evil; for better or for worse

content.content: 善かれ悪しかれ持って生まれた運だと諦めるよりほか無い
You must accept your lot, whether it be good or bad.
善かれ悪しかれ事実だからしかたが無い
Right or wrong, it is a fact―I may be right or wrong, but it is a fact.
人生は善かれ悪しかれこんなものだと諦めるよりほかは無い
We must take life for better or for worse―take life for good or for evil.

content:
よかん〔予感〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: よかく〔予覚〕

content:
よかん〔余寒〕
〈名〉Lingering winter

content.content: 余寒未だ去らず
Winter lingers still.

content:
よき〔予期〕
〈名〉Expectation; anticipation; contemplation:(=する) to expect; to anticipate; to contemplate; to look for (success); to count on(success, etc.)

content.content: 僕は成功を予期しておった
I expected to succeed―anticipated success―counted on success.
結果は予期通りだ
The result has come up to my expectations―The result has proved to be up to my expectations.
投機は予期通りにいった
The speculation turned out according to expectation―according to my expectations.
結果は予期以上だ
The result exceeds my expectations―The result is beyond my expectations.
予期の如く失敗に帰した
The scheme ended in a failure as I had expected―according to my expectations.
結果は予期に副わぬ
The result does not come up to my expectations―falls short of my expectations.
彼の成功は予期に応じない
His success does not meet our expectations―answer our expectations―fulfil our expectations.
結果は予期に反する
The result is contrary to my expectations―The result belies my expectations.
予期に反して事業が失敗した
Contrary to expectation,―Contrary to our expectations,―the scheme turned out a failure.
大戦乱は予期せざる結果を生じた
The Great War has produced unexpected results―unlooked-for results.
戦争を予期して造った軍艦だ
The ships were built in expectation of a war―in anticipation of a war.
この犯罪は立法者の予期せざるところであった
The offence was not contemplated by the legislator.

content:
よき〔予記〕
〈名〉Previous statement:(=する) to state previously

content.content: 宮中舞踏会は予記の如く昨夜挙行された
The Court Ball came off last night as previously stated.

よぎしゃ〔夜汽車〕
〈名〉A night-train

content:
よぎない〔余儀無い〕
〈形〉Necessary; unavoidable; inevitable

content.content: 余儀無い事情が有って止めるのです
Unavoidable circumstances oblige me to leave.

content:
よぎなく〔余儀無く〕
〈副〉Of necessity; perforce; unavoidably

content.content: 余儀無く何々する
to be under the necessity of doing something―obliged―compelled―forced―constrained―to do something
彼は余儀無く働くのだ
He works of necessity―He is under the necessity of woking.
ご用立てし金子ご返済無くば余儀無く訴えます
If you will not pay me, I shall be obliged to―compelled to―forced to―constrained to―bring an action against you.
彼はあまり強情だから余儀無く最後の手段をとったのだ
He was so obstinate that I was forced to go to extremes―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His obstinacy forced me to go to extremes―drove me to extreme measures.
そういうわけで余儀無くお断りするのです
Such being the case, I find myself under the necessity of refusing your request.

content:
よきょう〔余興〕
〈名〉An (additional) entertainment, a performance (at a banquet)

content.content: 福引の余興あり
There will be a lottery by way of entertainment.
余興として音楽等の演芸があった
There were musical and other performances to entertain us.
宴会の席上種々の余興があった
There were various performances on the scene of the banquet.
これより余興に移ります
We now proceed to the entertainments.
時間の都合で余興を省きます
As we are pressed for time, the additional entertainments will be omitted.

よきょう〔余響〕
〈名〉An after-effect; an after-math

よぎょう〔余業〕
〈名〉Supplementary industry; subsidiary industry; side-work; by-business

よぎる〔過る〕
〈自他動〉To pass (a house, etc.)

content:
よきん〔預金〕
〈名〉
1. A deposit; money on deposit; money in bank; a bank account; balance at one's bankers; credit at the bank:(=する) to deposit (money) in bank; to place (money) on deposit; to bank (money)

content.content: 彼は預金をしている
He has money in bank―He has money on deposit―He has a bank account.
彼は預金がある
He has an account at the bank―a balance at the bank―credit at his banker's.
だいぶ預金がある
He has a large deposit in bank―a large bank account―a large balance at his banker's.
十万円預金がある
He has 100,000 yen on deposit―He has a bank account of 100,000 yen.
僕は少ししか預金が無い
I have only a small bank account―only a small balance at my banker's.
彼は今月五百円預金した
He has deposited 500 yen in bank―placed 500 yen on deposit―this month.
預金を引き出す
to draw money from the bank

content:
2. 
〈複合詞〉

content.content: 定期預金
a fixed deposit
当座預金
a current deposit
当座預金通帳
a pass-book―a deposit-book―a bank-book
当座預金入金票
a deposit slip
小口当座預金
a petty current deposit
別途預金
a special deposit
通知預金
a deposit at call―a deposit at notice
預金者
a depositor―a deposit customer
預金銀行
a deposit bank
預金勘定
deposit account
預金利率
the deposit rate
(銀行の)預金係
the deposit teller
(大蔵省の)預金局、預金部
the Deposit Bureau―the Deposit Section

content:
よく〔善く、好く、能く、快く、克く、よく〕
〈副〉Well; often; frequently; commonly:(助動詞に訳せば)can

content.content: 人のことを好く言う
to speak well of a man
よく知っている
I know very well.
よくは知らない
I do not know well―I am not quite sure.
病気が快くなる
One gets well―recovers from an illness.
一晩寝れば快くなる
A night's rest will set you right―set you up.
よく煮なくちゃいかん
You must boil it well.
よく煮えました
It is well done.
克く勉め克く遊べ
Work well and play well―Work while you work, play while you play.
わたしゃ好く見て好く惚れる
I look well and love well.
この作文は好くできている
This composition is well written―well done.
よく覚えています
I remember very well.
よくは覚えていませんが
I do not remember well, but...
ゆうべはよく寝ました
I have slept very well.
よく言ってくれた
You have done well in telling me.
よく聞いてくだすった
I thank you for listening to me.
彼は子どもに好くする
He does well by his children.
この薪はよく燃える
This wood burns well.
よくわかりました
I understand―I see.
よくわかりません
I do not quite understand.
そんな説明ではよくわからない
Your explanation does not go far―does not go down with me.
ここはよく火事がある
Fires are frequent―of frequent occurrence―here.
東京はよく地震がある
Tokyo is subject to frequent earthquakes.
彼はよく遊びに来る
He often comes to see me.
よくある奴さ
Such things are of common occurrence―Such things are apt to happen.
よくやる奴さ
It is a very common mistake―a very common blunder.
こんなことは世間によくある
It is a very common case.
君にあらずして誰がよくこれを為さん
Who can do it but you?
任重大我が能く堪うるところに非ず
I am unfit for the post―unequal to the task.
君にこれがよくできるね
How do you manage to do it?―I wonder how you can do it.
君はよく借金をせずにおれるね
How do you manage to keep out of debt?―I wonder how you can keep out of debt.
よく生きておれたね
How did you manage to keep alive?
よく死ななかったね
How did you manage to escape death?
この家は地震でよく倒れなかった
It is a wonder how the house could stand the earthquake.
この靴はよく持つね
These shoes wear very well―It is a wonder how well these shoes wear.
彼はよく働く
He works hard.
よくお精が出ますね
Hard at work?
よく聞け
Mind!―Mark my words!
よくしゃれる男だよ
You are an inveterate punster.
よくいたずらをする子だ
The child is very mischievous―always in mischief.
よく失錯する男だ
He is constantly committing blunders.
よく泣く子だ
The child is given to crying.
よく考えてから返事する
I must think over the matter before giving my answer.
よく降るね
How it rains!―Much rain!
よく出ますね
How you run on!
よく来たね
I am glad to see you.
よくこわしてくれたね
You are a pretty fellow to break my things!
貧乏人は丈夫だとはよくしたものだ
It is wisely ordained―a wise dispensation of Providence―that the poor are strong.
世の中はよくしたものだ
Things are well ordered―Everything is for the best―“Whatever is, is right.”
動物とはよく言った、なるほど動く
An animal is well called a moving thing―it moves.
彼は善く言えば倹約、悪く言えば吝嗇だ
He may be called frugal―or stingy.
ごく善く言ってもけちだ
He is mean, to say the least of it.

content:
よく〔善く、好く、能く、快く、克く、よく〕
〈副〉Well; often; frequently; commonly:(助動詞に訳せば)can

content.content: 人のことを好く言う
to speak well of a man
よく知っている
I know very well.
よくは知らない
I do not know well―I am not quite sure.
病気が快くなる
One gets well―recovers from an illness.
一晩寝れば快くなる
A night's rest will set you right―set you up.
よく煮なくちゃいかん
You must boil it well.
よく煮えました
It is well done.
克く勉め克く遊べ
Work well and play well―Work while you work, play while you play.
わたしゃ好く見て好く惚れる
I look well and love well.
この作文は好くできている
This composition is well written―well done.
よく覚えています
I remember very well.
よくは覚えていませんが
I do not remember well, but...
ゆうべはよく寝ました
I have slept very well.
よく言ってくれた
You have done well in telling me.
よく聞いてくだすった
I thank you for listening to me.
彼は子どもに好くする
He does well by his children.
この薪はよく燃える
This wood burns well.
よくわかりました
I understand―I see.
よくわかりません
I do not quite understand.
そんな説明ではよくわからない
Your explanation does not go far―does not go down with me.
ここはよく火事がある
Fires are frequent―of frequent occurrence―here.
東京はよく地震がある
Tokyo is subject to frequent earthquakes.
彼はよく遊びに来る
He often comes to see me.
よくある奴さ
Such things are of common occurrence―Such things are apt to happen.
よくやる奴さ
It is a very common mistake―a very common blunder.
こんなことは世間によくある
It is a very common case.
君にあらずして誰がよくこれを為さん
Who can do it but you?
任重大我が能く堪うるところに非ず
I am unfit for the post―unequal to the task.
君にこれがよくできるね
How do you manage to do it?―I wonder how you can do it.
君はよく借金をせずにおれるね
How do you manage to keep out of debt?―I wonder how you can keep out of debt.
よく生きておれたね
How did you manage to keep alive?
よく死ななかったね
How did you manage to escape death?
この家は地震でよく倒れなかった
It is a wonder how the house could stand the earthquake.
この靴はよく持つね
These shoes wear very well―It is a wonder how well these shoes wear.
彼はよく働く
He works hard.
よくお精が出ますね
Hard at work?
よく聞け
Mind!―Mark my words!
よくしゃれる男だよ
You are an inveterate punster.
よくいたずらをする子だ
The child is very mischievous―always in mischief.
よく失錯する男だ
He is constantly committing blunders.
よく泣く子だ
The child is given to crying.
よく考えてから返事する
I must think over the matter before giving my answer.
よく降るね
How it rains!―Much rain!
よく出ますね
How you run on!
よく来たね
I am glad to see you.
よくこわしてくれたね
You are a pretty fellow to break my things!
貧乏人は丈夫だとはよくしたものだ
It is wisely ordained―a wise dispensation of Providence―that the poor are strong.
世の中はよくしたものだ
Things are well ordered―Everything is for the best―“Whatever is, is right.”
動物とはよく言った、なるほど動く
An animal is well called a moving thing―it moves.
彼は善く言えば倹約、悪く言えば吝嗇だ
He may be called frugal―or stingy.
ごく善く言ってもけちだ
He is mean, to say the least of it.

content:
よく〔慾、欲〕
〈名〉
1. (=貪慾)greed; avarice; cupidity; rapacity:(金銭の慾)love of money; desire for wealth; hope of gain:(利の慾)interest; selfishness

content.content: 慾が深い
to be greedy―avaricious―covetous―rapacious―grasping
彼はどこまで慾が深いか底が知れぬ
His avarice knows no bounds.
年寄れば慾深し
Age makes one avaricious―“Prudence is the only virtue left at seventy.”
彼は慾の奴隷だ
He is the slave of avarice―a slave to avarice.
慾の固まりだ
He is avarice itself―the personification of avarice.
あの人は慾というものは塵ほども無い
He has not a particle of avarice in his nature.
慾が無い
to be unselfish―disinterested―self-sacrificing―simple―foolish
君は慾が無いね
How simple you are!―What a fool you are!
僕は慾が無くなった
I have lost interest in life.
慾を離れる
to give up all hope of gain
女が慾を離れて男の世話をした
She took care of him apart from hope of gain.
このことは慾を離れて考えなければならぬ
The matter must be considered apart from interest.
彼はあんなことをするのは慾でするのだ
He does such things for love of money―He does such things from a desire for gain―He acts from selfish motives.
慾が手伝っている
He is urged by avarice―impelled by avarice.
あの人の働くのは慾が手伝っているのだ
Avarice urges him to work.
慾と二人連れだ
Avarice is part of himself.
慾に限り無し
“Avarice knows no bounds.”
大慾は無慾に似たり
Avarice overreaches itself―“Grasp all, lose all.”
慾に目無し
Avarice is blind.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 慾を言えば
I wish it were so―I could have wished it so.
慾を言えばこの家はいま少し大きいとよい
I with this house were a little longer―I could have wished this house a little longer.
眠くて眠くて慾も得も無い
I would give anything for a quiet nap.
腹が減って慾も得も無い
I would give my life for a bowl of rice.
慾にも得にも目を覚ましていられない
I can not keep awake to save my life―for the life of me.
慾にも得にもそんなことをするのはいやだ
I would not do such a thing for the world―for all the gold in the world.

content: 3. (=慾望)desire:(浮世心)worldly desires:(情慾)the passions

content.content: 国が開けると金銭の慾を生ずる
Civilization engenders a desire for wealth.
慾を離れる
to give up worldly desires
片足突込んでも慾を離れぬ
With one foot in the grave, man can not wean his mind from worldly desires.
慾を制す、慾を抑える
to control one's passions

content:
よく〔翌〕
〈形〉Next; following; ensuing

content.content: 翌日
next day―the following day
翌十日に帰った
I returned on the following day, the 10th.

content:
よく〔翼〕
〈名〉
1. (=軍の翼)a wing; a flank

content.content: 右翼
the right wing―the right flank―of an army
左翼
the left wing―the left flank―of an army

情慾は抑制し難し
The passions are hard of control.
彼は情慾を抑制し得ない
He has no control over his passions―He can not keep his passions under control.
情慾を抑制するには強固なる意志を要す
One must have a strong will to control one's passions.
感情を抑制する

憤怒を抑制する
to control one's anger―repress one's anger―contain one's anger―keep one's anger down―control one's temper―master one's temper―keep one's temper under

慾得を離れて働かねばならない
One must work apart from interest.

content:
よくばる〔慾張る〕
〈自動〉To be greedy; to be avaricious; to be covetous; to be rapacious; to grasp (too much):(金銭以外なら)to wish for too much; to go beyond bounds

content.content: 慾張るとかえって損をする
“He who grasps at too much, will lose all.”
あまり慾張るとかえって損をするよ
You will “kill the goose with the golden eggs.”
慾張る鷹は爪が抜ける
“Grasp all, lose all.”
何事もあまり慾張るものでない
You should keep within bounds―be moderate in your desires.
あまり慾張ったのが悪い
You have done wrong in going beyond all bounds.
どれもこれも読もうというのは慾張っている
It is going beyond bounds to wish to read every one of them.
その上望むのは慾張っている
It is too much to wish for more.

content:

to gratify one's desire
運は慾望に副うものでない
Fortune is never equal to one's desires.
分限を越えた慾望を懐くものでない
One should not cherish desires beyond one's means―One should bound one's desires to one's means.

content:

content.content: 慾目で見る
to look at anything with partial eyes
君は慾目で見るから真相が見えないのだ
Your partiality blinds you to the truth.
親の慾目
“Everybody thinks his geese are swans.”
親の慾目かも知れぬが彼には非難すべき点が無いようだ
My fatherly eye sees no blame in him.
惚れた慾目
Love invests its object with perfections not its own―“Love is blind.”
惚れた慾目にゃ
When one is lost in love's sweet dream.
あばたも笑窪
A pockmark will a dimple seem.

よくも厚かましくそんなことが言えたものだ
I wonder how he could have the face to say such a thing.

He must be in the last extremity to come to me for help.
よくよくのことでなければ兵禍を放つものでない

〈接尾詞〉A protection (from something); a shelter (from something); a charm (against something)

content.content: 魔除け
a charm against evil influence―a protection from harm
この守りは魔除けになる
This amulet will protect you from harm.
霜除け
a protection from frost
この木の霜除けをしなけりゃならぬ
This tree must be protected from the frost.
雨除け
a shelter from the rain
雨除けをする
to shelter a place from the rain
風除け
a protection from the wind
この竹藪は風除けになる
The bomboo-grove protects the house from the north wind.
日除け

The trees shade the street.
弾除け

火難除け
a charm against fire
水難除け

鬼門除けをする

content:

content:

〈形〉Superfluous; unnecessary; needless; undue; uncalled-for; to spare; too much

content.content: 船内には余計な物は一つも無い
There is nothing superfluous in the ship.
僕は余計な金は一文も無い
I have no more money than I need―I have no money to spare.
余計の金を使った
I have been put to unnecessary expense.
金は五十円だけ余計だ
The money is 50 yen too much.
余計な干渉は止すがよい
You ought to refrain from undue interference.
あのお世辞はちと余計だった
That compliment of yours was not needed―uncalled-for.
話のはずみに余計なことを言ってしまった
I said more than I meant to―I was carried away―in the heat of the talk.
余計なことをする
to carry coals to Newcastle―butter the bread on both sides―teach a fish how to swim―kill the slain―paint the lily―refine a violet―gild refined gold
余計なことをするな
You are buttering the bread on both sides―You may spare yourself the trouble.
余計なことをしたものだ止せばよいのに
He need not have done that―He might have spared himself the trouble.
余計なことを言うな
Do not waste words!―“Keep your breath to cool your porridge!”
余計な世話を焼く
to meddle in other's affairs
余計な世話を焼くな
Mind your own business!―That's no business of yours.
あれは余計な世話を焼く男だ
He is a meddler―a busybody.
余計な心配するな
Do not give yourself needless anxiety!
余計な苦労をするな
Do not run to meet your trouble!―“Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.”
彼は余計な力こぶを入れている
His zeal is worthy of a better cause.

content:
よける〔除ける〕
〈他動〉To avoid (dangers); to shun (a dangerous man); to avert (a calamity); to evade (dangers); to elude (a blow); to dodge (a blow); to fend off, ward off, stave off (a disaster); to keep off (evil); to keep out (the dust); to keep out of (danger); to fly from (temptations); to beware of, guard against (accidents); to steer clear of (the rocks); to keep clear of, stand clear of (troubles); to get out of the way of, keep out of the way of (carriages); to shelter oneself from (the wind); to shield oneself from (the sun); to make way for (a mad bull, etc.)

content.content: 邪魔だから除けろ
You stand in my way. Get out of my way!
そこは馬車が通るから除けろ
Get out of the way of the carriage!―(常になら)―Keep out of the way of carriages!
災難を除ける
to avert a calamity―keep off a disaster―fend off a disaster―ward off a disaster―stave off a disaster
悪事災難を除ける
to keep off evil
禍を除ける
to keep off evil―keep out of harm's way
危難を除ける
to avoid dangers―evade dangers―elude dangers―keep out of danger
船は暗礁を除けて通る
A ship steers clear of rocks.
ばかと気違いは除けて通せ
“Make way for a fool and a madman!”
困難を除ける
to avoid difficulties―steer clear of difficulties
身を開いて打ち込む太刀を除ける
to dodge a falling blow―elude a falling blow―evade a falling blow
用心してけがを除けよ
Beware of accidents!―Guard against accidents!
日を除ける
to keep off the sun―shield oneself from the sun
木が日を除ける

風を除ける
to shelter oneself from the wind
港は北風を除けている
The harbour is sheltered from the north wind.
この竹藪が風を除ける
This bamboo-grove protects the house from the north wind.
船が島の蔭に碇泊して風を除けている
The ship lies under the lee of an island.
塵(や芥)を除ける
to keep the dust out
眼鏡を掛けて芥を除ける
One wears goggles to keep the dust from one's eyes.
自動車を除ける
to dodge a motor-car
倒れんとする木を除ける
to get away from under―stand from under―a falling tree
倒壊する家を除ける
to get away from under a falling house

僕の予言が当たった

君の予言が当たらない

予言者

強盗が金を寄越せと言った

手紙のほかに何か寄越さなかったか

手紙のほかには何もお寄越しになりません

彼は無礼にもこんな手紙を寄越した
He had the insolence to write me such a letter.
手紙をやっても返事を寄越さない
He has not answered my letter.
言って寄越す
to write to say―write me word―drop me a line
兄は来月上京すると言って寄越した

来るなら来ると言って寄越せば掃除でもさせておくのだったに
