来られないなら来られないと言って寄越せ

よこたて〔横縦〕

content.content: 室は横縦共に五間

crosswise
横縦十文字に腹を切る

content.content: 寝床に横たわる
to lie in bed―recline on a couch
くたびれて草の上ヘ横たわった
Feeling tired, I lay down―threw myself―on the grass.

忽驚大蛇

当路横
Across my path recline;
抜剣欲斬
I draw my sword―'tis but the shadow
老松影
Of an ancient pine.

よこちょう〔横町〕

三つ目の横町を左へお曲りなさい
Take the third turning on your left.

よこちょうへそれないで
Do not wander from the point!―Keep to the point!

〈名〉A stain; a soil; a smudge; a blot; a spot:(=る) to stain, be stained; to soil, be soiled; to dirty, become dirty; to become filthy; to foul; to be smudged:(=た) stained; soiled; dirty; filthy; foul

No matter what may happen,―Whatever may happen,―Come what way,―I am prepared for it.

content:
よす〔止す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=中止する)to stop; to cease; to leave off; to break off; to knock off; to discontinue; to end; to put an end to (anything)

content.content: 冗談止せ
Stop joking!―No more of your jokes!
ばかな真似を止せ
No more of this folly!―Enough of this folly!
もう仕事を止して好い時間だ
It is time to leave off work―knock off work.
僕が行くと皆話を止す
They stop talking―cease talking―leave off talking―at my approach.
人間は戦争を止さない
Man will never cease from strife.
この新聞は面白くないから止そう
I will stop taking this paper, for it is poor reading.
しばらくドイツ語を止している
I have discontinued the study of German for some time.
彼は演説の真中で急に止した
He broke off in the midst of his speech.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 銀行と取引を中止す
to close an account with a bank
人と交際を中止す
to drop an acquaintance
彼は誰が来ても読書を止さない
Whoever may come, he goes on reading.
彼は医者に注意されても酒を止さぬ
He keeps on drinking in defiance of his doctor's warning.
僕はまだ同窓と文通を止さぬ
I still keep up correspondence with my college friends.
先方が謝罪しなけりゃこのけんかは止されぬ
If the other party will not apologize, the affair must proceed―go on.
もう馬車を止そう
I will put down my carriage―The carriage must go.

content: 2. (=為そうと思ったことをせぬ)not to do (anything); to desist from (the attempt)

content.content: 止せ
Don't!―Have done!
止せやい
Out upon it!―Out upon you!
今日は止そう
I will not do it today.
今日は行くのを止そう
I will not go today.
そんなことはお止しなさい
You may spare yourself the trouble.
止せば好いのに
He might have spared himself the trouble.
仲裁などは君の柄に無いから止すがよい
You ought to desist from the attempt, for mediation is out of your character.
そんな骨の折れることは止した方が好くはないか
Hadn't you better desist from such an arduous attempt?
まあ止しやしょう
I would rather not.
止せばよかった
I have done it once too often.
行くのを止して手紙をやろう
I will write instead of going.
勉強を止して遊ぼうじゃないか
Let us play instead of working.
詳しいことは止して要点だけを簡単に述べておきます
I shall only touch on the chief points instead of going into details.
彼はその取引を止したと言っている
He has broken off the bargain―declared off the bargain.
君が入らなけりゃ僕も止す
If you will not join, I will beg off―cry off.
玉突きか、近頃止しているから下手になったろう
Billiards? I am rather out of practice.

content: 3. (=断念する)to abandon (the attempt); to give up (the attempt)

content.content: 酒を止す、タバコを止す
to give up drinking―give up smoking
酒を止した
I have given up drinking―drunk my last cup.
タバコを止した
I have given up smoking―smoked my last pipe.
彼は酒が好きで止されぬ
He has an unconquerable love for drink―He is an inveterate drunkard.
僕はどうしてもタバコが止されぬ
Nothing can make me give up smoking―I am an inveterate smoker.
この目が治らなけりゃ学問を止さなけりゃならぬ
If my eyes do not get better, I shall have to give up my studies.
とうとう駄目だから止した
I gave up the attempt in despair―gave it up as a bad job.
僕は金が出ないから洋行を止した
I have given up the idea of going abroad, for I can't find the means.
誰が何と言ってもこのことばかりは止されぬ
Nobody can deter me from the step.

content: 4. (=辞職する、廃業する)to resign (one's office); to retire from (business); to leave; to quit

content.content: 彼は役所を止した
He has resigned his office―left office.
学校を止そうと思う
I think I will leave school.
あの時半途に学校を止さなければよかった
I wish I had not left school half-way.
先生を止して実業界へ入る者がある
Some men quit teaching and go into business―leave teaching for business.
要求を容れなけりゃ僕は止す
If they will not comply with my demands, I will leave.

content: 5. (=廃す)to abolish; to do away with (anything)

content.content: 儀式を止して無礼講にしようじゃないか
Let us do away with ceremony!―Let all ceremony be done away with!

content.content: 寄せ来る敵を防いだ
They defended the castle against the oncoming enemy―the surging enemy.

よせつぎ〔寄せ接ぎ〕
〈名〉Inarching:(=する) to inarch (a tree)

content:
よせつける〔寄せ付ける〕
〈他動〉To allow (one) to come near

content.content: 寄せ付けぬ
to keep one at a distance―keep one at arm's length―keep one at bay
あんな者を寄せ付けるな
Keep such men at a distance?
凶漢は短刀を振りまわして追手を寄せ付けない
The ruffian brandished a dagger, and kept his pursuers at bay.

よせて〔寄せ手〕
〈名〉The besieging army; a storming party

よせなみ〔寄せ波〕
〈名〉A surf

content:
よせる〔寄せる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=引寄せる)to draw (anything) to one

content.content: 彼のそばへ椅子を寄せた
I drew my chair near him.
時々寄せて下さい
You will let me come and see you sometimes.

content: 2. (=脇へ寄せる)to push aside, shove aside (anything)

content.content: 仕事を邪魔にならないように寄せておく
I push my work out of the way.

content: 3. (=集める)to gather; to collect; to bring together

content.content: 顔に皺を寄せる
to wrinkle one's face―pucker up one's face
額に八の字を寄せる
to knit one's brow―gather one's brow―contract one's brow―pucker one's brow

content: 4. (=加える)to add (one number to another); to add up (figures)

content.content: 数字を寄せる
to add up the figures―cast a column of figures
皆寄せていくら
What do you make the total?

content: 5. (=攻め寄る)to attack, storm (a castle)

content.content: 寄せ来る敵を防いだ
They defended the castle against the oncoming enemy―the surging enemy.

content: 6. (=逆巻く)to surge

content.content: 波が岸へ寄せる
The sea surges on the shore.

content: 7. (=猟獣などに隠れて近寄る)to stalk (game)

content.content: この鳥は寄せにくい
The bird takes flight on the least alarm.

content: 8. (=送る)to send, write (a letter to one)

content.content: 天皇陛下には御親電を寄せらる
The Emperor sent a personal telegram.
思いを寄せる
(男が女になら)He falls in love with her―loses his heart to her―takes a fancy to her―(女が男になら)―She fixes her affections on him.
(人の許に)身を寄せる
to go to live with one―become a dependent on one―place oneself under another's protection
父が死んでから伯(叔)父のもとに身を寄せております
I have lived with my uncle since my father died.
彼女は身を寄せるところがない
She has nowhere to go.
(歌道に)心を寄せる
to direct one's attention to versification

content:
よせん〔予選〕
〈名〉Provisional election; preliminary election; nomination:(=する) to elect provisionally; to nominate

content.content: 予選会
a nomination meeting―a primary meeting―(米国にては)―a caucus
予選競走
a trial heat

content:
よぜん〔余喘〕
〈名〉One's remaining days

content.content: ようやく余喘を保っている
He lingers on.

content:
よそ〔余所〕
〈名〉Another place; strange parts:(=の) other; strange:(=で) elsewhere; out; abroad

content.content: よその人だ
He is a stranger.
よそのお方だ
He is a strange gentleman―She is a strange lady.
よその小父さんに(よその小母さんに)に貰いました
A strange gentleman―A strange lady―gave it me.
よそではもっと安い
They sell cheaper at other houses.
それではよそでお買いになったらよいでしょう
Then you had better go elsewhere for it.
よそよりはお安く願っております
We sell cheaper than at other houses.
ちょっとよそへ行って来る
I am going out for a while.
今日はよそで飯を食う
I shall dine out today.
よそのご馳走よりうちの茶漬
“Dry bread at home is better than roast meat abroad.”
よその家へ行ったら言語挙動に注意なさい
You must mind your P's and Q's while on a visit.
よその花は赤い
“Variety is the mother of enjoyment.”
よそにする
to neglect anything
彼は勤めをよそにして遊んでばかりいる
He does nothing but play, neglectful of his duties.
よそを見る
to look away
よそに見る
to look unconcernedly on anything
君の難儀をどうまあよそに見ていられるか
How can I look unconcernedly on you distress?
彼は人の難儀をよそに見てさらにかまわない
He does not concern himself about―trouble his head about―care about―others' distresses.

content:
よそいき〔余所行き〕
〈形〉Best

content.content: よそ行きの着物
one's best clothes―one's Sunday clothes―one's Sunday best
皆よそ行きの着物を着ている
They are all in their best.
彼女はよそ行きの顔をしていた
She was looking her best.
よそ行きのお辞儀をする
to make one's best bow
女がよそ行きの声を出して歌った
She sang her sweetest.

content:
よそう〔装う〕
〈他動〉To serve (food in a dish); to dish (food); to fill (a bowl with rice)

content.content: 飯をよそう
to serve rice in a bowl―fill a bowl with rice

content:
よそう〔予想〕
〈名〉Expectation; anticipation; estimate; forecast:(=する) to expect (a rise); to anticipate (a war); to estimate (the crop); to forecast (the weather)

content.content: 騰貴を予想する
to expect a rise―anticipate a rise
騰貴を予想してたくさん買い込んだ
I laid in a large stock in expectation of a rise―in anticipation of a rise.
収穫を予想する
to estimate the crop
予想収穫
the estimated crop
天気を予想する
to forecast the weather
将来を予想する
to forecast the future
結果を予想する
to expect a result
予想通りの結果を得た
I have obtained the expected result.
結果は予想通りだ
The result is as I expected―just as I expected.
予想通り彼は失敗した
He has failed according to expectation―according to my expectations.
結果は予想通りにいった
The result has come up to my expectations.
予想通りにいかない
It has fallen short of my expectaions.
物事は予想通りにいくことはめったにない
Things seldom come up to our expectations.
結果は予想に反する
The result is contrary to expectation―contrary to my expectations―The result belies my expectations.
予想に反して彼は成功した
Contrary to expectation,―Contrary to my expectations,―he has succeeded.
利益は予想以上だ
The profit is more than I expected―beyond my expectations―The profit exceeds my expectations.
利益は予想以下だ
The profit falls short of my expectations.
予想がはずれた
I am disappointed of my expectations―I have reckoned without my host.
予想が全く違った
Things have gone contrary to my expectations―My hopes are shattered―My hopes are dashed to the ground.→『よそうがい〔予想外〕』

content:
よそうがい〔予想外〕
〈形〉Unexpected (result); unlooked-for (success); unhoped-for (success); surprising (result); disappointing (failure):(=に) contrary to expectation; beyond expectation; more than one expected; more than one hoped; more than one feared

content.content: 結果は予想外だ
The result is unexpected―contrary to expectation―contrary to my expectations―not what I expected―surprising―a surprise.
成績は予想外に良好だ
The result is better than I expected―beyond my expectations―beyond expectation―surprisingly good―an agreeable surprise―The result exceeds my expectations.
成績は予想外に悪い
The result is worse than I expected―disappointing―a disappointment―The result falls short of my expectations.
利益は予想外に多い
The profit is greater than I expected―much greater than I hoped―beyond my expectations―The profit exceeds my expectations.
損亡は予想外に少ない
The loss is less than I expected―much less than I feared.
今度の成功は実に予想外だ
My success exceeds my wildest hopes.

content:
よそおい〔装い〕
〈名〉
1. (=支度)dress; attire; array; equipment; outfit

content.content: ソロモン王の栄華を極めし時だにもその装いこの百合に如かざりき
Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these lilies.

content: 2. (=身飾、化粧)personal ornament; personal adornment; toilet

content.content: 紅粉の装い
rouge and powder

content:
よそおう〔装う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=支度する)to dress oneself, attire oneself, array oneself, equip oneself (in silk, etc.)

content.content: 皆華やかに装うている
They are gaily dressed.
晴れやかに装うている
They are showily dressed.

content: 2. (=身を飾る、化粧する)to ornament oneself, adorn oneself, deck oneself (with something); to make one's toilet

content.content: 紅粉を装う
to paint one's face with rouge and powder
紅粉を装える美人
a painted beauty

content:
3. (=艤装する)to equip, fit out (a ship)
4. (=何の振りをする、何々ぶる)to assume, put on (some air); to pretend (to be ill); to feign, sham (death or sleep); to affect (virtue or piety); to affect, dissemble, simulate (virtue); to set up for, pose as (a virtuous man); to pretend to, lay claim to (wisdom or virtue)

content.content: 道徳家を装う
to assume a virtuous air―set up for a virtuous man―pose as a man of virtue―pretend to virtue―affect virtue―simulate virtue
宗教家を装う
to put on a pious air―affect piety―simulate piety
病を装う
to pretend to be ill―feign illness―sham sickness
彼は病気を装って面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me on the pretence of illness―under pretence of illness.
死を装う
to pretend to be dead―feign death―sham death
眠りを装う
to pretend to be asleep―feign sleep―sham sleep
発狂を装う
to pretend to be mad―feign madness―sham madness
平気を装う
to assume an unconcerned air―put on an indifferent air―put a good face on the matter
彼は親切を装って僕をだました
He cheated me under colour of friendship―under the mask of friendship―under the cloak of friendship.

content:
よそぎき〔余所聞き〕
〈名〉Reputation

content.content: よそ聞きが悪いからそんなことを言ってくれるな
Don't say such things of me, for it concerns my reputation.
そんなよそ聞きの悪いことを言うものじゃない
You should not say such disreputable things―such scandalous things.

よそく〔予測〕
〈名〉Estimate:(=する) to estimate

content:
よそごと〔余所事〕
〈名〉A matter that does not concern one; anything apart from the matter in hand

content.content: これはよそ事じゃない
The matter concerns me―I am concerned in the matter.
よそ事を言う
to talk apart from the matter in hand
いろいろの人が居たからよそ事を言うようにして彼に注意を与えた
As there was a mixed company, I warned him by a casual remark.

content:
よそながら〔余所乍ら〕
〈副〉Indirectly; obliquely; obscurely; casually

content.content: よそながら暇乞いに行った
I went to bid him an indirect farewell.

content:
よそみ〔余所見〕
〈名〉Looking aside:(=する) to look aside; to look away; to look off

content.content: 君はよそ見しながら歩くから人に突き当たるのだ
You keep looking aside, and that's why you run against people.
本を読んでてよそ見する
to look off one's book
(先生が全級に向かって)誰でもよそ見している者があったら知らして下さい
If any one of you sees another boy looking off his book, let him come and tell me.

content:
よそめ〔余所目〕
〈名〉Other's eyes; an outsider's view; a looker-on

content.content: 病人よりもよそ目の方が辛い
Lookers-on suffer more than the invalid.
病人はよそ目で見るぼどは苦しくないのだ
The invalid does not suffer so much as he seems to.
彼はよそ目には不平らしくない
He does not seem discontented.
よそ目には満足しているようだ
He seems to be contended.
よそ目で見るほど好くはない(よそ目に見えない苦労がある)
“None but the wearer knows where the shoe pinches.”
あの人はよそ目にも気の毒なほど行儀を崩さない
He is painfully proper.
あんな事をしたからよそ目が恥ずかしい
After such conduct on my part, I am ashamed to appear in public.

content:
よそよそしい〔余所余所しい〕
〈形〉Distant, cold, icy, frigid, freezing, offish, stand-offish, indifferent (behaviour)

content.content: よそよそしい振る舞い
distant behaviour
彼は僕によそよそしくする
He keeps his distance towards me―He makes a stranger of me.

content:
よた〔与太〕
〈名〉A fool

content.content: 与太を飛ばす
to talk nonsense

よたか〔夜鷹〕
〈名〉
1. The goat-sucker
2. (=辻君)a street-walker

content:
よたく〔余沢〕
〈名〉Benefits; blessings

content.content: これは聖代の余沢だ
This is one of the blessings of the glorious reign.
乞食の果てまでも文明の余沢に与る
Even the beggar shares in the benefits of civilization.

content:
よだつ〔弥立つ〕
〈自動〉To stand on end

content.content: 身の毛がよだった
My hair stood on end.
身の毛のよだつような話だ
The story will make your hair stand on end.

content:
よだつ〔与奪〕
〈名〉Giving and taking away→『

content.content: せいさつよだつのけん〔生殺与奪の権〕

content:
よだれ〔涎〕
〈名〉Slaver; slobber

content.content: 涎を垂らす
to slaver―slobber―drivel―dribble―run at the mouth
この子は始終涎を垂らしている
The child is constantly running at the mouth.
涎が出る、涎が流れる、涎を流す
One's mouth waters―One waters at the mouth.
そんな話を聞くと涎が出る
You make my mouth water.
見ると涎が流れるようなご馳走だ
The sight of the feast will make your mouth water―bring the water to your mouth.
涎を流して眺める
to look on with watering mouth―covet anything
彼はあの地位に涎を流している
He covets the position.
人が金儲けをするのを涎を流して見ているのは辛い
It is hard to look with covetous eyes on people making fortunes.
涎を流して(ご馳走などを)待つ
to lick one's lips―lick one's chops

よだれかけ〔涎掛け〕
〈名〉A bib

よだん〔予断〕
〈名〉Prejudgement:(=する) to prejudge

content:
よだん〔余談〕
〈名〉
1. (=枝葉の談)a digression

content.content: 余談に互る
to make a digression―digress from the subject―wander from the point
余談に互るな
Do not wander from the point!―Keep to the point!
余談は暫く措いて
To return (to my subject)

content: 2. (=話の続き)the sequel (of a story)

よち〔予知〕
〈名〉Foreknowledge; foresight; foreboding; prescience:(=する) to foreknow; to foresee; to forebode

content.content: 下等動物は天災の襲来を予知するものと見える
The lower animals seem to forebode the visitation of natural calamities.
結果は予知し難し
It is impossible to foresee the result.
晴雨計によって天候を予知(予言)することを得
The barometer enables us to predict the weather.

content:
よち〔余地〕
〈名〉Room; space

content.content: 証拠は疑いを容るべき余地がある
There is room for doubt―The evidence leaves room for doubt―The evidence is open to doubt.
疑いを容るべき余地無し
There is no room for doubt―The evidence leaves no room for doubt―The evidence admits of no doubt.
この問題はまだ論ずべき余地がある
The question is still open to discussion―There is room for discussion.
論ずべき余地無し
The question admits of no discussion―There is no room for discussion.
彼の行為は非難の余地がある
His conduct is open to censure.
非難の余地が無い
His conduct admits of no censure.
彼の英語は進歩の余地がある
His English leaves room for improvement―leaves something to be desired.
進歩の余地無し(申し分無し)
It leaves nothing to be desired.
この系統は発達の余地がある
The system leaves room for further development.
僕の決心は再考の余地が無い
My resolution admits of no reconsideration.
満堂立錐の余地無し
There is no standing-room―The hall is closely packed―filled to overflowing―crowded to suffocation.
膝を容れる余地も無い
There is no sitting-room.
御提案の件は遺憾ながら詮議の余地無之候
I regret to say that I am not in a position to entertain your proposition.

content:
よち〔輿地〕
〈名〉The world; the earth

content.content: 輿地誌
a geography of the world

content:
ヨチヨチ
〈副〉Toddlingly

content.content: 子どもがヨチヨチ歩く
A child toddles about―toddles along.

content:
よつ〔四つ〕
〈名、形〉Four

content.content: 相撲が四つに組む
Two wrestlers grapple with each other―lock themselves in each other's arms.

よつあし〔四つ足〕
〈名〉A four-footed animal; a quadruped

content:
よつおり〔四つ折り〕
〈形〉Folded in four; quarto

content.content: 紙を四つ折りにする
to fold a sheet of paper in four
四つ折判の本
a quarto

よっかく〔浴客〕
〈名〉A visitor at a spa; a bather

content:
よつかど〔四つ角〕
〈名〉Four corners; a crossing; a cross-roads

content.content: あの四つ角を左へお曲りなさい
Turn that crossing to the left.

よつぎ〔世継ぎ〕
〈名〉A successor; an heir:(女なら) an heiress

content:
よっきゅう〔欲求〕
〈名〉Desire

content.content: 性の欲求、自然の欲求
sexual desire
年頃になると自然の欲求が出る
Nature asserts herself at the age of puberty.

content:
よつぎり〔四つ切り〕
〈名〉Quartering

content.content: 四つ切りにする
to quarter anything―cut anything in four

よづく〔世付く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=世馴れる)to get used to the world
2. (=色気づく)to arrive at puberty

よつぐみ〔四つ組〕
〈名〉A set of four; a tetrad

content:
ヨッコラヨッコラ
〈副〉Haltingly

content.content: ヨッコラヨッコラ歩く
to halt along

よつだけ〔四つ竹〕
〈名〉A kind of castanets

content:
よっつ〔四つ〕
〈形、名〉Four

content.content: お年はいくつ―四つ
How old are you?―I am four (years old).

content:
よっつじ〔四つ辻〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: よつつじ〔四つ辻〕

よつつじ〔四つ辻〕
〈名〉A crossing; a cross-roads

content:
よって〔依て〕
〈副〉Accordingly; consequently; in consequence; hence

content.content: 依ってその通り行った
And I acted accordingly.
彼は病気にかかったに依って僕は出発を見合わした
He was taken ill, and I put off my departure in consequence.
依ってこの名あり
Hence its name:
依って後日のため件{くだん}の如し
In witness whereof I hereto set my hand and seal for future reference.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉At (one's request); by (one's order); on (one's advice); for (some reason); from (some cause); through (some medium); according to (circumstances); in accordance with (one's wishes); on account of, on the ground of (illness); in consequence of, owing to (some cause)

content.content: 命に依り
by order
その筋の命に依り学校を休みにした
The school was closed by order of the authorities.
医者の勧めに依って旅行に行く
On my doctor's advice, I am about to start on a journey.
ご主人のご依頼に依って参上しました
I came at your master's request.
貴命に依って上京致しました
I have come to town in accordance with your wishes―in obedience to your wishes.
誰かの動議に依ってある所へ二次会を開いた
On some one's motion, we adjourned to a certain place.
ご助力に依り成功した
I have succeeded by your assistance.
君は忍耐に依って成功したのだ
You have succeeded by dint of perseverance.
彼は勉強に依って富貴を致した
He has become rich by industry―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Industry has made him rich.
文脈に依って判断する
to judge by the context―infer from the context
事情に依って斟酌せねばならぬ
We must make allowances according to circumstances―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Circumstances alter cases.
都合に依っては金を増してもさし支え無い
The money may be increased according to circumstances.
刑法に依って犯人を処分する
to deal with the culprit according to the Criminal Code
値段は大きさに依って違う
The price differs according to size―The price varies with the size.
収入は月に依って違う
The receipts vary with the month.
彼は人に依って態度を異にする
He changes his attitude according to the person he has to deal with.
慣例に依って長男が相続した
The eldest son succeeded to the property according to custom―in conformity to custom.
功労に依って男爵に叙せられた
He was created baron in recognition of his services.
吾人は書に依って親しく古人に接する
We listen to the ancients through books.
彼は勉強が過ぎるに依って身体をこわす
He makes himself ill by overworking himself.
金が無いに依って洋行を断念した
I gave up the idea of going abroad for want of means.
彼は不勉強だに依って落第した
He has failed in the examination owing to his idleness―in consequence of his idleness.
彼は病だに依って辞職したのだ
He has resigned on account of illness―on the ground of ill health.

content: 〈形〉Some

content.content: 人に依ってはそう思う
Some people think so.
品に依っては前日お申し込みを要します
Some dishes require a day's notice.
場合に依っては嘘をついてもよいものか
Is it allowable to tell a lie in some cases?―on some occasions?―under certain circumstances?

よつで〔四つ手〕
〈名〉(=四つ手網)A dipping-net

content:
よってたかる〔寄ってたかる〕
〈自動〉To crowd about (a person)

content.content: その外人のまわりに人が寄ってたかった
People crowded about the stranger.
寄ってたかってその男を殴った
They surrounded and mauled him.
僕が何か企てると君達は寄ってたかってぶちこわすから困る
You will pull my scheme to pieces among you.

content:
よっと〔快走船〕
〈名〉A yacht

content.content: ヨット遊び(ヨット操縦)
yachting
ヨット遊びに行く
to go to yachting
ヨット操縦家
a yachtsman
彼はヨットの操縦が巧みだ
He is a good yachtsman.
ヨット競走
a yacht-race
競走用ヨット
a racing yacht
航海用ヨット
a cruising yacht

content:
よつばい〔四つ這い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: よつんばい〔四つん這い〕

よっぱらい〔酔払い〕
〈名〉A drunkard; a sot

content:

He is fuddled with drink―flustered with drink.

He is habitual drunkard―a sot.

content:
よてい〔予定〕
〈名〉
1. (Previous) arrangement; prearrangement; intention; expectation; a plan; a programme; a schedule:(=する) to prearrange; to arrange; to intend; to expect; to preconcert; to concert:(=の) prearranged; arranged; intended; expected; preconcerted; concerted; scheduled

content.content: 来週の日曜開会の予定
It is arranged that the meeting shall be held on Sunday week―The meeting is arranged for―scheduled for―Sunday week.
十日御地着の予定に御座候
I expect to reach your place on the 10th―I am due at your place on the 10th.
彼は今日到着の予定です
He is expected to arrive―due here―today.
工事は向こう一カ年間に竣工の予定
The works are expected to be completed―due to be completed―in a year's time.
パリに一カ月滞在の予定です
I intend to make a week's stay is Paris.
三泊の予定
I intend to make a four day's stay.
休暇中はどうするご予定ですか
What are your plans for the holidays?―What is your programme for the holidays?
予定を変更した
I have changed my plans―changed my programme.
予定の行動
preconcerted operations
予定の作戦計画
a concerted plan of operations
予定の線路
a projected line
予定保険
open cover
予定の如く、予定通り
according to programme―as arranged―as preconcerted―as intended―as expected
予定通り京都へ行く
I am going to Kyoto according to programme.
予定通り昨日開会せり
The meeting was held yesterday as arranged.
予定の如く戦闘を開始せり
We went into action as preconcerted.
予定通り今日到着せり
He has arrived today as expected.
船は予定よりも早く着いた
We have arrived sooner than we expected―ahead of time.

〈名〉A pool (in a river)

〈名〉One's own party; one's friends

2. (=閨中のお相手)bedservice:(=する) to do bedservice

without hesitation―without faltering―without any pause
淀みなく話をする

He stated his reasons without hitch or pause.
淀みなく読める本は少ない
There are few books I can read without stopping.

〈自動〉To be deposited; to be precipitated; to settle

よどむ〔淀む〕
〈自動〉
1. To stagnate

content.content: 淀んだ水
stagnant water

content: 2. (=言葉などが淀む)to hesitate; to falter; to pause

content.content: 言葉が淀んだ
He faltered in his speech.

〈名〉An earthquake; a catastrophe; a cataclysm; a revolution; a social upheaval

〈名〉The middle of the night:(=に) in the middle of the night; in the night; at dead of night

I happened to wake up in the middle of the night.

I wonder where he can be going at this time of night.

He is already snug in bed.
まだ夜中だ
He is still snug in bed.

content:

〈名〉Longness of night

content.content: 秋の夜長に

〈名〉Crying at night:(=する) to cry at night

〈他動〉
1. (=米を研ぐ)to wash (rice)
2. (=淘汰する)to select (the good); to weed out (the bad)

〈名〉Night-work:(=する) to work nights; to do night-work

〈副〉Nightly; every night; night after night

content.content: 夜な夜なあやしい婦人があの家を訪れる
A suspicious female visits that house night after night.

content:
よなれる〔世馴れる〕
〈自動〉To get used to the world

content.content: あれは世馴れた人だ
He is a man of the world.
なかなか世馴れている
He is very much of a man of the world.
まだ世馴れない青年だ
He is a green youth―a raw youth―an inexperienced youth―an unsophisticated youth.

content:
よにげ〔夜逃げ〕
〈名〉Flight by night; moonlight flitting:(=する) to fly by night; to decamp:(米国にては)to vamoose

content.content: 夜逃げでもするよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to decamp.
借金して夜逃げする
to give one's creditors the slip―“shoot the moon”
果ては夜逃げくらいが落ちだろう
The final scene will perhaps end in a moonlight flitting.

content:

content.content: よめい〔余命〕

content.content: 子どもらは余念無く遊んでいる
The children are absorbed in play―intent on play.
彼は余念無く勉強している
He is absorbed in his studies―engrossed in his studies.
余念無く働け
Go about your work with a devotion of the whole man!―Devote the whole man to your work!―Be the whole man at your work!

content:
よのおぼえ〔世の覚え〕
〈名〉Reputation; public estimation

content.content: 世の覚えめでたし

content:
よのつね〔世の常〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: よのならい〔世の習い〕

content:
よのなか〔世の中〕
〈名〉The world; life; times; things; men and things

content.content: 世の中を見る
to see the world
彼はなかなか世の中を見ている
He has seen much of life―He is a man of the world.
世の中を見ない
He has seen nothing of life―seen little of life.
世の中の事情に通じている
He is in touch with the world―in touch with the times.
世の中の事情に疎い
He is out of touch with the times―out of touch with the world―ignorant of the world.
世の中へ出る
to go out into the world―start in life
世の中へ出るとそんなウカウカしたことではいかん
You must have all your wits about you when you go out into the world.
彼は幼い時に世の中へ出てずいぶん苦労している
He was thrown upon the world in his infancy, and had many difficulties to contend with.
世の中は広い
The world is wide―(ここばかり日は照らぬの意味なら)―I have all the world before me.
世の中は広いようで狭い
The world is not so wide as it seems.
世の中はそうしたものだ
That is the way of the world―Such is life.
世の中は好くしたものだ
Things are well ordered―Everything is for the best.
世の中はこんなものだと諦めた
I take the world as it is―take things as they are.
今は昔と世の中が違う
The times have changed―Things are not what they were.
世の中は移り変わる
The times change.
せち辛い世の中だ
The times are hard―We live in hard times.
世の中は静かだ
All is silent―All is quiet.
世の中は真暗だ
All is dark.
世の中は騒がしい
The people are alarmed.
物騒な世の中だ
Here is an alarming state of things.
今は便利な世の中だ
This is the age of conveniences.
当節は金の世の中
Money is everything nowadays.
世の中は金次第
“Money makes the mare to go.”
当節は運動の世の中だ
Everything goes by interest nowadays.
いまに飛行機の世の中になる
Flying will soon be all the rage―all the mode―all the go.

content:
よのならい〔世の習い〕

content.content: 逢うて別れは世の習い

満つれば欠くるは世の習い

content:

content.content: 余病が出る、余病が併発する

余病が併発しなければ一カ月で全治する

content:

content.content: 人を手紙で呼び寄せる

content:

content:
よぶ〔呼ぶ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=呼び掛ける)to call:(高声を揚げてなら)to call to (a man); to call for (mamma); to hail (a cab, etc.)

content.content: 人の名を呼ぶ
to call a man by name
名を呼ばれた時は胸が轟いた
When I heard myself called by name, I felt a flutter in my breast.
子どもがしきりにお母さんを呼んでおった
The child was calling for mamma.
彼を呼んで危険を警戒した
I called to him to warn him of the danger.
彼を追いかけて呼んだ
I called after him.
車屋を呼んだ
I hailed a ricksha.
鳥は呼ぶと集まって来る
The birds come at your call.
呼んだら聞こえるところにおれ
Stay within call!―Keep within hearing!
もう呼んでも聞こえぬ
He is out of hearing now.
犬が怖いからそちらへ呼んで下さい
I am afraid of your dog. Will you call him off?
助けを呼ぶ
to cry for help
助けを呼ぶ声四方に起こる
Cries for help were heard on every side.

content: 2. (=呼び寄せる)to call; to summon; to procure; to bring; to fetch

content.content: 皆呼んで来い
Bring them here!
校長室へ呼ばれた
I was summoned before the principal.
彼は僕を呼びに来たのだ

医者を呼びに行く
to go for the doctor
医者を呼びに使いをやる
to send for the doctor
医者を呼べ
Go and fetch a doctor!―Procure a doctor!―Go for the doctor!―Send for the doctor!
ひと走り行って医者を呼んで来よう
I will run for the doctor.
手紙で呼ぶ
to write for one
国元から家族を呼ぼうかと思う
I think of writing home for my family.
電信で人を呼ぶ
to telegraph for―wire for―a man

I have been wired for from Osaka.
電話で人を呼ぶ
to telephone for―phone for―a man
鈴を鳴らして小使いを呼ぶ
to ring for the servant
お呼びになりましたか
Did you ring for me, sir?
俥を呼びましょうか
Shall I send for a kuruma?
自動車を呼んで下さい
Send for a taxi!―Fetch me a taxi!―Go and get me a taxi!
小僧が自動車を呼びに行きました
The boy has gone for a taxi.
芸者を呼ぶ
to call a geisha―engage a geisha

content: 3. (=何を何と称す)to call (one a madman); to style (one a benefactor); to term (a verb factitive); to designate (one as a tyrant); to address (one as sensei); to refer to (one as the general); to brand, stigmatize (one as a thief); to denounce (one as a traitor, etc.)

content.content: 世人彼を呼んで狂人と言う
People call him a madman.
人彼を呼んで先生と言う
Men call him sensei―(本人に向かってなら)―Men address him as sensei.
彼は詐欺師と呼ばれた
He was called―branded as―stigmatized as―a swindler.
彼を国賊と呼ぶ者がある
Some people call him a traitor―denounce him as a traitor.

content: 4. (=招く)to invite, ask, bid (one to dinner, etc.)

content.content: 人を呼ぶ
to give a party―give a dinner

今日は園遊会へ呼ばれた

よぼう〔予防〕

content.content: 予防は治療に勝る
Prevention is better than cure―“An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.”
伝染を予防する
to prevent infection
伝染病を予防する
to take precautionary measures against an epidemic―prevent the spread of an epidemic

The Metropolitan Police are endeavouring to prevent the spread of infectious diseases among the refugees.
予防法
a preventive (measure)―a precaution―a preservative
野外運動は罪悪の予防法になる
Field sports are a good preservative against vice.
伝染の予防法
a preventive against infection
流行病の予防策を講ずる、予防策を施す
to take preventive measures―take prophylactic measures―against an epidemic
流行病の予防策として下水工事を起こした
Sewerage works were started as a preventive against epidemics.
予防医学
preventive medicine
予防薬
a preventive―a prophylactic―a preservative
予防注射
preventive injection―inoculation
コレラ予防注射

コレラの予防注射をする
to inoculate one against cholera
コレラの予防注射を受ける

to forestall an attack
彼は世間から非難されるかと思ってしきりに予防線を張っている
He is trying to forestall public censure.

content:

content.content: 予防線を張る
to set a guard against attack―forestall attack

content:

content.content: 伝染病の予防法

content:
よほど〔余程〕
〈副〉Very; much; very much; greatly; a great deal; a good deal; considerably; far; a long way; a long time:(=の) great; considerable:(数なら)very many:(量なら)very much

content.content: 日曜にも仕事を休めないようではよほど忙しいと見える

子どもを学校へも出せないようではよほど貧乏していると見える

病人は今日はよほど快い
The invalid is much better today.
汽車がよほど後れた

彼は失敗してよほど弱っている
He is very much cast down―greatly dejected―by his failure.
この方がよほど好い
This is much the better of the two.
王子まではよほどある

そこはよほど先だ

content:
よむ〔読む〕
〈他動〉
1. To read; to peruse

content.content: 本を読む
to read a book―peruse a book―lean over a book
本が読みたくば蔵書をご用立てる
If you wish to read, my library is heartily at your service.
始めはどんな本を読んだらよいだろうか
What sort of books shall I read in the first place?
本を始めからしまいまで読む
to read through a book―read a book from cover to cover―read a book from title-page to colophon
彼はなかなか本を読む
He has good reading ability.
なかなか本を読んでいる
He is well read.
なかなか英書を読んでいる
He is well read in English authors.
広く読んでいる
He has read extensively―His reading is extensive.
この本はざっと読んだ
I have made a cursory reading of the book―skimmed over the book.
あの人は飛び飛びに本を読む
He makes a desultory reading―He is a desultory reader―He skips from one book to another.
俺の家へ来れば本は読み放題だ
If you will come to live with me, you may read as many books as you like―you shall have the run of my library.
読みきれないほど本を持っている
I have more books than I can read.
手当たり次第に本を読んだ

この本は読む価値がある

僕は眠くない時は本を読んで寝る

君は字が読めるか

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この字が読めない

読んで字の如し

読んで字の如く彼は成人せる赤ん坊だ

一字一字味わって読む

一字一字拾って読む

むずかしいところを飛ばして読む
to skip over hard passages

貪り読む
to devour

読んでご覧面白いから
You will find it interesting.

経を読む

あの人の本を読むのはお経を読むようだ

歌を読む
to compose a poem―write an ode―indite a couplet
あの人は歌を読む

content:
よめ〔嫁〕
〈名〉(花嫁)a bride:(新婚の妻)a newly married wife:(姑から見れば)a daughter-in-law

content.content: お嫁に行く
to marry (a man)―get married (to a man)―marry into a family
もうお嫁に行ってもよい年だ
She is old enough to marry―of an age to get married―of a marriageable age.
まだお嫁に行くには早い
She is too young to marry―not yet marriageable age.
まだお嫁に行ける
She is young enough to marry―still of marriageable age.
もうお嫁に行くには遅い
She is too old to marry―past her marriageable age.
娘どもは皆相応なところへ嫁に行っている

あの子は好いところへ嫁に行った
She has made a good match.
医者のところへ嫁に行った

娘がどうしても(いくら説いても)嫁に行かない

to give a daughter in marriage―marry a daughter to a man―marry a daughter into a family
娘を相応なところへ嫁にやりたいと思う

娘を弁護士のところへ嫁にやりました

嫁を取る、嫁を貰う、嫁を迎える

嫁にする
to take a woman to wife―marry a woman
伜{せがれ}に嫁を取ってやらなければならない
I must find a wife for my son.
伜に嫁を取って安心しました
I am happy in my son's marriage.
彼は金持ちの嫁を貰った
He has married a fortune.
財産が目的で嫁に貰う
to marry for money
あれは好い嫁だ
She is a good match―He has an excellent match in her.
君は好い嫁を貰った
You have made a good match―made a good choice―I admire your taste.
妙な嫁さんを貰ったものだ
There is no accounting for tastes.
あの子は嫁さんぶりが好いだろう
She will play the bride well―bride it well.
嫁さんは鬼も十七のおぼこだ
She is a blushing bride of sweet seventeen.
嫁と反物は昼間選べ
“Choose neither a woman nor linen by candlelight.”
嫁と姑のよう
There is no love lost between them.

content:
よめ〔夜目〕
〈名〉Seeing at night

content.content: 夜目遠目傘の中
Lamplight, distance or an umbrella makes every woman look beautiful.

content:
よめい〔余命〕
〈名〉The remainder of one's life; the rest of one's days

content.content: 彼は過去の罪滅しに余命を慈善事業に送った
In order to atone for the past, he spent the rest of his days in works of charity.
フランスでは早く隠退して余命を楽しむ人が多い
Many Frenchmen early retire from active life to enjoy the remainder of their lives.
彼は余命いくばくも無し
He has not long to live―He is not long for this world.

content:
よめいり〔嫁入り〕
〈名〉(A woman's) marriage:(=する) to marry; to get married

content.content: 今が嫁入り盛りだ
She is a marriageable age.
嫁入り支度、嫁入道具
trousseau―paraphernalia
狐の嫁入り
(a sort of) witches' sabbath―Walpurgis-night

よめな〔嫁菜〕
〈名〉A wild-growing vegetable (Aster indicus)

content:
よめる〔読める〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=読むことができる)can read

content.content: 君は Macaulay が読めるか
Can you read Macaulay?
日本の英学者は本は読めるが会話ができない
Japanese students of English read very well, but can not speak.
この本は学生にも読める
The book is within the reach of the student.
いや、学生には読めない
No, it is beyond the reach of the student.

content: 2. (=読まれる)to be read

content.content: ここはこうもああも読める
The passage may be read in several ways―There are several readings of the passage.

content: 3. (=読み得る)to be legible

content.content: あの人の筆跡は読めない筆跡だ
He writes an illegible hand―a crabbed hand.

content: 4. (=面白く読める)to read well; to be readable

content.content: この雑誌はちょっと読める
This magazine reads quite well―It is rather good reading―It is a rather readable magazine.

content: 5. (=わかる)to understand; to perceive; to see

content.content: 読めた読めた
I see!―I perceive!
やっと読めた、だから先生出て来ないんだね
I see it now! That's why he does not appear.

content:
よも
〈副〉→『

content.content: よもや

content:
よも〔四方〕
〈名〉The four quarters; all direction:(=の) on every side

content.content: 四方の山辺を見渡せば
As I look out over the hills on every side,...

よもぎ〔艾〕
〈名〉A kind of sage; the moxa-plant

よもすがら〔夜もすがら〕
〈副〉All night; all the night through; throughout the night

content:
よもや
〈副〉
1. Surely (can not); (can not) possibly, by any possibility

content.content: よもや本当であるまい
Surely it can not be true―It can not possibly be true―It can not by any possibility be true.
彼はよもやそんなことは言うまい
Surely he can not have said so―He can not possibly have said so―He can scarcely have said so.
彼はよもやそんなことはすまい
Surely he can not have done such a thing―Surely he must be the last man to do such a thing.
彼はよもやそんな卑怯なことはすまい
Surely he can not have done such a mean thing―Surely he must be above such meanness.
よもやそうでもあるまい
Surely it can not be so―It can not possibly be so―It can not by any possibility be so.
なんぼ因業な高利貸しでもよもやそんな無理を言うまい
Surely the most unconscionable usurer can not be so unreasonable.
あなたも男の意地なればよもや見捨てはなさるまい
As you are a man of honour, you surely will not abandon me.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: そんな成功はよもやと思った
I dared not hope for such a success.
不治の病人が治ると聞いてよもやと思った
When I was told that the incurable would recover, I dared not hope for its truth―did not know what I dared hope.
よもやと思ったがやはり本当だった
I dared not hope for its truth―thought my hopes were too wild―but it has proved true after all.
よもやと思った望みが叶った
My wildest hopes are fulfilled.

content:
よもやま〔四方山〕
〈形〉Various

content.content: 四方山の話
various subjects―indifferent topics―general conversation
四方山の話をした
We talked on indifferent topics.
それから四方山の話に移った
Then the conversation became general.

content:
よやく〔予約〕
〈名〉
1. Previous engagement; reservation:(=する) to engage beforehand; to bespeak (a room); to have (a berth) reserved; to book (a seat) in advance

content.content: 旅館の一室を予約する
to bespeak a room in a hotel
芝居の場所を予約する
to book a seat in advance
一桝予約してある
I have booked a box in advance―A box is (previously) booked.
汽車の寝台を予約する
to have a berth reserved for one
寝台が予約してある
A berth is reserved for me―I have a berth reserved for me.

content: 2. (=本の予約)subscription:(=する) to subscribe for (a book)

content.content: 本を予約で出版する
to publish a book by subscription
予約出版
publication by subscription
僕も一部予約しよう
I will subscribe for a copy.
予約は締め切りになりました
The term of subscription has closed.
予約者
a subscriber

content:
よゆう〔余裕〕
〈名〉Reserve; something to spare; a margin

content.content: 余裕が有る
to have something in reserve―have something to spare
君は金の余裕が有る
You have money to spare.
それをするだけの金の余裕が有る
You can afford to do that.
僕は金の余裕が無い
I have no money to spare.
そんな物を買う余裕が無い
I can not afford to buy such things.
そんなぜいたくをする余裕が無い
I can not afford such extravagance.
貧乏だからそんな余裕が無い
I am too poor to afford it.
君は金持ちだから馬車くらい抱える余裕が有る
You are rich enough to afford a carriage.
時間の余裕が有る
to have time to spare
時間の余裕がある人は読むべき本だ
Those who have time (to spare) should read the book.
からだに余裕が無い
I have no time to spare―I have not a minute that I can call my own.
余裕を付ける
to leave a margin―allow for something
こわれ物を見越して余裕を付けて送る(余裕を付けて計算する)
to allow for breakage
綽々{しゃくしゃく}として余裕あり
He has much in reserve―a great reserve of energy.
彼は一日十時間働いても余裕綽々だ
With ten hours a day's teaching, he is ready for more.

content:
よよ
〈副〉

content.content: 女はよよとばかりに泣き伏した
She broke down and cried as if her heart would break.

content:
よよ〔代々〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: だいだい〔代々〕

content:
より
〈前置詞相当〉From; out of; since

content.content: 友遠方より来たる
A friend comes from afar.
植物は地より生ず
Plants grow out of the earth.
彼は大学を卒業してより実業界に在り
He has been in business since his graduation.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 日は東より出る
The sun rises in the east.
授業は九月一日より開始す
School begins on the First of September.
本法律は本月十日より実施す
The law comes into force on and after the tenth inst.

content: 〈接続詞〉Than

content.content: 月よりも明らかなり
It is brighter than the moon.
学者というより文章家だ
He is more of a writer than a scholar―He is not so much a scholar as a writer.
成功した者は君よりほかに無い
No other man has succeeded than you―No one has succeeded but you.
待つよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to wait―We must wait.
武士は生命より名を貴ぶ
The samurai values honour above life.

content:
より〔依り〕
〈前置詞相当〉→『

content.content: よって〔依て〕

content:
より〔寄り〕
〈名〉(=集り方)gathering; collection

content.content: 人の寄りが好い、寄りが悪い
There is a good gathering―a poor gathering―of people.
金の寄りが好い、寄りが悪い
Money collects well―collects badly.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉(=傾ける)by

content.content: 東寄りの北
north by east

content:
より〔縒り〕
〈名〉
1. Twist

content.content: 縒りをかける
to give a rope a twist―give a rope a firmer twist
絹糸に縒りをかける
to throw silk
縒りがかかる
The thread gets a twist.
糸は縒りがかかっている
The threads are hard as nails.
腕に縒りをかける
to do one's utmost―strive to the utmost―strain every nerve
腕に縒りをかけてそんな人を捜してみよう
I will strive to the utmost to find such a man.
縒りを戻す
to untwist a rope―(旧情を温めるの意味なら)―renew old relations
縒りを戻す気は無いか
Won't you return to your former love?
縒りが戻る、縒りが返る
to get untwisted―(運動家などの鍛えた身体なら)―get out of form―lose one's form

content: 2. (=何本縒りの縒り)ply

content.content: 二本縒りの縄、三本縒りの縄
a two-ply rope―a three-ply rope

content:
よりあい〔寄合い〕
〈名〉
1. (=会合)a meeting

content.content: 同業者の寄り合いがある

content: 2. (=寄り集まり)a promiscuous gathering

content.content: 大火後は方々から避難して来て寄り合い世帯になっている
Since the great fire, several families have taken refuge in our house, and formed a promiscuous household.

よりあう〔寄り合う〕
〈自動〉To meet together

content:
よりあつまり〔寄集まり〕
〈名〉A gathering; a promiscuous gathering

content.content: なんというばかの寄り集まりだろう
What a set of fools!

content:
よりあつまる〔寄り集まる〕
〈自動〉To gather; to come together; to flock together

content.content: 夏は海岸へ人が寄り集まる
In summer, people flock to the seaside.
市民は皇居前の広場に寄り集まった
The townsfolk gathered in the open space in front of the Imperial Palace.
ここは夏場人の寄り集まるところだ
This is a summer resort.

よりいと〔縒糸〕
〈名〉Twisted thread:(絹糸なら)thrown silk; singles

content:
よりかかる〔寄り掛かる〕
〈他動〉To lean against (the wall); to lean on (the table); to recline (on a couch)

content.content: 壁に寄り掛かる
to lean against the wall
壁に寄り掛かって日なたぼっこをしている
He is basking in the sun with his back against the wall.
柱に寄り掛かって思案に暮れていた
He was leaning against a post, lost in meditation.
机に寄り掛かって居眠りしておった
He was leaning on the desk and dozing.
食卓に寄り掛かるものでない
You should not lean on―rest your elbows on―the table.
大砲に寄り掛かってはいかん
Lean off―Stand off―that gun!

よりき〔与力〕
〈名〉A constable (of the Tokugawa regime)

content:
よりきらい〔選り嫌い〕
