content:
よりごのみ〔選り好み〕
〈名〉Over-nicety in choice:(=する) to be over-nice in one's choice; to be nice, be particular, be fastidious (about anything)

content.content: 僕はあまり人の選り好みしない
I am not very particular about men.
あまり選り好みするとかえって屑を取るぞ
If you are over-nice in choosing, you will end by making a bad choice―“Go farther and fare worse.”

よりすがる〔寄り縋る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=縋る)to cling to (anything)
2. (=頼る)to rely on, depend on (one)

content:
よりそう〔寄り添う〕
〈他動〉To draw near

content.content: 怖くなって互いに寄り添った
They became frightened and drew closer to each other.

よりだす〔選り出す〕
〈他動〉To pick out, single out, cull out, sort out (the best)

content:
よりつき〔寄付き〕
〈名〉The opening of a session (on the Exchange)

content.content: 寄付値段
the opening price

content:
よりつく〔寄り付く〕
〈他動〉To get near (one); to approach (one)

content.content: 皆彼を怖がって寄り付かぬ
Everybody shuns him―gives him a wide berth.
彼は遠慮して寄り付かぬ
He keeps his distance―keeps at a respectful distance.
皆彼の足下にも寄り付けぬ
They can not come near him―can not hold a candle to him.
英語では彼の足下にも寄り付く者が無い
No one can touch him―No one can hold a candle to him―in English.

content:
よりどころ〔拠所〕
〈名〉Foundation (for a rumour) grounds (for a supposition); authority(for one's statement); something to go by

content.content: 拠り所有る
(説)a well-grounded theory―(報)―authentic news
拠り所無き
(風説)an unfounded rumour―a groundless rumour―(説)―an ill-grounded theory―(報)―unauthentic news―mythical information
君がそう言うのは何か拠り所があるのか
Have you any authority for your statement?
どういう拠り所が有ってそう言うのか
On what authority do you say so?―What is the authority for your statement?
充分拠り所が有ってそう思うのだ
There are ample grounds for my thinking so.
この風説は拠り所が無い
There is no foundation for this rumour―This rumour is unfounded―groundless.
この説は拠り所が有る、拠り所が無い
The theory is well grounded―ill grounded―The theory has no leg to stand on.
その報道は拠り所が有る、拠り所が無い
The information is authentic―unauthentic―mythical.
その信仰は拠り所が無い
There is no foundation for the faith―The faith is without foundation.
この信仰は真理に拠り所が有る
The faith is founded on truth.
この議論は拠り所が薄弱だ
The grounds of the argument are flimsy.
この事業は僕が嚆矢{こうし}だから何も拠り所が無かった
I was a pioneer in the work, and had nothing to go by.

content:
よりどり〔選取り〕
〈名〉Choice:(=する) to take one's choice

content.content: 選り取り一円
You may take your choice for one yen―You have your choice for one yen.

よりどる〔選り取る〕
〈自動〉To take one's choice
〈他動〉To choose, select, pick out (the best)

content:
よりぬき〔選り抜き〕
〈名〉The choice (of the men); the pick (of the basket); the cream (of a party); a selection (of one's works):(=の) picked (men); choice (extracts); select (works, etc.)

content.content: 選り抜きの品
choice articles―select articles―the pick of the basket
選り抜きの人
picked men―the pick of the men―the choice of the men

content:
よりぬく〔選り抜く〕
〈他動〉To choose, select, single out, pick out, cull out, sort out, pick and choose (the best)

content.content: 大勢の中から選り抜く
to choose from among many
この中から一人選り抜け
Choose one out of the number!

よりば〔寄場〕
〈名〉
1. (=人の集まるところ)a resort
2. (=立ち寄るところ)a place of call

content:
よりみち〔寄り路〕
〈名〉Stopping on the way:(=する) to stop on the way

content.content: 寄り路しないでまっすぐにお帰りなさい
Go home straight without stopping on the way!

よりめ〔寄り目〕
〈名〉Convergent squint; convergent strabismus; cross-eyed strabismus:(=の) cross-eyed

よりめ〔縒り目〕
〈名〉(=縄の縒り目)Lay

content:
よりょく〔余力〕
〈名〉Reserve strength; reserve of energy; superfluous power; anything to spare

content.content: 彼は充分に余力を蓄えている
He has a great reserve of energy.
僕は金の余力が無い
I have no money to spare.
専門家は余力が無い
A profession is engrossing―He is engrossed in his profession.

content:
よりより〔寄り寄り〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: おりおり〔折々〕

よりわける〔選り分ける〕
〈他動〉To sort out, assort, classify (goods); to pick out, single out, sort out (one kind); to separate, sift, winnow (the good from the bad)

content:
よる〔依る〕
〈他動〉
1. To depend on, hang on, turn on, hinge on (something)

content.content: 成功は忍耐に依る
Success depends on perseverance.
売れ行きは品に依る
The sale depends on the quality.
勝敗は必ずしも数の多少に依るものにあらず
Victory does not always depend on numbers.
それは時と場合に依る
That depends (on circumstances).
それは人に依りますね
That depends on the person.
彼の生命の有無は一に裁判官の判決に依る
His life hangs on the judge's decision.
この争論を決するはこの一点に依る
The whole controversy turns on this one point.
お受けするとせぬとは条件に依ります
My acceptance will hinge on the terms―I shall hinge my acceptance on the terms―My acceptance is conditional on the terms.
財源に依る(財源に依て資を得る)
to draw on one's resources
人は見掛けに依らぬもの
Do not judge of a man by his looks.
よって〔依て〕

content:
よる〔寄る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=近寄る)to approach; to draw near

content.content: もっとお寄りなさい
Please draw nearer!
もっと寄ってお当たりなさい
Draw nearer to the fire!
もっとソバへ寄ってご覧なさい
Draw nearer and have a better look!―Take a nearer view of the article!
ソバへ寄るな
Stand off!
君などはとてもソバへも寄れぬ
You can not come near him―You are no match for him―You are not a patch upon him―You can not hold a candle to him.
脇へ寄る
to draw to one side―draw aside
こちら側へ寄れ
Draw to this side!
少し脇へ寄って一行を通して上げて下さい
Please make way for the party!
彼は僕のソバへ寄っていた
He was at my side.
今に懲りるから寄らず触らずに見ているがよい
You had better look on without meddling till he learns by experience.

content: 2. (=寄り集まる)to gather; to come together; to flock together; to meet

content.content: 彼らは寄ればきっと人の悪口だ
They can not come together without picking their neighbours to pieces.
目の寄るところに玉
“Birds of a feather flock together.”
三人寄れば文殊の智慧
“Two heads are better than one”―“There is safety in the number of counsellors.”
あそこは夏場人の寄る所だ
That is a summer resort.
人が外人のまわりに寄ってたかった
People crowded about the stranger.
世間では寄ると触るとその話で持ち切っている
People can not meet without talking about that.

content: 3. (=立ち寄る)to look in, drop in (upon one); to stop at, call at, look in at (a place)

content.content: お帰りにお寄りなさい
Please look in on your way home.
こちらの方ヘおいでの説はぜひお寄り下さい
If you ever come up this way, do not fail to look in upon me.
ついでに寄って来よう
I'll look in by the way.
そこへ友人が二三人偶然寄ってくれた
Some friends dropped in―blew in―at the moment.
途中仙台へ寄って行きます
I shall stop at Sendai on the way.
この列車は次の停車場へ寄りますか
Do we stop at the next station?
船が港へ寄る
A ship stops at―calls at―touches at―puts in at―a port.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 年が寄る
to grow old―advance in age―age
彼は年が寄っている
He is old―advanced in age―stricken in years.
皺が寄る
to wrinkle
皺の寄った顔
a wrinkled face
皺の寄って婆さんだ
She is a wrinkled old woman.
美人の顔に皺が寄る
Time ravages a beautiful face―A beautiful face shows the ravages of time.
彼女の顔も皺が寄った
Her face shows the ravages of Father Time―shows the assaults of old Time.→『にたりよったり〔似たり寄ったり〕』

content:
よる〔拠る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=従う)to act upon, proceed upon, go upon (some principle); to go by (some rule)

content.content: 僕はいつもこの主義に拠る
I always act upon―proceed upon―this principle.
拠るべき事実がない
I have no data to go upon.
僕はいつも「己の欲するところ人にもこれを施せ」なる金言に拠って事を為す
I always act upon the Golden Maxim, “Do to others as you would be done by”.
彼は規則に拠って何事もする
He does everything by rule.
この規則に拠ると便利だ
This is a good rule to go by.→『よりどころ〔拠所〕』→『よれば〔拠れば〕』

content: 2. (=立てこもる)to hold (a castle); to occupy (a position); to take to (a fastness)

content.content: 城に拠る
to hold a castle
その城に拠って敵を防いだ
They held the castle against the enemy.
敵は堅固な陣地に拠る
The enemy holds a strong position.
地の利に拠る
to hold an advantageous position
要害に拠る
to take to a fastness
天嶮に拠って敵を防いだ
They betook themselves to a mountain-fastness to defend themselves against the enemy.
露軍は退いて奉天に拠る
The Russians retreated on Mukden―fell back upon Mukden.
それは彼らが拠ってもって金城鉄壁とするところのものである
This is their tower of strength.
これは彼が拠ってもって米櫃とするところのものである
This is his means of livelihood.

content:
よる〔選る〕
〈他動〉To choose, select, pick out, single out, call out, sort out (the best)

content.content: 選りに選る
to pick and choose the very best
選りに選った品
choice articles―select articles―the pick of the basket
選りに選った人
picked men―the choice of the men

content:
よる〔夜〕
〈名〉Night:(副詞に用いれば)at night; by night:(=の) nocturnal

content.content: 夜になる
Night falls―Night comes on.
夜になった
It is night.
星は夜出る
The stars come out at night.
昼寝て夜働く者がある
Some people sleep by day and work by night.
夜はアラが見えない
Personal defects are not seen by lamplight.
夜寝る前にこの薬を飲みなさい
Take the medicine the last thing in the evening.
三日の夜
on the night of the 3rd
こんな夜に眠られようか
Can I sleep on such a night?
夜遅く着いた
I arrived late at night.
彼は夜遅くまで起きている
He sits up till late at night.
夜遅くまで勉強する
He works till late at night―works far into the night.
夜に乗じて攻撃を行う
An attack was delivered under cover of night.
夜の物
bedding―bedclothes
梟は夜の鳥だ
The owl is a nocturnal bird.

content:
よる〔由る、因る〕
〈他動〉To be due to (some cause); to be owing to (some cause); to be attributable to (some cause); to be caused by (something)

content.content: 僕の成功は君の助力に因る
My success is due to―all owing to―to be attributed to―your assistance I―I owe my success to your assistance―I must thank you for my success.
君の成功失敗は君自身に因るのだ
Your success or failure will be due to yourself―all owing to yourself―You will owe your success or failure to yourself―You will have to thank yourself for your success or failure.
この大捷は一に陛下の御稜威{みいつ}に由る
The signal victory we have gained is due to the glorious virtues of His Majesty.
社会の進歩は主に教育に由る
Social progress is mainly due to education.
潮の満干は月の引力に由る
The tides are caused by the gravitation of the moon.
その由って来たるところ甚だ深し
The cause is very deep.
そこにこの弊害の由って来たる本源がある
There lies the source of the evil.

content:
よる〔由る、因る〕
〈他動〉To be due to (some cause); to be owing to (some cause); to be attributable to (some cause); to be caused by (something)

content.content: 僕の成功は君の助力に因る
My success is due to―all owing to―to be attributed to―your assistance I―I owe my success to your assistance―I must thank you for my success.
君の成功失敗は君自身に因るのだ
Your success or failure will be due to yourself―all owing to yourself―You will owe your success or failure to yourself―You will have to thank yourself for your success or failure.
この大捷は一に陛下の御稜威{みいつ}に由る
The signal victory we have gained is due to the glorious virtues of His Majesty.
社会の進歩は主に教育に由る
Social progress is mainly due to education.
潮の満干は月の引力に由る
The tides are caused by the gravitation of the moon.
その由って来たるところ甚だ深し
The cause is very deep.
そこにこの弊害の由って来たる本源がある
There lies the source of the evil.

content:
よる〔倚る、凭る〕
〈他動〉To lean (on a desk―against the wall)

content.content: 机に倚る
to learn on one's desk
机に倚って読書する
to read at one's desk
椅子に倚る
to sit on a chair―sit in a chair

content:
よる〔倚る、凭る〕
〈他動〉To lean (on a desk―against the wall)

content.content: 机に倚る
to learn on one's desk
机に倚って読書する
to read at one's desk
椅子に倚る
to sit on a chair―sit in a chair

content:
よる〔縒る〕
〈他動〉To twist

content.content: 紙を縒る
to twist a slip of paper
絹糸を縒る
to throw silk
腹の皮を縒る
to split one's sides with laughter

content:
よるとさわると〔寄ると触ると〕
〈副〉(They) can not meet without, never meet without (doing something)

content.content: 世間では寄ると触るとその話で持切っている
People never meet without talking about that.

よるひる〔夜昼〕
〈副〉Night and day

content:
よるべ〔寄る辺〕
〈名〉Some one to depend upon

content.content: 寄る辺無き
helpless―forlorn
寄る辺無き身です
(寡婦なら)She is a forlorn widow―(孤児なら)―He is a helpless orphan without kith or kin.
寄辺渚の捨小舟
I am thrown upon the world―thrown upon my own resources.

よるよなか〔夜夜中〕
〈副〉In the middle of the night; at dead of night

content:
よれつ〔四列〕
〈名〉Four rows

content.content: 四列縦隊
a column of fours
四列縦隊に並ぶ
to form fours
四列横隊
a line four deep
四列横隊に並ぶ
to form a line four deep
四列横隊に並んでいる
They are drawn up four deep.
四列で進行する
to march four abreast

content:
よれば〔拠れば〕
〈前置詞相当〉According to; from

content.content: 彼の言うところによればそうらしい
According to his statement, such seems to be the case.
皆の話によれば彼は無罪らしい
According to all accounts, he seems to be innocent.
新聞の報道によれば事態容易ならぬ
According to the papers, the matter grows serious.
聞くところによれば彼は辞職するそうだ
From what I hear, he seems to be going to resign―I hear that he is going to resign.

よれる〔縒れる〕
〈自動〉To be twisted; to get twisted

content:
よろい〔鎧〕
〈名〉An armour

content.content: 鎧を着る
to buckle on an armour
鎧を着ている
They are in armour.
鎧武者
a warrior in armour―an armoured warrior

よろいど〔鎧戸〕
〈名〉A Venetian blind; louvers; persiennes

よろいどおし〔鎧通し〕
〈名〉A misericord

よろいびつ〔鎧櫃〕
〈名〉An armour case

よろける
〈自動〉To stagger; to totter

content:
よろこばしい〔悦ばしい〕
〈形〉Joyful (news); joyous (event); glad (tidings); delightful (result); pleasing (sight); pleasant (time, etc.)

content.content: いまに悦ばしい便りが聞ける
We shall soon hear joyful news―glad tidings.
皆悦ばしそうな顔をしている
Everybody has a glad countenance―Joy sits on every countenance.
君の成功は実に悦ばしい
I am very glad of your success―I rejoice over your success.
こんな悦ばしいことは無い
Nothing can be more joyful.

content:
よろこばす〔悦ばす〕
〈他動〉To rejoice; to gladden; to please; to delight

content.content: 彼は親を悦ばせたさに勉強するのだ
He works hard from a desire to please his parents.
日本料理は目を悦ばせるために作る(目のご馳走)
Japanese cooking is meant to please the eye.
心を悦ばせる
to please the fancy
酒は人の心を悦ばせる
“Wine maketh glad the heart of man.”

content:
よろこび〔悦び〕
〈名〉
1. (=喜悦)joy; gladness; delight; glee

content.content: その悦び察すべし
His joy may be imagined.
その悦びいかばかり
What was his joy!―What was not his joy!
皆大悦びです
Everybody is rejoiced―delighted.
その報に接した時の彼の悦びは溢れるばかりであった
He was overjoyed at the news.
顔に悦びの色を浮かべた
His face beamed with joy―Joy sat on his countenance.
目に悦びの色を浮かべた
His eyes sparkled with joy―His eyes kindled with joy.
皆大悦びで(悦び勇んで)出かけた
They went out in high glee―full of glee.
その悦び限り無し
His joy knows no bounds.
悦びあれば悲しみあり
“No joy without alloy.”
悦びと悲しみ相半ばす
I feel mingled joy and sorrow.

content: 2. (=祝賀)congratulation; felicitation

content.content: お悦びを申し上げます
I offer my congratulations―I wish you joy―Give you joy!
このたびは高等学校へ御入学の由お悦び申上候
Allow me to congratulate you on your successful entrance into the High School.

content:
よろこびいさむ〔悦び勇む〕
〈自動〉To be delighted; to be in high glee; to be full of glee

content.content: 皆悦び勇んで出かけた
They went out in high glee―full of glee.
彼は洋行ができるので悦び勇んでいる
He is delighted at the prospect of going abroad.

よろこびごと〔悦び事〕
〈名〉A happy event; a matter for joy; a matter for congratulation

content:
よろこぶ〔悦ぶ〕
〈自動〉To rejoice, be rejoiced (at the sight or news―over some event); to be glad (of something); to be pleased (at something); to be delighted (at something); to congratulate oneself (on one's escape); to hug oneself (on or for one's success, etc.)

content.content: 女房悦べ、伜がお役に立ったぞや
Rejoice, wife! our boy has proved of service to his lord.
子どもがお母さんを見て悦んだ
The child rejoiced at the sight of its mother―rejoiced to see its mother.
国民が捷報に接して悦んだ
The people rejoiced at the news of victory―rejoiced over the victory.
これ天の与えと悦んだ
I rejoiced over the godsend.
小躍りして悦ぶ
to dance for joy
皆、試験が済んで悦んでいる
Everybody is glad that the examination is over―glad of the examination being over.
彼は山が当たったので非常に悦んでいる
He is overjoyed―rejoiced beyond measure―over the success of his speculation.
彼は危ないところを助かって悦んでいる
He congratulates himself on his narrow escape.
僕はよっぽど果報者だと思って悦んだ
I congratulated myself on my good luck.
彼は成功して悦んでいる
He is glad that he has succeeded―He is glad of his success―He rejoices over his success―He hugs himself on his success.
彼が全快したので家族は悦んでいる
His people are rejoicing over his recovery―He has recovered to the joy of his people.
彼は人を困らせて悦んでいる
He takes a malicious pleasure in annoying people.
彼女はお世辞を言われてたいそう悦んだ
She felt herself highly flattered by the compliment.
これは悦ぶべきことだ
It is a matter for joy―a matter for congratulation―We have cause for joy.
悦んで
willingly―gladly―joyfully―with joy―with pleasure―with all one's heart
悦んで人を迎える
to receive one with joy―welcome one with open arms
そういう仕事なら悦んでお引き受けする
I shall be glad―pleased―delighted―happy―to undertake such work.
悦んで参ります
Willingly―Most willingly―will I go.
悦んで致します
With pleasure―With all my heart.
習いたけりゃ悦んで教えて上げる
If you with to learn, I will teach you with pleasure.
この計画を悦ばない者がある
Some people look on the project with cold eyes.

content:
よろしい〔宜しい〕
〈形〉
1. Good; well; right; fit; proper

content.content: これは宜しい品です
This is a good article.
それで宜しい
That's right―That'll do.
誰か宜しい人がありませんか
Can't you think of some fit and proper person?
宜しいやってみよう
Very well, I will try.
ご病気はお宜しいですか
Are you well?
少し宜しい
I am a little better.

content: 2. (=何々するは宜しい)(It is) right, proper (to do so)

content.content: 金を浪費するのは宜しくない
It is not right―wrong―to waste money.
君は先生の悪口を言うのは宜しくないぜ
It is wrong of you to speak ill of your teacher.
場合によっては虚言をついても宜しいものか
Is it right to tell a lie under some circumstances?
家の中で外套を着ても宜しいか
Is it proper to wear an overcoat indoors?

content: 3. (=それで宜しい)(That) will do

content.content: 今日はこれで宜しい
That'll do for today.
当分これだけ有れば宜しい
This sum will do for the present.
(どの紙を上げましょうかと問われて)どの紙でも宜しい
Any paper will do―answer the purpose―serve my turn.
何でも宜しい
Anything will do.
どららでも宜しい
Either will do.
ペンが無けりゃ鉛筆で宜しい
If you have no pen, a pencil will do as well.
明日で宜しいか
Will tomorrow do?
いつでも宜しい
Any time will do.
五十円も有れば宜しいか
Will fifty yen do?
いくらでも宜しい
Any sum will do.
この室は僕の書斎にちょうど宜しい
This room will do for my study.
この本は参考書には宜しかろうが教科書には宜しくない
This book may do for reference, but not for a text-book.

content: 4. (=何々するが宜しい)(you will) do well (to do so); (you) ought (to do so)

content.content: 君は早く帰るが宜しい
You will do well to return quickly.
もっと勉強するが宜しい
You ought to work harder.
彼に尋ねてみるが宜しい
You ought to ask him.
こう長く降ったから天気になっても宜しいわけだ
It ought to be fine after this long rain.
こういう場合にはどうしたら宜しいものか
What ought one to do in such case?
その金を返せば宜しかったに
You ought to have paid the money.
謝まれば宜しかったに
You ought to have apologized.

content: 5. (=何々しても宜しい)(You) may; (I) do not mind (doing so); I have no objection to (doing so)

content.content: タバコを飲んで宜しい
You may smoke―I permit you to smoke.
帰っても宜しい
You may go―You are at liberty to go.
何をしても宜しい
You may do anything―You are at liberty to do anything―You are welcome to do anything.
君は去っても宜しい
You may go away―You are at liberty to leave―You are welcome to leave.
僕も行っても宜しい
I don't mind going―I have no objection to going.
夜学を教えても宜しい
I don't mind teaching evenings―I have no objection to teaching evenings.
僕が来ても宜しいか
May I come?―Don't you mind my coming?―Have you no objection to my coming?
君は来たけりゃ来ても宜しい
You may come―I don't mind your coming―I have no objection to your coming.
いっしょに行っても宜しい
I don't mind going with you―I don't care if I go with you―I have no objection to going with you.
少々は飲んでも宜しいが酔っては宜しくない
You may drink a little, but you must not make yourself drunk.

content: 6. (=何々さえすれば宜しい)(You) have only to (do so)

content.content: 勉強さえすれば宜しい
You have only to work hard.
金を返しさえすれば宜しい
You have only to pay the money.
明日までに返事をすれば宜しい
You may give an answer by tomorrow―You need not give an answer before tomorrow.
断って入れば宜しいでしょう
I have only to ask permission to enter, haven't I?

content: 7. (=何々する方が宜しい)(I) would rather (do so); (you) had better (do so);(I) may as well (do so)

content.content: 生きて恥を掻くならいっそ死んだ方が宜しい
I would rather die than live in dishonour.
君は自分で行った方が宜しい
You had better go yourself―I would advise you to go yourself.
彼に事実を打ち明けた方が宜しかろう
I may as well tell him the truth.
このことは誰にも言わずにおく方が宜しい
You had better keep the matter to yourself―I may as well keep the matter to myself.
君はそうした方が宜しかったに
You had better have done so.
一時借りておいた方が宜しかったに
You had better have borrowed it for a time.

content: 8. (=何々したのが宜しい)(you have) done well (in doing so)

content.content: 君は事実を打ち明けたのが宜しかった
You have done well in telling me the truth.
君は来てくれて宜しかった
You have done well in coming―It was fortunate that you came.

content: 9. (=何々しなくとも宜しい)(You) need not (do so)

content.content: その金は返さなくとも宜しい
You need not pay the money.
この本なら買わなくとも宜しかったに
You need not have bought the book―You might have spared yourself the trouble of buying the book.

content: 10. (=何々が無くとも宜しい)(can) do without (something)

content.content: この金は当分無くとも宜しい
I can do without this money for the present.
あの人は居なくとも宜しい
I can do without him―He can be done without.
飯はもう宜しい
I want no more rice.

content: 11. (=何でも宜しい)any

content.content: どの本でも宜しいから貸してくれ給え
Lend me any book!
どの紙でも宜しいからくれ給え
Give me any paper!
いくらでも宜しいからくれてやり給え
Give him any sum!
その話は嘘でも本当でも宜しいから聞かしてくれ給え
Let me hear the story whether it may be true or false!

content: 12. (=どうでも宜しい)(I) do not care; (it) does not matter

content.content: 僕はどうでも宜しい
I don't care how it is.
どちらでも宜しい
I don't care which―Either will do.
どちらが勝っても宜しい
I don't care which side my win―It doesn't matter which side may win.
一二の差はどうでも宜しい
One more or less does not matter―One more or less makes no difference to me―One more or less is indifferent to me―no matter―of no consequence.
そんなことはどうでも宜しい
Such things are indifferent to me―all one to me―of no consequence―I am indifferent about such things―careless about such things―I don't care about such things.
そんなことはどうでも宜しいと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence.
そんなことはどうでも宜しかりそうなものだ
Such things can be of no consequence.
酒や女は有っても無くても宜しい
Wine and woman are indifferent to me―I am indifferent to wine and woman.

content: 13. (=そうなら宜しいが)I wish it were so

content.content: 私は男に生まれりゃ宜しかった
I wish I were born a man.
この家がいま少し大きけりゃ宜しかったが
I wish this house were a little larger.
君の病気が早く治れば宜しいが
I wish you would get well soon.
彼は及第すれば宜しいが
I wish he would pass.
明日天気になれば宜しいが
I wish the weather would be fine tomorrow.

content: 14. (=何々しなければ宜しいが)I fear lest I should (fail)

content.content: 今度落第しなけれゃ宜しいが
I fear lest I should fail this time.
彼は死ななけりゃ宜しいが
I am afraid lest he should die.
明日雨が降らなけりゃ宜しいが
I am afraid lest it should rain tomorrow―I wish it would not rain tomorrow.
彼は落第と聞いて発狂でもしなけりゃ宜しいが
I fear lest he should go mad at the news of his failure.
僕はこれが宜しい
I like this.
僕は洋服より和服の方が宜しい
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
葡萄酒は宜しうございますか
Will you have some wine?―Will you buy wine?
葡萄酒は宜しい
I don't want wine.
どうでも宜しいようになさいまし
Do as you please!
用意は宜しいか
Are you ready?
宜しい
I am ready.
ご都合が宜しくば明日行くことにしようや
Let us go tomorrow if it is convenient to you―if it suits your convenience―if it suits you.
いつでもご都合の宜しい時に金をお返しなさい
You may pay me whenever convenient to yourself―at your own convenience―You may take your own time for payment.
間違いは間違いだがまあ宜しい
It is mistake, to be sure, but let it go!―let it pass!
明日は早く来るんだよ、宜しいか(わかったか)
You are to come early tomorrow, mind!―mark my words!―d'ye hear?

content:
よろしき〔宜しき〕
〈名〉Fitness; propriety

content.content: 宜しきを得る
to be fit―proper―right―just―well
処置宜しきを得
It is well managed―You have acted well―The measure is just.
経営宜しきを得
The business is well managed.
操縦宜しきを得
(機械なら)The machinery is well worked―(大砲なら)―The guns are well served.
方法宜しきを得
You proceed well―You go about it in the right way.
時機宜しきを得
It is well-timed―timely―opportune―seasonable.
語気宜しきを得る
to hit the tone
繁簡宜しきを得る
to be short and comprehensive
寛厳宜しきを得
It is neither too severe or too lenient―It is judicious.
寛厳宜しきに従って処分すべし
Let him be judiciously dealt with!
風雨その宜しきを得れば此植物はよく発育する
The plant grows well under favourable conditions.
寒暑宜しきを得
It is neither too hot nor too cold―The temperature is favourable.
選択宜しきを得
You have made a good choice.
賞罰宜しきを得
They are just in awarding rewards and punishments―Rewards and punishments are justly administered―Justice is satisfied.
緩急宜しきに従って処置すべし
Let measures be taken according to the urgency of the case―as the urgency of the case may demand.

content:
よろしく〔宜しく〕
〈副〉
1. Well; properly

content.content: よろしく取はからえ
Manage the matter as you think fit!―at your own discretion!
よろしく頼む
I leave it to your judgment.
なにぶんよろしくお願い申します
You will please exert yourself in my behalf―I leave my affair in your hands―(初対面の挨拶なら)―I hope we shall have a good time together.
子どもをよろしくお願い申します
I wish to place my boy under your care―I hope you will make something of him.
今後ともなにぶんよろしくお引立てを願います
Let me continue in your favour―I solicit a continuance of your favour―I solicit your further patronage.

content:
2. 
〈命令法〉

content.content: よろしく何々すべし
Let something be done―Something should be done―Something may be done!
各自よろしくその利益を図るべし
Let each man look to his own interests.
語学を学ばんとする者はよろしく助動詞を研究すべし
One who wishes to learn a language, should study the auxiliary verbs.
後はよろしく察すべし
The rest may be imagined.
ご尊父様へよろしく申し上げて下さい(宜しく御鳳声被下度候)
Present my compliments to your father―Give my respects to your father.
皆様によろしく
Give my best regards to everybody―Remember me kindly to them all.
よろしくご伝言を願います
Please give my regards to him―convey my best regards to him.
父がよろしくと申しました
My father presents his compliments.
兄がよろしくと申しました
My brother sends you his best regards―My brother begs to be remembered to you.
キイちゃんがよろしくってよ
Kitty sends you her love.
ご主人によろしくお礼を申し上げて下さい
Return your master my best thanks for the present!

content:
よろず〔万〕
〈名〉
1. (=一万)ten thousand
2. (=万事)all; everything:(=の) all

content.content: 百科全書は万の事を説明した辞書である
An encyclopedia gives information on all branches of knowledge.

content:
よろずや〔万屋〕
〈名〉(商人なら)a general dealer; a universal provider:(店なら)a general store; a jumble-shop:(人なら)a Jack of all trades:(学者なら)a pantologist

content.content: あの人は万屋で何でもできる
He can turn his hand to anything―He is a universal genius.

content:
よろずよ〔万代〕
〈名〉A myriad ages; all ages; eternity

content.content: 万世までも
to all ages―for ever
君万代までもましませ
O king, live for ever!

content:
よーろっぱ〔欧羅巴<ヨーロッパ>〕
〈固名〉Europe:(=の) European

content.content: 彼はヨーロッパを漫遊した
He has travelled in Europe.
その船は今頃ヨーロッパへ行っている
The ship is now in European waters.
ヨーロッパ人
a European
ヨーロッパ州
the Continent of Europe
ヨーロッパ大陸
the Continent

content:
よーろっぱ〔欧羅巴<ヨーロッパ>〕
〈固名〉Europe:(=の) European

content.content: 彼はヨーロッパを漫遊した
He has travelled in Europe.
その船は今頃ヨーロッパへ行っている
The ship is now in European waters.
ヨーロッパ人
a European
ヨーロッパ州
the Continent of Europe
ヨーロッパ大陸
the Continent

content:
よろめく
〈自動〉To stagger; to totter; to dodder; to reel

content.content: 酒に酔ってよろめく
A drunkard reels.
重荷を負ってよろめく
to stagger under a load
病人がよろめく
An invalid totters.
中風病みがよろめく
A paralytic dodders.

content:
ヨロヨロ
〈副〉Staggeringly; totteringly:(=する) to stagger; to totter; to reel

content.content: ヨロヨロ歩く
to stagger along―totter along―reel along
病人がヨロヨロと立ち上がった
The invalid tottered to his feet.
酔払いがヨロヨロと立ち上がった
The drunkard staggered to his feet.
ドンと突かれてヨロヨロする
to stagger under a blow―receive a staggering blow

content:
よろん〔輿論〕
〈名〉Public opinion; the popular voice; the common cry; the public feeling; the general feeling; consensus of opinion

content.content: この点については輿論は一致している
Public opinion is unanimous on this point.
輿論の一致
consensus of public opinion
この問題については輿論が分かれている
Public opinion is divided on this question.
この問題については輿論が確定した、輿論確定せず
The last word has been said―The last word has not yet been said―on the subject.
これが天下の輿論だ
This is a popular voice―a common cry.
普選は今や天下の輿論なり
Manhood suffrage is a popular voice―a common cry―The popular voice is for manhood suffrage―The common cry is for manhood suffrage―The cry is for manhood suffrage.
輿論は普選に傾いている
The general feeling leans towards manhood suffrage.
輿論に訴える
to appeal to public opinion
輿論に任せる
to leave to the public opinion to decide
輿論を指導する
to lead the public opinion
輿論に反対する
to defy public opinion
輿論に反対して実行した
I set public opinion at defiance and went my own way―I went my own way in defiance of public opinion.
輿論を探る
to fly a kite―find out which way the wind blows
輿論の制裁
the yoke of public opinion
輿論の制裁を受ける
to be tried at the bar of public opinion
そんな処置をしては輿論沸騰のおそれあり
The public will cry out against such a measure.

content:
よわ〔夜半〕
〈名〉Midnight

content.content: 夜半の月
a midnight moon

content:
よわい〔弱い〕
〈形〉Weak (woman); feeble (age); frail (constitution); infirm (old man); delicate (heart) pale (light); low (wind)

content.content: 女は弱い
Woman is weak.
女は男より弱い
Woman is weaker than man.
女だって皆々弱くはない
Women are not always weak.
弱い国
a weak power
弱い身体
a feeble body
身体が弱い
He has a weak constitution―a frail constitution―(女なら)―She has a delicate frame―She is delicate in health.
身体の弱い少年は学問にこりたがる
Boys of frail constitutions will fling themselves into books.
力が弱い
He has no strength―He is weak―feeble.
風が弱い
The wind is low.
火が弱い
The fire is low.
弱い地震
a slight shock
弱い熱
low heat
弱い酒
a weak wine
僕は酒が弱い
I am a poor drinker.
船に弱い
I am a poor sailor.
籤が弱い
I am unlucky at lottery.
気が弱い
to be faint-hearted―chicken-hearted―timid―timorous―nervous
意志が弱い
He has a weak will―He is weak-willed―He is a weak character.
足が弱い
I am a poor walker―a poor pedestrian.
胃が弱い
I have a weak digestion.
心臓の弱い人は過激な運動をしてはいかん
One who has a weak heart ought not to take violent exercise.
弱い月の明り
the pale light of the moon
日本出来の靴は弱い
Shoes of Japanese make do not wear well.
弱い奴だ
What a weakling!
弱きを助け強きをくじく
to fight for the weak against the strong
弱くなる、弱くする
to weaken―enfeeble
火酒に水を割って弱くする
to qualify spirits

content:
よわい〔齢〕
〈名〉
1. (=年齢)age; years

content.content: 齢傾く
to decline in one's years
齢人寿を全うし位人臣を極む
He died full of years and honours.

content: 2. (=する)(=仲間入りする)to associate with (men); to join (a party, etc.)

よわいものいじめ〔弱い者苛め〕
〈名〉Bullying:(=する) to bully (people)

content.content: あの人は弱い者いじめだ
He is a bully.

content:
よわき〔弱気〕
〈名〉A weak market; a bearish tone

content.content: 弱気連
the bears

content:
よわぎ〔弱気〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: よわき〔弱気〕

よわごし〔弱腰〕
〈形〉Weak in the knees; weak-kneed; wanting in firmness

content:
よわたり〔世渡り〕
〈名〉Life; living; livelihood; getting on in life:(=する) to walk through life; to get one's living; to gain one's livelihood; to get on in life

content.content: 世渡りの秘訣
the secret of getting on in life―the way to succeed in the world―how to rise in the world
世渡りの道
worldly wisdom―prudence
彼は世渡りが上手だ
He knows how to get on―He has worldly wisdom―He is prudent.
世渡りが下手だ
He has no worldly wisdom―He is imprudent.
正しい世渡りをする
to live on the square
不正な世渡りをする
to live on the cross
それは世渡りだからしかたがない
It is the part of prudence to do that.
主人の気に入るようにするのも世渡りというものだ
It is the part of prudence to try and please your employer.

content:
よわね〔弱音〕
〈名〉A complaint

content.content: 弱音を吹く
to complain―grumble―sing small
弱音なら一つ吹かない
Not a complaint ever escapes him.

content:
よわみ〔弱味〕
〈名〉One's weakness; a weak point; helplessness

content.content: 弱味に付け込む
to take advantage of one's weakness
相手の弱味に付け込むのは卑劣だ
It is mean to take advantage of one's helpless situation.
あれは人の弱味に付け込む卑劣な奴だ
He will take a mean advantage of you.
人の弱味を見る
to detect one's weak point―find the length of one's feet
弱味を見せる
to betray one's weakness
こちらに弱味があるからあまり強いことは言えない
“Those who live in glass houses should not throw stones.”

よわみそ〔弱味噌〕
〈名〉A weakling

content:
よわむし〔弱虫〕
〈名〉A weakling

content.content: 弱虫だなー
What a weakling!
弱虫の強がり
bravado

よわめる〔弱める〕
〈他動〉To weaken (the medicine); to enfeeble (the body, etc.)

よわよわしい〔弱々しい〕
〈形〉Delicate (frame); fragile (article); frail (constitution, etc.)

content:
よわりめ〔弱り目〕
〈名〉An evil day

content.content: 弱り目に祟り目
I am the sport of fortune―the sport of chance―I have had a chapter of accidents―an Iliad of woes.

content:
よわる〔弱る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=衰弱する)to weaken; to be enfeebled; to be reduced; to decline; to languish; to pine

content.content: 病人はだいぶ弱っている
The invalid is very weak―very feeble―in a very reduced state.
非常に弱っている
He is far gone.
随分弱っている
He is pretty well gone.
身体が弱る
to decline in health―break in health
彼は台湾から弱って帰って来た
He has returned from Formosa in declining health―in broken health.
病気で弱る
to languish under illness―to be prostrated by illness―pulled down by illness
寒い時は達者だが暑くなると弱る
I am very well in cold weather, but the heat of summer prostrates me.
熱で身体が弱った
The fever has pulled me down.
彼は長煩いで弱っている
A long illness has pulled him down―worn him down.
一日働いて弱った
I am knocked up with my day's work.
十時間働くと弱る
Ten hours' work knocks me up―beats me.
あまり働いて弱った
I am knocked up with overworking myself―I have run down from overwork.
スッカリ弱ってしまった
I am completely knocked up―completely done up―quite used up―dead beat.

content: 2. (=失望落胆する)to despair; to be dismayed; to be dejected; to be cast down; to be chap-fallen; to be crest-fallen

content.content: どうした、ひどく弱っているじゃないか
What is the matter with you? You look greatly dejected―You look the picture of dejection.
彼は失敗して弱っている
He is dejected at his failure―cast down by his failure.
負けて弱っている
He is chap-fallen at his defeat―crest-fallen at his defeat.
運が向かないで弱っている
He is down on his luck―down in the mouth.
細君に死なれてひどく弱っている
He is dreadfully cut up by the loss of his wife.
一人息子に死なれてひどく弱っている
The death of his only son has cut him up terribly.
弱ってしまった
I am in despair―I am in dismay―I am at a loss how to act―I am at my wits' end.

content: 3. (=困却する)to be perplexed; to be puzzled; to be nonplussed; to be at a loss how to act; to be at one's wits' end

content.content: あの男には弱ったね
I don't know what to do with him―I can do nothing with him.
お前には実に弱らされるね
You will be the death of me.
どうしてよいか弱ってしまった
I don't know what to do―I am at a loss how to act―I am perplexed―I am in a fix―in a tight place―in a tight box―in a cleft stick.
こいつぁ弱ったなー
Here is a go!―Here is a rum go!―What a go!
この金を取れば大罪、取らなけりゃ滅亡、弱ったなー
If I take the money, I shall commit a crime; If I don't, I shall be ruined. I am in a dilemma.
今日は便船が出ないと、そいつぁ弱ったなー
Steamer not sailing? What an awkward situation!
この問題には皆弱らされた
The question puzzled―floored―gravelled―everybody.
百方手を尽してもその甲斐無く弱り果てた、弱り切った
I am at my wits' end―driven to my wits' end―reduced to the last extremity.
親父に死なれて弱ってしまった
My father's death has driven me to my wits' end.
大事な金を取られて弱ってしまった
The loss of the much needed money has reduced me to my wits' end.

content:
よんどころない〔拠無い〕
〈形〉Necessary; inevitable; unavoidable; not to be avoided; not to be helped

content.content: よんどころ無い事情があって欠席致します
Unavoidable circumstances oblige me to absent myself.
よんどころ無いこととは言いながら残念なわけです
It is not the less to be regretted because it is not to be avoided.
それはよんどころ無い
It can not be helped―There is no help for it.

content:
よんどころなく〔拠無く〕
〈副〉Unavoidably; perforce; of necessity; (to be) under the necessity of (doing something); (to be) obliged, compelled, forced, constrained (to do something)

content.content: 彼はよんどころ無く働くのだ
He works of necessity―He is under the necessity of working.
ご用立てし金子ご返済無くばよんどころ無く訴えます
If you will not pay me, I shall be obliged to―compelled to―forced to―bring an action against you.
彼はあまり強情だからよんどころ無く最後の手段をとったのだ
He was so obstinate that I was forced to go to extremes―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His obstinacy forced me to go to extremes―His obstinacy drove me to extreme measures.
そういうわけだからよんどころ無くお断りするのです
Such being the case, I find myself under the necessity of refusing your request.

content:
ら〔等〕
〈接尾詞〉
1. A plural sign

content.content: 子ら
the children―the sons
子等は皆軍の
The sons are, one and all, away
庭に出で果てて
To guard their fatherland;
翁や一人
The gray-haired sire alone is left
山田守るらん
The woodland farm to tend.

content: 2. (=等{とう})and so forth; and the like; and all that; and others; and his set

content.content: 僕は田中等とは付合わない
I do not go with Tanaka and his set.

ら〔羅〕
〈名〉A thin kind of silk cloth; silk gauze

content:
らい〔来〕
〈接頭詞〉Coming; next

content.content: 来年
next year
来月
next month
来週
next week
来春
next spring―the coming spring

content:
らい〔来〕
〈接尾詞〉(=襲来)an invasion

content.content: 蒙古来
the Mongol invasion

content: 〈前置詞相当〉(=以来)since; these

content.content: 一昨年来ここに居る
I have been here since the year before last.
二三年来ここに居る
I have been here these two or three years.
痔は十年来の持病だ
I have been subject to piles these ten years.
二十年来の大雪だ
It is the heaviest snowfall we have had for twenty years.
三十年来の大嵐だ
It is the severest storm we have had for thirty years.

content:
らい〔雷〕
〈名〉Thunder

content.content: 雷が鳴る
It thunders―Thunder roars.
鼾声{かんせい}雷の如し
He snores loudly.
百雷の一時に落ちるが如き音
a sound as if of a hundred thunders

content:
らいい〔来意〕
〈名〉The object of one's visit or call

content.content: 来意を述べる
to state the object of one's call
早速来意を述べた
I came to the point at once.
ご来意は(?)
What is the object of your visit?―What is your pleasure?―Please come to the point!
彼に来意を尋ねた
I begged him to state the object of his visit―I asked him what he had called for.
主人に来意を告げた
I told the master of the house why I had called.

content:
らいう〔雷雨〕
〈名〉A thunderstorm

content.content: 雷雨あり
There was a thunderstorm.
雷雨に逢う
to be overtaken by a thunderstorm
雷雨に逢ったら大木の下に雨宿りするな
Do not take shelter under a tree in a thunderstorm.

らいか〔雷火〕
〈名〉Fire caused by lightning

content:
らいが〔来駕〕
〈名〉Your coming; your attendance; your presence; your company

content.content: 至急ご来駕を乞う
I request your immediate attendance―request your immediate presence.
御来駕被成下度奉懇願候
I beg you will favour me with your company―I request the pleasure of your company.
御夫人御同伴御来駕被下度候{ごふじんごどうはんでらいがくだされたくそうろう}
I request the pleasure of your company and that of Mrs.

content:
らいかい〔来会〕
〈名〉Attendance at a meeting:(=する) to attend a meeting; to be present at a meeting

content.content: 御来会被成下度奉懇願候
I request your presence at the meeting.
万障お繰合わせ御来会被下度候
I hope you will not fail to attend the meeting.
御夫人御同伴御来会被下度候
I request the pleasure of your company and that of Mrs. xxx.
御来会の有無御一報被下度候
Please let me know whether we may expect you or not.

content:
らいかいしゃ〔来会者〕
〈名〉An attendant:(総称すれば)attendance

content.content: 来会者は三百人の見積り
The attendance is calculated at 300.
多数の来会者があった
There was a large attendance.
来会者はたんと無かった
There was only a small attendance.
会長が来会者に挨拶をした
The president made a speech to welcome those present.

content:
らいかん〔来観〕
〈名〉A visit (to a show); inspection:(=する) to visit (a show); to inspect (an exhibition)

content.content: 来観者
a visitor―a spectator

content:
らいきゃく〔来客〕
〈名〉A guest; a visitor; a caller:(集合的に言えば)company(は一人にても数人にても)

content.content: 父は来客です
Father has company―Father is receiving company.
今晩は来客がある
I expect company this evening.
今日は来客の多い日であった
I have had many visitors today.

らいげき〔雷撃〕
〈名〉Torpedoing:(=する) to torpedo (a ship)

content:
らいげつ〔来月〕
〈名、副〉Next month:(日に伴えば)proximo(prox.―と略す)

content.content: 来月五日に
on the 5th prox
来月の今日立つ
I leave this day month.

らいこう〔来航〕
〈名〉A visit to these shores:(=する) to visit these shores

らいこう〔来貢〕
〈名〉Coming to pay tribute:(=する) to come to pay tribute

らいこう〔来寇〕
〈名〉An invasion (of Japan); an inroad (on the country); an irruption (into the country); an incursion (into the country); a raid (into the country); a descent (on the coast):(=する) to invade (Japan); to raid (a territory); to make a raid on (the country); to make an inroad on (the country); to descend upon (the coast)

らいし〔雷死〕
〈名〉Death by lightning:(=する) to be struck dead by lightning

content:
らいしゃ〔来車〕
〈名〉Your coming; your attendance; your presence; your company

content.content: 万障お繰合せ御来車を乞う
I hope you will not fail to come.
至急御来車を乞う
I request your immediate attendance.

content:
らいしゅう〔来襲〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: しゅうらい〔襲来〕

content:
らいしゅう〔来週〕
〈名、副〉Next week

content.content: 会は来週の日曜にある
The meeting will be held on Sunday week.
来週の今日帰る
I shall be back this day week.

らいじゅう〔雷獣〕
〈名〉A kind of marten

content:
らいじょう〔来状〕
〈名〉A letter received

content.content: 君に来状がある
There is a letter for you.
僕に来状は無いか
Is there no letter for me?
来状山の如し
Letters pour in from all quarters.

content:
らいしん〔来信〕
〈名〉A letter received

content.content: 国もとより来信ありたり
I have had a letter from home.

らいじん〔雷神〕
〈名〉The god of thunder; the Thunderer; Jupiter; Thor

らいしんし〔頼信紙〕
〈名〉A telegram form; a telegram blank

ライスカレー
〈名〉Curry and rice; curried rice

content:
らいせい〔来世〕
〈名〉The future life; the future existence; the future state; the next world; the other world; the world to come

content.content: 君は来世を信ずるか
Do you believe in the future life?
来世の幸福を図る
to consult one's spiritual welfare

content:
らいだ〔懶惰〕
〈形〉Idle; lazy; indolent; slothful; sluggish

content.content: 彼の懶惰は持って生まれた性分だから治らない
His idleness is bred in the bone.
懶惰者
an idler―a drone―a lazy-bones―a sluggard

content:
らいだん〔来談〕
〈名〉Coming to inquire:(=する) to come and inquire

content.content: ご来談あれ
Please inquire within.
本人来談
Apply in person.

content:
らいちゃく〔来着〕
〈名〉Arrival:(=する) to arrive

content.content: 氏は両三日中に来着のはず
He is expected here―due here―in a few days.

content:
らいちょう〔来朝〕
〈名〉Coming to Japan:(=する) to come to Japan; to visit Japan

content.content: 氏は今年中に来朝のはず
He is expected in Japan―due in Japan―in the course of the year.

らいちょう〔雷鳥〕
〈名〉The grouse; the ptarmigan

content:
らいでん〔来電〕
〈名〉A telegram (or cablegram) received

content.content: (云々の旨)巴里来電あり
A telegram has been received from Paris to the effect that...

らいどう〔来同〕
〈名〉Coming together:(=する) to come together

content:
らいどう〔雷同〕
〈名〉Blind following:(=する) to follow others blindly; to echo (others' views)

content.content: 定見無き者はとかく人の説に雷同する
People without settled convictions are apt to echo others' views.
付和雷同するなかれ
Do not follow others blindly!
雷同者
a blind follower

content:
らいねん〔来年〕
〈名、副〉Next year; the coming year

content.content: 来年の作
next year's crop
来年の今日帰る
I return this day twelvemonth.
この子は来年の春から学校へやります
The boy shall go to school next spring.
彼は来年の四月帰朝する
He returns from abroad next April―in April next.
来年のことを言うと鬼が笑う
Next year is the devil's joke―We know not what a year may bring forth.

content:
らいはる〔来春〕
〈名、副〉Next spring; the coming spring

content.content: この子は来春から学校へ出します
The boy shall go to school next spring.

content:
らいびょう〔癩病〕
〈名〉Leprosy; lepra

content.content: 癩病患者
a leper

content:
らいひん〔来賓〕
〈名〉A guest; a visitor

content.content: 来賓席
the visitors' seats
来賓競走
the visitors' race

らいふ〔雷斧〕
〈名〉A stone axe

らいふるじゅう〔ライフル銃〕
〈名〉A rifle

content:
らいほう〔来訪〕
〈名〉A visit; a call:(=する) to call on (one); to visit (one); to pay (one) a visit

content.content: 今日は珍しい人の来訪を受けた
I had a visit from an unexpected person today.
その人はご来訪の節ご同道下さい
Please bring the man with you when you call on me.

content:
らいほうしゃ〔来訪者〕
〈名〉A visitor; a caller

content.content: 病人は来訪者に面会を許されない
The invalid is not allowed to see visitors.
彼は来訪者を断っている
He denies himself to callers.
来訪者は断わられた
He was denied to callers.

content:
らいめい〔雷名〕
〈名〉A far-resounding name

content.content: 雷名を轟かす
to enjoy a wide fame
雷名天下に轟く
His name rings through the land―(よりも普通は第二構文)―The whole country rings with his name.
雷名世界に轟く
His name resounds through the world―The world resounds with his name―He enjoys a world-wide fame.
ご雷名はかねて承っております
I have long known you by fame.

content:
らいめい〔雷鳴〕
〈名〉Thunder; a thunderclap; a peal of thunder

content.content: 雷鳴あり
It thundered.
烈しい雷鳴があった
There was a severe thunder―a terrible peal of thunder―a terrific thunderclap.

content:
らいゆう〔来遊〕
〈名〉A visit to Japan:(=する) to visit, pay a visit to (Japan)

content.content: あの人は五六度来遊している
He has paid five or six visits to Japan.
外人の来遊するもの増加しつつあり
Foreign visitors to Japan are increasing in number.
物価騰貴のため来遊する外人が少なくなった
Owing to the appreciation of commodities, fewer foreigners now visit Japan than formerly.
来遊外人
a foreign visitor―a foreign tourist

らいよけ〔雷除け〕
〈名〉A lightning-rod; a lightning-conductor

content:
らいらく〔磊落〕
〈形〉Liberal; licentious; free and easy; off-hand; Bohemian

content.content: 彼は非常に磊落だ
He is an ultra-biberal―an out-and-out Bohemian.
磊落はふうをしている
He has a free and easy air―an off-hand manner.
資性磊落(些事に拘泥せず)
Of a liberal disposition, he is careless about trifles.
先生は磊落で文法に拘泥しない
He is licentious about grammar.
こんな磊落なふうをして伺ってはすみませんが
I must apologize for calling on you in this Bohemian dress.

content.content: 万障御繰合わせ御来臨被下度候
I hope you will not fail to favour me with your company.
御夫人御同伴御来臨被下度候
I request the pleasure of your company and that of Mrs. xxx.

content:
らいれき〔来歴〕
〈名〉A history; a story; a tale:(人のなら)one's past life; one's career; one's antecedents

content.content: あれは来歴のある学校だ
The school has a history.
これには故事来歴がある
And thereby hangs a tale.
熟語の故事来歴を糺す
to inquire into the origin and history of a phrase
英語には故事来歴が多い
The English language is rich with the spoils of time.
あの人は面白い来歴のある人だ
His is a romantic career.
あの人は来歴が無ければもっと出世ができるのだが
But for his antecedents, he might rise higher.

content:
らく〔楽〕
〈名〉(苦の無い楽)ease; comfort:(苦に対する楽)pleasure:(苦の無くなった楽)relief:(=な) easy; comfortable:(=に) comfortably; in comfort:(なに不自由無く)at one's ease

content.content: 楽に暮らす
to live in comfort―(は衣食の不自由無きこと、不如意なこと無くの意味なら)―live at one's ease
独身なら月百円で楽に暮らせる
A bachelor can live in comfort on 100 yen a month.
彼は楽に暮らしている
He is in easy circumstances―in comfortable circumstances.
楽をする
to take one's ease―live at one's ease―live a life of ease
彼は隠居をして楽をしている
He has retired from active life, and lives at his case.
彼は試験を済まして楽をしている
He is taking his case after his examination.
老いて楽をする
to have an age of ease
若い時に働けば老いて楽をする
A youth of industry gives one an age of ease.
両親は年をとっているから楽をさせてやりたい
As my parents are advanced in years, I wish to make them comfortable―lead them an easy life of it.
死際を楽にしてやりたい
I wish to ease their declining years―smoothe their paths to the grave.
どうぞお楽に願います
Please make yourself comfortable!―make yourself at home!
この薬を召上がると楽になります
This medicine will relieve you of pain―give you relief.
あのお薬を戴いてたいそう楽になりました
The medicine has given me much relief―greatly relieved me (of my pain).
いまにこの子が大きくなると私は楽な身になります
The boy will grow up to make me a man of ease―to be the staff of my declining years.
彼は職を辞して楽な身になった
He has resigned his post, and is now a man of ease―a man of leisure.
軍備制限が実施になったら人民の負担が楽になる
If the armament-limitation goes into operation, the people's burden will ease off.
楽あれば苦あり、楽は苦の種、苦は楽の種
No pleasure without pain―Pleasure is bought at the price of pain.
なにもせずに遊んでいるのは楽なように見えてかえって苦しいものだ
To be doing nothing is not a pleasure, as it seems to be, but a positive pain.

content: 〈形〉(=容易な)easy (task); light (work):(=に) easily; with ease

content.content: 楽な仕事
an easy task―a soft job
楽な仕事はあるものじゃない
It is hard to find a soft job.
人数が多ければ仕事は楽
“Many hands make light work.”
この仕事はなかなか楽じゃない
It is no easy task.
この役はなかなか楽じゃない
It is no sinecure.
はたで見るほど楽じゃない
It is not so easy as it seems.
仕事がだんだん楽になる
My work is getting easy to me―I am getting used to my work.
試験は存外楽だった
The examination was easier than I had expected.
英語を楽に話してみたい
I wish I could speak English with case―with fluency.
彼は楽に英語を話す
He speaks English with ease―He is a ready speaker of English.
楽に英文を書く
He writes English with ease―He is a ready writer of English.
楽に儲ける
to make an easy gain
楽に成功する
to succeed with ease―make an easy success of it
楽な旅をする
to travel by easy stages
そこから東京へ楽に往復ができる
The place is within easy distance of Tokyo.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 書くのは楽だ
Writing comes natural to me.
学校の課業が楽になった
I have my lessons well in hand.
教授法が好いと生徒が楽だ
If the teacher teaches with tact, the students learn without effort.
この教科書を使うと先生が楽だ
The book saves the teacher much trouble.
この難関を切り抜けると後は楽だ
Once over this barrier, we shall be in smooth water.
僕は若い時は一日に十五里くらいは楽に歩いた
When I was young, I made nothing of doing my fifteen ri a day.
彼は日に十時間くらい楽に働く
He makes nothing of working ten hours a day.
彼はビール一ダースくらいは楽に平げる
He will make short work of a dozen bottles of beer.
彼は競走に楽に勝った
He won the race hands down―won at a canter―walked over his course.

content.content: ラクダを砂漠の船と言う

ラクダは幾日も幾日も飲み食いせずにおれるというのは事実でない
It is not true that the camel can go for days without eating or drinking.

単峯ラクダ

content:
らくたん〔落胆〕
〈名〉Discouragement; dejection; despondency; dismay; despair:(=する) to be discouraged; to be disheartened; to be dejected; to be cast down; to be down-hearted; to be dismayed; to despond; to lose heart

content.content: 彼は一度の失敗に落胆して再挙の勇気が無かった
A single failure discouraged him from trying again.
一度の失敗くらいに落胆するものでない
One should not be disheartened by a single failure.
彼は一人息子を無くしてひどく落胆している
He is disconsolate―broken-hearted―dreadfully cut up―over the death of his only son.
山ほどの困難を見て落胆した
I lost heart―My heart failed me―My heart died within me―My heart sank within me―at the sight of a mountain of difficulties.
これしきのことに落胆するものではない
You should not lose heart over such trifles.
落胆するな
Never despair!―Keep a good heart!―Be of good heart!―Cheer up!―Never say die!

content:

content.content: 事件が落着した

事件の落着
the settlement of the matter―the termination of the matter
事件が速かに落着すればよい
I wish the matter would be brought to a speedy conclusion.
事件が首尾好く落着した

裁判がまだ落着しない

裁判の落着するまでは被告に面会を許さぬ
The prisoner is not allowed to see visitors pending the trial.

content:
らしい
〈形〉Like; likely; probable:(副詞に訳せば)probably; apparently; evidently; in all likelihood; in all probability; to all appearance:(動詞に訳せば)to seem; to appear; to look:(接続詞に訳せば)as if

content.content: 彼は成功するらしい
It is likely that he will succeed―he is likely to succeed.
失敗するらしい
It is probable that the will fail―He will probably fail.
評判が本当らしい
The report seems to be true―The report is evidently true.
評判が嘘らしい
The rumour appears to be false―The rumour is apparently false.
評判で察すると偉い人らしい
Judging from reports, he seems to be a great man.
彼はどう見ても正直らしい
He is honest to all appearance.
彼はどう見ても失敗らしい
He will fail in all likelihood―in a probability.
これは英語らしい
This is something like English.
雨らしいぜ
It looks like rain.
どうもそうらしい
It seems to be so―It is evidently so.
人間らしい口を利く
He talks like a man―as if he were a man.
主人らしい人が出て来た
A man, apparently the master of the house, appeared.
彼は紳士らしい
He looks like a gentleman―He is gentlemanly.
紳士らしい行為だ
It is gentlemanly conduct.
紳士なら紳士らしくして貰いたい
If you are a gentleman, you must show yourself such.
男らしい振る舞い
manly behaviour
男らしく振る舞う
to behave manfully―like a man

a manly boy
女らしい優しさ
womanly tenderness

らち〔埒〕

content.content: 埒を明ける
to settle the matter
なんとか埒を明けて貰いたい
I wish to have the matter settled―I wish to have the matter brought to some settlement.
埒を明けてやる
I will bring the matter to as satisfactory settlement.
埒が明く
The matter can be settled―The matter lends itself to arrangement.

content.content: 彼は呑気で物事を楽観する

He is an optimist―He takes an optimistic view of things―He takes a rose-coloured view of things―He looks on the bright side of thing―He sees things through rose-coloured spectacles―He takes things easy.
彼は結果については楽観している
He is optimistic about the result―sanguine of the result.
当局者は時局を楽観している
The authorities take an optimistic view or the situation.
彼は成功を楽観している
He is sanguine of success.
(そう悲観せずに)ちと楽観し給え
Let us hope for the best!―Be of good heart!―Never say die!
前途の形勢容易に楽観を許さざるものあり
The prospects are rather gloomy―The prospects are not very bright―The outlook is not very reassuring.
楽観性
a sanguine nature
楽観説
an optimistic view
